Reviews.Title: “An Italian Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Ali B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for four days as a graduation celebration. We are a couple in our 20's and have travelled many places across the world but I really do mean it when I say that this was one of the best hotels we have stayed at. The hotel inside was chic and lovely and throughout our entire stay it was always kept clean. The room was perfect for us and as we spent most of our time sightseeing, it was great having a cosy bed to sleep in at night (especially important as I sometimes suffer with backache). We decided to pay for the all you can eat breakfast buffet and at 7 euros per person it was excellent value. The breakfast selection was fantastic and their cappacino's heavenly. It is a great idea to have breakfast there before you start your day and it gave us the opportunity to go over our plans in the morning. The location of the hotel is wonderful. Trastevere is just outside the centre and you can get a tram from outside the hotel into the city centre. The hotel was able to give us a map which showed us where the tram stopped and how to get to the various sights which was only a very short walk away. However be sure to visit the square of Trastevere as it is lovely place and the restaurants around the area are not only fantastic but also a little cheaper than the city centre. There is also a lovely Basilica in the centre which is worth visiting. One of the main attractions to this hotel was the friendliness of the staff. They were all so polite and nothing ever seemed to be a problem. Splendora on reception was lovely - always so kind to us despite us frequently losing the map or asking for advice. The staff had some of the best tips of where to go in Rome and how to get there. Another delight of this hotel is the roof garden. Although the weather was a little cold at night we still enjoyed a bottle of wine whilst sitting on the roof top, and it was lovely overlooking Rome at night. You may have to wrap up weather dependent but it is worth it. The bar staff were very helpful and ensured we were taken care of. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Porta Portese apartment is great for families”
Reviews.Author: debbythec
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the apartment owned by the Trilussa Palace called the Porta Portese. It was perfect for our family (2 daughters ages 12 and 14). It is always hard to find a room to accomodate all 4 of us and this was perfect. It is located in an apartment building across the street from the hotel and is full of Romans. We could still have breakfast at the hotel and they were great at helping us find restaurants and tours but then we could go back to our apartment and have space to relax. There was a great little kitchen with a wonderful capuccino machine, and a beautiful little balcony and 2 bedrooms with a 2 beds in one room and a queen size in the other. Also, if you are there on Sunday go to the Porta Portese market. It has everything you could imagine and is literally at the front door of the apartment!

Reviews.Title: “Good People!!”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trilussa hotel from 4/7 to 4/14 and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay with them. The room was small but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was an adventure as many people have mentioned before. NOTE: They have multiple outlets throughout the room but there is one in the bathroom that can fit a US prong and can charge electronic devices at the US voltage. You can charge your laptops in the room but things like cell phones or curling irons are best done in the bathroom. The hotel has adapters they can lend to you for your labtops but consider walking with a CONVERTER if you have multiple things you would like to charge at the same time (i.e. I-Pods, cameras, cell phones, and etc). The staff was excellent! Very helpful and friendly throughout our stay. God only knows how lost we would have been if they did not help us out!! Location is great -- it's near a tram stop that can take you to the city center where you can tour and shop. The only complaint I would have is that our room was cold. Rome was rather cold and rainy when we went and having our room be 68 F to 69 F just didn't cut it. I'm not sure what was the issue with turning up the heat a bit. I would and intend to stay there again when I return to Rome and I would recommend this to others. I would actually give them a score of 4.5 but trip advisor doesn't allow you to put in half scores.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RickDJ
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay at Trilussa with our children (12 and 8). Really friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms and very comfortable beds. Our children shared a sofa bed which is normal for family rooms, but even that was comfortable. Hotel location is out of the centre, but tram right outside which gets into the centre very quickly, and only 2 stops to the heart of Trastevere eateries and bars. Good chinese restaurant next door, if too weary to make it any further! Location easy to get a tram to Trastevere Station (2 stops), then a train to Fiumicino airport (5 stops). Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Trilussa Hotel and frankly I would not stay anywhere else in Rome. The hotel is nice, but the service is fantastic. Max and others at the hotel made our stay very comfortable, they solved all of our needs and even gave my youngest daughter a birthday present while we were there on her 16th birthday. When we did not want to go back out to a restaurant for dinner, they handled ordering pizza, which was superb, and served the pizzas to us as though we were at a restaurant. They assisted us with finding our way around Rome (our first time there). The bartender provided us with the typical apetizers but also cut fresh fruit for us as well. These are just a few examples of the friendliness and service we had. We did not partake in the Spa, but it looked really nice. The foot massage probably would have been the thing to get. As I mentioned, there is a bar on site and there is a garden on top of the building that has a bar as well (check for when the roof bar is open). Also, they provide a free breakfast that included scrambled eggs, bacon, meats, cheeses, pastries, cakes, fresh fruit, toast and breads, juices, and coffees. Some key things to note, there is a tobacco shop next to the hotel where you can buy tram/bus tickets. The hotel has an information sheet that shows you how to get to key attractions. The Tram stop is right in front of the tobacco shop. We always used the IP gas station sign to flag where we needed to get off coming back. The Tram takes you to what is called Area Sacra which is not far from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Grab one of their cards from the front desk that has the address on it because not all of the taxi's know where it is at. The hotel offers different types of pillows and has memory foam mattresses in some of the rooms. This was helpful for my wife who has a bad back. But the key thing for us is that when we go back to Rome, we will stay at the Trilussa Palace.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Nancy P
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome, and I could never have picked a more perfect place to stay. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the reception staff and the bartender. Excellent room housekeeping and breakfast room staff. My room was much more than I had expected and the balacony overlooking the tree lined street was great. The location afforded me the opportunity to venture out by myself and feel safe. As a first time single traveler to Rome, I was treated more like family than a guest. The transportation was very accessible and very affordable. I cannot say enough positive comments about the hotel, and would highly recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Rome as your first choice of a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!! HOTEL MARAVILLOSO!!”
Reviews.Author: gonrod
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The rooms were perfect, the breakfast was delicious and the service was great. We had a small connection problem with the WiFi and they switched our rooms in an instant. Right across from the train that takes you downtown... Couldn't have asked for a better place in Rome. Este hotel fue maravilloso. Los cuartos eran muy cómodos, el desayuno delicioso y el servicio excelente. Tuvimos un pequeño problema de conexión con el WiFi y nos cambiaron de cuarto de inmediato. Está al frente del tren que te lleva al centro... No podríamos haber pedido un mejor lugar en Roma.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD BOOK IT!!”
Reviews.Author: 123-clareyb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on here. It was great. I have to agree totally with other reviews which state how friendly and helpful the staff were, especially at reception. It is true that the staff will tell you how to get to places, which restaurants to eat in no matter what your budget and they even printed off an email for me. As another reviewee said you can take the train to Trastevere station from the airport and then get the tram up the road to the hotel so no need to take the main train to the centre of Rome or get a taxi. The tram stop is right outside the hotel and this takes you into the centre of Rome too and it's really cheap. The hotel is located in Trastevere which is a really nice area in which to eat and drink (not touristy) so it's really handy when you have finished your day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rome Base!”
Reviews.Author: Jandmreviews
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location, clean rooms, staff very friendly and helpful, would stay here again! Trastevere is a great place for food and drink in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay at Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: coolscotabroad
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome - won't be the last. 4 days - the weather was just perfect for sightseeing and shopping, not sure why many people were dressed in jumpers, jeans and bodywarmers! I'd read the reviews on Trip Advisor and wasn't disappointed. When I booked only the ground floor economy rooms were available - I was delighted when I arrived and we'd been upgraded. The room was ok size wise. The decor (inc. darkened curtains, bedding, lighting etc) & facilities (e.g. aircon, shower, mini bar, pillow menus) were just perfect for our cosy, romantic stay. Nothing I'd need to change although tea/ coffee facilities might have been useful. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble e.g. advice on how to get the most out of the tourism aspect, transport. Definately go for the breakfast at the hotel - only 7 euros pp (probably the cheapest you'll find but also really good choice / quality). You'll probably find you're in the centre of Rome for lunch but I'd definately recommend coming back the area around the hotel for dinner as this was definately where we got the best food and service (city centre was average to good and you paid more - not unexpected). The hotel recommended restaurants within walking distance - my favourites were Le Fate, Alle Fratte Di Trastevere and the one next door to this (sorry didn't get name). NB the hotel doesn't provide dinner or lunch menus. Do however make sure you grab a drink (or several) on the hotel's roof terrace - it is really lovely with lovely views. We booked treatments (reflexology and massage) at the Spa with Helene - highly recommend, especially if you are doing the tourist walks! Spa' looks' gorgeous but this must be such an under used asset of the hotel - in my opinion. It can only be used if booked privately which for only the 2 of us would be too expensive! If there were a group of you then it would be very worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jckgraham
Reviews.Content: Extremely good service, Splendora and Paulo especially. Very clean and comfortable rooms and tram stop right outside to take you into Rome centre. Plenty of restaurants and bars just 10 -15 min walk or get a pass and hop on the tram for a couple of stops. If you want to know anything just ask Splendora or Carmen nothing is too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie F
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 5 different hotels during our recent tour of Italy (March 2012), and this was, by far, the best hotel. The staff is very friendly and so helpful. They went out of their way to suggest restaurants, tram stops, and answered every question we had with a smile. We are early risers, and several mornings arrived for breakfast a bit early. No problem. They allowed us to get coffee and rolls while they finished cooking for the buffet. The breakfast buffet was very good too. The room was sizable for Rome, and the bed was most certainly a memory foam. Again, the most comfortable of all of the hotels in which we stayed. I would highly recommend this hotel for comfort, friendliness, and a quiet night's sleep. A very good value.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy C
Reviews.Content: my friend and I stayed in this hotel on the 23th to the 26 th of march 2011 we were greeted by spandora (not sure if thats the right spelling)who has the nicest smile in the world from the moment we arrived we were made feel like friends not guests the room was great and the breakfast was the best we have ever had . be sure to ask francisco for the coffee as he is the king of coffee. we went to L'ORANGE for dinner which is only down a small bit from the hotel which has the best pasta dishes in rome be sure to go there. the tram 8 and bus 3 was right across from the hotel which was great. a word of warning do not go to the china garden next door to the hotel for food we went there on the sunday night as we were tired and L'orange was closed we couldnt eat the food as it was inedible when we complained they just laughed anyway our trip was fantastic and if anybody is lucky enough to go to rome they should stay at this wonderful hotel as it will make their holiday even better x judy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, and Gorgeous Spa”
Reviews.Author: andan24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trilussa Palace Hotel in February 2012 because all the reviews I read about the various hotels in Rome, this one seemed to have the best prices for being a nice hotel in a great location. What I didn't know when I was booking this hotel is that they apparently have a brand new spa (called Moon Spa) that just opened at the beginning of the month. We were traveling with one other family and wanted to figure out something to do for the kids to have fun together while we can relax with the other parents and all have a good time. Once we saw the spa we immediately knew this would be perfect to be able to supervise the kids while we sat back, relaxed, and even joined in on the fun every once in a while ourselves. So when we first walked into the spa, you see a huge jacuzzi that's almost as big as a pool (and the pool/jacuzzi has lounge beds BUILT IN to the seats) and for on the wall above the pool/jacuzzi you can select different music videos to play on the speakers and the image projects onto the wall which the kids loved because there is a built in iPad with a selection of different music videos and if you have an iPhone, you can dock your phone to play your own music which the kids had a blast with. On that same wall if you don't want the image to show, you can also choose to have water streaming down the wall like a waterfall built into the wall. I suppose this is for a more romantic setting which we didn't get to take advantage of on this trip, but we will be sure to for the next trip. There is also a steam room where you can also customize the music and lighting inside there as well. Outside of the steam room there are lounge chairs where we were able to relax and talk while the kids were playing in the pool/jacuzzi and the staff even put a chilled bottle of champagne on ice for us. We couldn't believe how modern and accommodating the spa and the staff was. The best part about this whole experience is you make private reservations so the entire spa is yours for as long as you want the reservation to be. The beautiful spa made an already beautiful hotel even better. The staff was really helpful and was always eager to help with anything we asked. I would recommend this hotel to any person traveling to Rome, and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Jade W
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my wife's 40th birthday weekend, we arrived on the Friday night to be welcomed by Max on reception, after checking in we were surprised by the arrival of a complimentary bottle of champagne and nibbles, an excellent touch to start the weekend off. The breakfast was a buffet but great value which set you up for the day ahead of site seeing in Rome, the rooms were excellent, very clean and a good size the bathroom was very clean and no signs of ageing. Te hotel is only an 8 minute tram ride into the centre of Rome and 2 minutes from the area of Trasteverre which has good bars an resteraunts an ideal locationEvery member of staff were as helpful and friendly as they could be from the moment we arrived to the moment we left, a special mention has to go to all the reception and bar staff who helped make this short break a special weekend for a special birthday, a big thank you to all at this hotel, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: pepin2412
Reviews.Content: When we arrived from a long travel, tired, late a night, we were welcomed very plesantly, hassle free check-in and were taken to our family room rapidly. We stayed 4 nights. Breakfast was included and excelent. A large buffet with lots to choose from. The room was not very big with four, two adults. two children, but suited us well. Very stylish, Itialian Hotel with a lot of marble. Excellent service and very friendly helpfull people. Hotel is well positioned to do your city tours. Either you walk (15 min) or take the tram into the city centre. Close by is the restaurant area, with lots of nice restaurants to choose from. We definitly reccomend this Hotel. Good value for money, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Trilussa!”
Reviews.Author: Calif-Vacationers
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent! We arrived in the morning to store our luggage before checkin, instead they let us checkin early at 9 am. After 19 hours travel time, a shower and a change of clorhes got us off to a great start. The deluxe rooms are very spacious for a European standards, modern and clean with balconies. The roof garden offers a great view. The tram is across the street and is 10 minutes to Campo Fiore. The hotel breakfast is included with a wide selection to please everyone and available from early to late morning. The staff recommended The L'Orange Restaurant a block away that serves an excellent dinner reasonably priced. The people at the hotel go above and beyond to be helpful and friendly. They are the best that we have met in our many years of travel. Splendora, Max, and Mara were especially wonderful! I would come back to this hotel just to see them again.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate clean hotel with extremely friendly, efficient and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: sherman21
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel from lovely quiet room wirh balcony to breakfast to overall service. You can catch the airport train and get off at Trasevere stop and then take the tram just 2 stops to hotel which is located just across from the tram stop - all very easy and efficient. We generally walked to the centre or just hop on a tram and you're there in 5 minutes or less. We also liked to socialise in the Trasevere area again walking distance - just located before the bridge to city centre - it's full of bars, restaurants, shops, St Maria plaza and so much preferred it to the very crowded centre. Rome is easy to get around and the hotel staff give you detailed information when you arrive so you'll have no trouble finding all the sights. We also just found guide tours when we arrived for example to the Vatican, Colesseum, etc and this also worked out well as you avoid all the queuing when you book like this. So all in all this hotel worked out very well for us. Oh just to mention would not recommend the Chinese restaurant next door to the hotel - very slap dash service and cold food. Couple from Ireland - Feb 2012

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome........Don't listen to everything you are told ;)”
Reviews.Author: tmac_1975
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Rome, stayed at this beautiful little hotel and WOW, what a welcome! Shown to our room which was really clean and welcoming, then popped straight to the hotel bar and got snacks non stop to the point where we had to ask for the guys to stop feeding us. The food was fantastic, full buffet choices for breakfast and great coffee all day long. The staff told us all the ways to travel bit advised the main attractions were too far, however if your up for plenty of walking its possible. Overall great hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Rugby Lads in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Mel7mm
Reviews.Content: 6 guys (5 over 70) stayed here 3 nights for the Italia v England Rugby. Arrived late greeted by the ever efficient and helpful Mana and Max - we were all in our Rooms within 15 minutes - rapid, then a good pasta Supper (8 Euros each) 100 yards away as suggested, by Mana! Rooms (all Classic Twins) very comfortable and Bathrooms with very sophisticated Showers. (No Bath tub, but there are seats in the Shower) Thanks also to Adrian and Paulo, ever attentive on our (usually late) visits to the Bar! Overall excellent little hotel, very fair price, convenient location. Tram outside the door takes you to Argentina in about 10-12 minutes and you can walk most anywhere quite quickly from there.

Reviews.Title: “60th Birthday trip to Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: eawdooley
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay in Rome, made all the more special by our stay at the Trilussa Palace. It started before we left London when I emailed the hotel with a request and received an immediately response from Mana Radofa from reception. I requested a surprise cake for my wife, when we checked in Mana was on duty and made sure that the cake was not mentioned. The surprise was so good that the next day when room service knocked on the door, my wife tried to turn them away as we did not order room service. We also chose a restaurant in advance, again emailed Mana who spoke to the restaurant on my behalf and confirmed the booking. When we went out Mana and Silvia took great care and as much time as we needed to make sure we did not get lost. The room was a great size. The breakfast was very good, great choice. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, go and have a great stay, the hotel is on top of great transport links, great base for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely relaxing”
Reviews.Author: francesca s
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Trilussa Hotel for a romantic weekend, and it has been perfect. The service is excellent. The staff is always very friendly, polite and very helpful. The room was cleaned twice a day, wood flooring, balcony, Sky and memory foam matress. The SPA experience was amazing, as you have private use of it and it's very very very nice, clean and relaxing. Plus on our arrival at the SPA, we found a prosecco bottle, juice, water, a fruit platter and snacks. The massage experience was also superb. Plus the location is good as well, as it is only 10 minutes walk from the centre of Trastevere area, renowed for its nice restaurant and nightlife and opposite the famous Sunday market of Portaportese. We would definitely recommend it, it has been a very relaxing and regenerating experience. We'll with no doubt go there again.

Reviews.Title: “4* in Trastevere, Great Expreince”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: We booked it for 120$ per night, no breakfast, and we got upgraded to classic room (from economy - ground floor). Small room but very well organized, small shower but a one-of-a-kind system that includes turkish bath function, radio, jet streams and more. Staff were wonderful, the Sunday flee market is across the street as well as a tram stop and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay! The staff truly cares that you have the stay while you're in their hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fweezin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, elegant, safe. The staff is very eager to please. They speak English, Italian, French and more. Breakfast is served from 6-10a and has a wide assortment of Danish, eggs, cheeses, meats and more. The roof top garden is beautiful for breakfast or an evening view.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality/price/location at Hotel Trilussa!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerfr0mH0lland
Reviews.Content: As our family arrived far too early for check-in time, we were offered to take an apartment instead. After having viewed it, it was an easy choice: 2 bedrooms, kitchen, large dining table, 2 bathrooms, a beautiful view over Rome and still being able to make use of the hotel's facilities (50 metres from hotel's entrance).Matrasses of very good quality, apartment well cleaned every day, a (for Mediterrenean standards), extensive breakfast buffet (breakfast room not very cosy, but that's cultural) and very friendly, helpful people at the reception desk (who even remember your name!). Bus (nbr 3) and tram (nbr 9) stop in front of hotel (1 EUR when you buy ticket at hotel, even cheaper when bought at "tabacci" and is valid for 75 min, so it will get you anywhere in town). When you've no problem with walking, it takes you 40 min to get downtown. Hotel is located in Trastevere neighbourhood, where you'll find tons of restaurants, some supermarkets and local shops. Hotel will call for taxi and it will be there within 5 min. Don't forget to visit Ostia Antigua (1 EUR from hotel to Ostia (bus/train; approx. 50 min) or Via Appia (busses or taxi; oldest "highway" in the world; rent bikes at little cafe over there). Make reservations for Vatican museums, Colosseum and Villa Borghese on-line; it will save you hours from waiting or even "sold out" for little extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: edistotime
Reviews.Content: On a business trip in late 2011, I stayed at Trilussa Palace for several days, including over the weekend. The hotel is very clean, comfortable, conveniently located, and the staff was very helpful in providing suggestions for tours and dining. Max and Splendora at the front desk were especially delightful and helpful to me, as I attempted to carve out ways to enjoy Rome while traveling by myself on business. I will definitely plan to stay there on my next trip, and certainly hope to bring my husband and really explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookndales
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location: a block away from a cooking school, close to the residential area, and the all the Roman attractions are a 20 minute walk. The restaurants are less crowded, and more locals dine there so a better experience. There is a grocery store close to. On every Sunday is a huge market; buy all your souvenirs there. A legitimate bank across the street. Save some energy and buy a week bus pass only 16 euros. What makes this hotel truly outstanding was the hotel staff, very accommodating. I left the room at different times, and the front desk ensured the room was cleaned around our schedule. I also liked NOT being charged on everything, room safe was included, wifi was included. I was travelling with two children. The staff spoke to them as they were guests, and I felt safe leaving my 14 and 10 year old in the hotel room for a few hours. Good breakfeast, took us well into the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Vacation in Italy”
Reviews.Author: sandy f
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Hotel gave us two rooms with a private hallway so the kids could have their own room. Ideal for families or large parties. Much better than adjoining rooms. Staff at the desk was so gracious and helpful. The hotel is in more of a residential area, rather than in the heart of Rome. All sights are about a 10 minute trolley or bus ride away. Both stop right infront of the hotel. The hotel had a wonderful New Year's party for eveyone on the roof top garden. We had a panoramic veiw of the fireworks over Rome. They invited us to another party New Year's Day, but we were leaving for the U.S. The trastevere section has some great restaruants and there is a Tourist Informatin (TI) booth in the are where you can buy a Roma Pass and get helpful information. It is less crowded than the ones in the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: sally700
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for more than a week on our first trip to Italy. Staying at this little jewel of a hotel made our experience one of our lifetime best travel memories. The staff is friendly, genuinely concerned that you enjoy your stay, and go out of their way to be helpful. They are fluent in English, and knowledgeable about transportation routes. We never heard sound from any other room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom shower, small and high tech, was a unique experience for us - in a good way. Breakfast was the best buffet we've experienced at a hotel and the staff were happy to make and bring fresh cappuccino. The hotel's location is perfect both for transportation to the rest of the city and relaxed strolling and exploration of the delightful authentic neighborhood of small shops and restaurants. We hope to be able to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Genie B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled to Italy three times and stayed in many hotels in various cities. This is the best so far for service. The staff are welcoming and helpful at all times. While all of the staff are fantastic, I must make special mention of Splendora. She (as did many others) went out of her way to make us feel welcome and help us with the many details of making a visit to Rome to special. They will all help you find your way easily around the transit system which makes a large city very manageable. They also helped us with train schedules for day excursions out of the city. If you are concerned about your language skills, don't be. Most of the staff speaks better English than many of my American students. The Trastavere neighborhood is charming and certainly adds to the positives of the hotel. The rooms are clean and lovely and the bathroom is much more than we expected in a European hotel at this price level (wonderful shower, plenty of hot water and space). Comfortable beds, a great breakfast to get you started on your busy day and delicious cappuccino. I could ask for nothing more. Except more time in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely trilussa hotel,highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: jamesccc
Reviews.Content: Our first time in rome. I must say this hotel is absolutey fantastic! The staff are wondeful, the room was warm, full sky tv, very big bed, bathroom was clean and the breakfast buffet is fantastic. If i had one negative i would say the cost for the spa is VERY expensive and tea/coffee supplied in the room would be nice.! Bar staff are very friendly and I will recommend this to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Best value for you money”
Reviews.Author: DuvalFinland
Reviews.Content: The private spa was excellent and treatments professional. Lobby service was very friendly. MOI! Splendora. Room are clean and cozy. All the main attraction are in walking distance and Trastevere restaurants are quite near.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa hotel for World Wide Forum”
Reviews.Author: ejlander
Reviews.Content: I went to the WorldWide Forum Conference in Rome. I did not stay at Trilussa but the conference was there. The meeting rooms, lobby and dining area were beautiful. The food was fantastic! And the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “tram no.8”
Reviews.Author: ooux
Reviews.Content: I was there for conference, hotel very easy to locate by tram no. 8, single room was very good. Nice bedding and chioces of pillow. Reception very helpful espacialy silvia!

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: broomtrainer
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Trilussa are excellent. They truly care about providing the best possible service. It seems like a family-run business, people are that attentive. The location is near perfect: two tram stops from the Trastevere station, and providing easy access via tram to Pz Argentina, a gateway to all of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: umberland
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing. They helped us from booking to check-in to check-out and everything in between. They were ready with anything - from providing phone and help confirming flights to finding a lighter, a wine opener, wake up calls, explaining maps, etc. They were careful with our bags, patient with our disorientation and a mistake with a taxi driver, and they spoke English very well. Everything was very clean and organized and fairly priced. The only thing missing was some coca cola on our last day there when through no fault of theirs, one of us ended up with an upset stomach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and great quality rooms and services”
Reviews.Author: kurushi
Reviews.Content: First of all this Hotel is in a really good area, near by all the restaurants and the night life, we had a great check-in with Splendora, she has so sweet voice and makes evething never too trouble. All the staff is very nice and Max ( the sexy guy at the reception ) speaks a perfect english, he has a natural sense of the humor and makes you feel so happy to come back after a long day in the city. Silvia was so helpfull when we booked and she has so cute accent. Mana gave us a really good suggestions about the restaurants and she always wanted to be sure that our stay was going good. Big thanks to Carmen and Paolo with the directions and the drinks. Please try the SPA, a romantic area bookable for private use, the best thing after a long walk in Rome. The room was perfect, the bed was so confortable. The breakfast has a good variety and good quality. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: T31AFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between 18/11/11 & 21/11/11. We found all the staff to be very helpful, always available to give advice and directions, especially Max who endured showing us several rooms before my partner decided on the one she wanted! The hotel is very clean, nice beds, safe included, bathroom with a sauna/hydro type shower which is useful after a day on foot around Rome. You can pay for breakfast when you check in, this worked out at 7 euros each per day and was worth the money. If your coming into Fiumicino airport, you can get the FR1 train from the airport to Roma Trastevere station, it's about 8 stops and takes 30 minutes, a ticket costs 8 euros. Once you get out of the station the hotel is about a 500 yard walk away or you can get the tram. Outside the hotel about 20 yards to the left is the tram stop, this will take you into Rome (tram number "8 Argentina" on the front) and takes only 10 minutes (6 stops). A three day tram/metro/bus pass costs only 11 euros and is excellent value. Basically from and to the airport plus getting around Rome cost us 27 euros each for the 3 days we were there ! The Trastevere area is really good for restaurants and bars, it's lively with a good atmosphere and where we ate each night. it's 4 stops on the tram from the hotel stop heading towards ( 8 Argentina on the front) the centre across the river Tiber. Virtually everything you want to see is walkable when you get off of the tram in the centre (Argentina stop), decent shoes and a map is all you need. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Point Pleasant, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Pleasant Experience. Staff could not have been friendlier...”
Reviews.Author: MLM058
Reviews.Content: This hotel was top notch...Staff (Paolo, the bartender, Splendora and Silvia) couldn't be more helpful and accommodating...all you had to do was ask and they took care of it in a minute. We went to Rome to visit my son who was studying a semester abroad and was given the name of this hotel by his school...From the moment I booked the trip, I knew it would be a very pleasant experience. Silvia, who I booked it with could not have been more helpful...every question I had she answered promptly through emails...Then when we got to the hotel, the staff was very welcoming...my daughter took a special liking to Splendora as did we all..She was so, so sweet and was so helpful...Every night we ended our day with a stop at the bar on the first floor, Paolo the bartender could not have been more friendlier and helpful...it was funny, the last night of our stay there he had his first day off in I think it was 25 straight days of work...well we missed him...it just wasnt the same without him there that night to say good bye... The rooms were clean and the whole facility was very modern and top notch. One thing that I will always remember was that one day we planned on getting up early and going into Florence, I asked if my son who was in school could stay in his sister's room that night so we could get up the next day early and get on the train to Florence...well much to my pleasant surprise, they gave my son his own room for the night...its the things like that that make people want to keep coming back...it's not like they were just after our money. If I ever go back to Rome, I will be sure to stay in that hotel again and I recommend it to anyone going to Rome who wants that warm, inviting feeling..When we left, we missed them all. One more thing, I dont want to forget how nice the breakfasts were there every morning, the breakfast staff was also very friendly and accommodating. Maryann Murphy

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, convenient and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveller78
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Trilussa between 27 October and 2 November of this year and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was conveniently located 10 minutes walk from Trastevere area where there was a great selection of restaurants and bars. It was also two minutes from a tram stop which took us straight into the city centre in under ten minutes (total average journey time less than 15 minutes). The staff were extremely helpful. On arrival the receptionist Fabio gave us some very useful pointers on how to get around the city together with a tourist map. The hotel barman, Paolo, also deserves mention for his engaging, friendly and hospitable service. Our room was clean and nicely furnished with a comfortable bed and a nice little balcony. The bathroom had no bath but was again well furnished/decorated, bright and clean (although it took a little while to figure out the shower.) There weren't many English language channels on the television other than Sky/BBC news, but in a city as lively as Rome this didn't inconvenience us. We'd have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Trilussa and hope to stay there again. Richard and Clara

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie J
Reviews.Content: My wife and i chose this hotel after reading the other reviews posted, im happy to say that our stay here was great. the rooms were well kept and the service at the front desk was excellent, namely a lady by the name of "Splendora" was super nice and made sure we were looked after well. The hotel is just 3 stops away from the famed Trestevere district filled with beautiful streets and an endless choice of great restaurants. Getting to the city centre is easy too, the rail car that stops right outside the hotel takes you to within a 10 minute walk of the main piazza where from there you can choose to walk down Via Corso which leads to Trevi fountain and the Pantheon or hop on a bus 5 min to the colloseum. we wasted hours looking for a hotel close to everything but that does not exist! Rome is big and you'll have to bus it somewhere sooner or later but its easy anyway, we found it really nice to be so close to the well known Trestevere district, after walking all day its nice to have great dining and nightlife 5 min away. loved the stay! only complaint is the shower was tiny and my wife laughed watching me trying to turn around inside but who cares anyway its just a shower. Room 216 had a tiny but nice balcony with rear facing view, highly recomended!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, first rate staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we expected and the staff was superb (really all of them, front desk, breakfast room, and maid). What a great location also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: LMack6
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I loved this Hotel!! Great location, wonderful staff...they went out of their way to be helpful. The room was large, very clean and comfortable.Breakfast was wonderful with plenty of selections. The rooftop garden and bar was beautiful!!!! Loved the neighbor...very quiet,great restuarants and shops within walking distance. The Tram stop is right outside the door,making it very easy to go in and out of the center of Rome.Will definitely stay here when we return. Highly recommend this Hotel... you will be very pleased with your stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: palmtree152
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Trastevere, walking distance to shops/restaurants. Friendly/helpful staff with great suggestions. Room was large, neat and very clean. Bathroom was large and beds were VERY comforatable!! Breakfast was wonderful. Would definitely recomment a stay at this hotel if you want to stay in Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Girls Weekend Away!”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: I went away for the weekend with 2 girl friends and cannot praise the hotel enough. The rooms were well decorated, clean and comfortable with an amazing shower. The hotel staff couldn't do enough for us and painstakingly found us excellent restaurants to eat in for our 2 nights there. (highly recommend the Elle restaurant). We wanted to spend one day relaxing in the spa and they gave us sole use of the spa (Jacuzzi, sauna and steam room for 3 hours) with a 1 hour massage each for an amazing price. The hotel is really conveniently located, with the tram stop practically a 20 sec walk from the hotel and a straight tram into the city centre in under 15min. Would definitely love to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant from start to finish!!”
Reviews.Author: laurawhsg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews we found on tripadvisor, and were not diasppointed! We followed the directions on the hotel's website to get from the airport, and it could not have been easier. LOCATION - Ideal, it's less than 10 mins on the tram from central Rome, and the tram stops right outside the hotel. There are so many nice, 'non-touristy' restaurants in that area, do not bother going across the River to eat! SERVICE - First class, with the ladies on reception so so helpful, they could even recommend great restaurants to try if you were stuck. When we checked in, we were given a token for a free drink at the rooftop bar - this is such a good idea, as otherwise there was a chance we would not have tried it. This was a fabulous spot, with the people serving the bar also so pleasant and welcoming. At the end of our day, there was nothing better than sitting here, in the comfy chairs, overlooking Rome with a drink in hand. You must try this!! ROOM - Stayed in a Classic Double - Really nice, lovely modern bathrooms, although the showers were on the small side, with not much room to move. Room was clean, with enough space that you would need for a city break. BREAKFAST - This was great, with plenty of choice, for only 7 EUR per person, great value. VERDICT - We plan on returning to Rome, and would not look any further than this hotel. Absolutely brilliant!!

Reviews.Title: “Great.”
Reviews.Author: whatsup12
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Room ok would have liked tea/coffee making facilities in room. Would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Jadaziat
Reviews.Content: Trilussa is called Palace but I won't call it like that. I think it is a very nice hotel where the people at the reception are very welcoming and answering to every questions. The cleaning lady didn't do it well the last day (we stayed 6 days), we were missing one towel and the garbage was still full. The breakfast from 7:30 to 10:30 am is correct but doesn't worth 4 stars. You don't have so many choices and if you arrive at 10am, there is almost nothing anymore. The shower can do turkish bath, and several kind of water pressions. The Spa was a really good surprise! We booked it for 1 hour and we got 1h30 as it was in the morning and nobody booked it after us. A nice big jaccuzzi, good hammam and sauna. Please enjoy it with friends or you partner. Good moment of relaxation. The massage was nice, we succeed in having our massage at the same time with my partner. But as most of massages, it lasted a little bit less than 50 minutes. Anyway, a very good experience but could be better for the breakfast knowing that we paid more than 200 eur per night (Wellness package).

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: crazygecko
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We stayed with our two children and our room was clean, tidy and enough space for the 4 of us. The hotel is perfectly positioned close to the tram/bus stops which take you in minutes either to the lively eating/social area of Trastevere or if you go to the end of the tram line you are centrally located to explore Romes main attractions. You can get singular public transport tickets from reception or 3 day/week tickets from the Tabacchi a couple of doors away. The front desk staff at this hotel were brilliant and very helpful with every request we made or piece of information we asked. They were also very friendly towards the children. On Sunday the market is located across the street and goes all the way to Porta Portese. It starts as a flea market and turns into a more general market the closer you get to Porta Portese. From the hotel you can also walk through the park located behind the hotel almost all the way to the Vatican if you are up for a longer stroll. Our only complaint if anything would be the breakfast. Although there was plenty to eat we feel that for a 4* hotel the breakfast could be improved. Every food base was covered but choice was limited and the menu was the same every day. For example there was just one meat and cheese option and the warm food each day was just scrambled eggs and bacon. A larger selection of meats and cheese and warm food would have been nice. Then again we had come armed with a whole list of restaurants, pizzarias, gelaterias etc to try which had been recommended to us that if we had eaten too much at breakfast we never would have been able to try everything. All in all a great stay at this hotel and we would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cormac65
Reviews.Content: This is a 3.5* star review. It's really a 3.5* hotel too. We liked our room and the hotel generally; the location is great if you want to explore Trastevere, in particular, and the price was fair enough for Rome, without being a complete giveaway. We opted to have breakfast in the hotel as we were pressed for time, but it was v. poor indeed - watery juice, tinned fruit, awful croissants, etc. Getting good croissants in Rome would be easier than getting bad ones, I would have thought. But this hotel does pass the would-I-stay-there-again test. It is a reasonable option - and improving the breakfast is a pretty minor challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: ISj
Reviews.Content: We used a lot of time finding a proper hotel in Rome. And we are so happy that Trilussa ended up beeing the choise. For us, it was perfect. We had a great welcome and good service during the stay. The staff was helpful in advising and recommending restaurants and shops (as we lost our luggage on the way).The location is good and the tram and bus stop was just outside the door. The tram took about ten minutes in to centeral Rome very convenient to all locations in Rome). The Porta Portese market was just across the street as well. The room was clean and spotless and the breakfast very good. We enjoyed these days very much and would love to come back. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: RAC1959
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research in trying to find a hotel in Rome and decided on the Trilussa - great choice. We wanted a place that was not close to the popular antiquities and the Trilussa fit the bill. It is in the Trasrevere area, a great neighborhood area of Rome. We loved the area. You felt like you were emerssed in the Roman culture. We used it's pickup service from the airport which is a nice alternative to the taxi (which can runup the euros in a hurry) or the bus/tram route. We didn't really want to have to figure out the transit system hauling luggage after an overnight flight. Our room was ready upon arrival at 9:30 a.m. which was a bonus. A bottle of Prosecco and a nice not congratulating us on our anniversary awaited us - a nice and thoughtful gesture. The room was one of the cleanest hotel rooms we had aver been and was always nicely cleaned everyday. Our room was on the street side of Trastevere but whenever heard street noise over 10 days. The staff exceeded our expectations from the reviews, always cheerful and willing to answer questions, give directions,make restaurant reservations and recommendations. Breakfast was good with a nice selection. The location is right by a tram and bus stop so transportation is easy to sites (just make sure to understand the bus route schedule), but we walked a lot. We especially loved the Trastevere area. There are so many excellent restaurantes, trattorias, and pizzerias finding places to eat are no problem. We had no poor meal there from pizza on the street to the sit-down restaurantes. And no sit-down fees like you find at many Rome eateries. We will stay at the Trilussa again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott E
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a city break seven nights, rooms although not the biggest (probably due to the budget room booking) comfortable and clean. Slightly off the beaten track but good transport links. Stand out for us was the hotel staff, Reception was very helpful, welcoming and well informed, provided assistance where needed and supplied useful local knowledge regarding sites of interest and transport links. Breakfast room and bar staff also very helpful and cheerful. Rooftop terrace relaxing and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Galitharel
Reviews.Content: There's nothing bad I can say about this hotel but I don't think it's best value for money... We chose it because of its location in Trastevere, however we had to take the tram or walk 20 minutes to the part of Trastevere where all the restaurants and bars were, which was exactly what we tried to avoid by choosing a hotel in Trastevere... The room is nice but basic and I don't think it's worth the 213 EURO we paid for it. The staff were all very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: Bruce D
Reviews.Content: We spent ten days at this delightful hotel which was very convenient to all locations in Rome. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Splendora and Max. We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome. We enjoyed the lovely rooftop terrace and well presented breakfast. The hotel is very well maintained, clean, and very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ayrshirelass53
Reviews.Content: Myself mother and sister only stayed one night thank goodness. After a lot of research before our trip we booked 3 nights at Ponte Sisto hotel (pre-cruise) and 1 night (post cruise) at the Trilussa. My sister is a wheelchair user and we try to make sure that a hotel room is going to be suitable for her needs. We have stayed at many hotels worldwide and I can safely say this was the worst experience in all our travels. We asked for a wheelchair accessible triple room - this turned out to be a ground floor room and was very dark , unwelcoming and slightly depressing. The worst part was the bathroom - although a wheelchair could get access to the bathroom - you could not get the wheelchair anywhere near the shower door which meant that my sister had to transfer from her wheelchair to the toilet , then transfer to the bidet and finally transfer to the stool (which I had to ask reception twice for) in the shower There were no grab rails in the shower or the bathroom. The lift within the hotel was dirty and although the rooftop terrace could have been very nice it was let down by the badly stained cushions on the furniture . The breakfast was very poor - there was no scrambled egg or bacon left and we had to ask for cutlery from an extremely surly waitress. I have seen many reviews regarding the friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff but I can only assume they all had a day off during our trip. I think it is normally good practice when the management of a hotel takes the time to read reviews on trip advisor and respond to any concerns that are raised however the management at this hotel would be far better using this time to actually speak to the guests when they are staying at the hotel. I had asked the reception about suitability of the trams for a wheelchair and they did not tell me that there was a scheduled strike the next day. A notice in the reception would have been sufficient to avoid the chaos we endured going into and returning from the centre of Rome. We tried the Orange restaurant which is nearby and the waiter was breathtakingly rude and the food was inedible. We did not try the food at the Chinese restaurant next door as the waiter was so rude and obnoxious that we did not stay. I am not sure if this was because of the fact that we were women on our own or the wheelchair but it was not a very nice experience. Also the area does not feel very safe at night for women travelling on their own. It was a very disappointing end to a wonderful holiday. If you want to have a more positive experience in Rome - I would definitely recommend hotel Ponte Sisto.

Reviews.Title: “good but pricey”
Reviews.Author: ItalianFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a two night stay for a business trip in August 2011. I unknowingly had only booked am economy room and was "offered" an up grade upon my arrival with breakfast. The timings of my meetings meant that I would not be able to make use of it so I declinde, and low and behold, they upgraded me anyway! The rooms are vey nice and the staff are very helpfull. as a business traveller, WIFI is very important and it did not dissapoint. The rooms have Sky TV which is great. The roof top bar was very enjoyable after a long day, mind you the price of a glass of wine was a bit heavy for a not so great bottle. Over all....it was good...but for the price, It could have done with a few more touches

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: revitalize10
Reviews.Content: We had very little complaints about our stay at Trilussa Palace Congress & Spa. When we arrived at the hotel at 8 am, one of our rooms were ready so we were able to check-in and get changed there before heading out for the day (we were traveling with another couple, so we had 2 rooms reserved at the Hotel). The other room was ready quickly too, when we arrived back mid-afternoon we had no problem checking in. The rooms are standard and comfortable. Our air conditioning broke one night and leaked all over the floor, once we told the front desk, it was immediately taken care of and fixed. We couldn't figure out the thermostat though so I was freezing (my husband loved it). The front desk was EXTREMELY helpful and was always willing to answer any and all of our questions. They spoke English very well and were kind enough to help us learn some phrases in Italian too. As noted in other reviews, the location is great, it's right across from a bus stop that will take you to the Trevi Fountain/Pantheon in less than 10 minutes. We also spent one night walking along the Lungo il Tevere (one of the stops on the bus) and LOVED it, there were lots of spots to shop! Since we traveled in August, a lot of the stores/restaurants by our hotel weren't open, but we stumbled upon some amazing restaurants near the Trevi fountain (Il Chianti, try the lasagna, it was amazing!) and Piazza di Trilussa (Il Duca, it was one of our best meals and least expensive too, we dined with a lot of locals). The one thing I would recommend is to travel with the Hotel's business card in your pocket. One of our cab drivers dropped us off at PIazza di Trilussa, which was a 40 minute walk back to our hotel, after that night we showed all of the cab drivers the address of the hotel so they knew where they were going. Overall, a great hotel in Italy. If we stayed at this hotel in the US, I'd give it 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Please Read Before Booking”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn D
Reviews.Content: Hello: I am posting this in an attempt to warn you regarding mgmt service at Trilussa Palace Congress & Spa. I was part of the north eastern hurricane Irene and as result all airports were completely shutdown. I booked my first ever trip to Rome with so much excitement and heavily relied on the reviews of trip advisor and so I post my feedback. For 4 full days since my cancellation, we tried to reachTrilussa for some type of reconsideration of scheduling to no avail. According to the front desk mgmt was not available and we were asked over and over to call again. When we finally got someone on the phone line, we were told that there would be no issue in rescheduling the dates for another time only to be told less than 24hrs later that this would not be possible. Again, I was not looking to be refunded but was more so looking for a resolution of rescheduling of dates (to say that I'm beyond tears at this point is an understatement). What has affected me most, is that this hotel had no consideration and response time in dealing with an foreseen and unexpected circumstance. Even the airlines accommodated 100% with no issue or insurance to back it up. I base all my travels on the customer service experience. This is what gives a business reliability and credibility. A small extension of attention and accommodation would impact any repeated business for any customer. I guess that what drove me to write this is that I was promised at 3am my time that the front desk would try to talk to mgmt to try to reverse the decision and the rep confirmed that I would receive an email. No communication was sent and no follow up. As a result, I'm only hoping that my experience will help so that no one relives my emotional nightmare. I will continue to post my opinion and will report my experience to the better business bureau. Thank you for your time...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but family rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Ashtan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located with a tram station right in front that takes you to the city center in 10 minutes. While the rooms were neat and bathrooms good, they were too small especially the family room we stayed in. Breakfast was average. If you pick this hotel pick the executive double rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very welcoming hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Errol C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 1st Aug to 5th Aug in room 412. First of all the location is excellent. Half hour by taxi and if using Tram #8 it stops directly outside the hotel. Dont forget that if you use the Tram you need to validate your ticket with the machine on the Tram (when it works)! The staff were exceptionally helpful and extremely polite. The choice of breakfast was good and filling to start your day. The hotel was clean, rooms were spacious, air con worked (which came in useful at times) and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Italy. We look forward to coming back to Rome and staying at the Trilussa Palace Hotel. Would definately recommend this hotel for couples, families with children and anyone wanting a touch of luxury to enhance their trip. Thank you all staff at Trilussa.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: MMK6
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family, my wife and two children, age 9 and 11, in two connecting rooms. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The location was good, next to tram #8, which takes you to last stop, Argentina, and from there you can walk to most of the tourist areas. The staffs are very friendly, especially Mana in the front desk. She also made the intial booking of the room. Try the Chinese food next door, they have very good food. Mk, NY

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service-perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: ikasalovic
Reviews.Content: Spent a two days here in June 2011 with my family before going north. The room was comfortable, clean and elegant. The staff, their professionalism, friendliness and knowledge was above & beyond. Very personable, willing to help with any enquiry that we had. Thanks Max for your restaurant recommendation! Looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “loved it - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SherbutFizz
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Trastevere district where we had a very nice three night stay. Helpful and very friendly staff. We chose a classic double room which was spotlessly clean with a fantastic spa shower with Turkish bath setting. Good buffet breakfast with plenty of choice. The roof top terrace is lovely either for a final drink in the late evening or an aperitif before heading out for dinner at the numerous restaurants in the district. The tram stop is literally just outside, not that you can hear anything from within the room, and it costs 1 euro to get into the heart of the city (or it's a 15 minute stroll if you'd rather walk.) From there you can walk to all of the sights Rome has to offer. We woke up Sunday morning to find the Porta Portese market was literally outside our door - great for bargain hunting and strolling. Everything on offer from food, antiques, clothing, flowers, kitchen utensils - you name it you can probably get it here.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen3507
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that I checked the trip advisor rating prior to my hotel booking. We loved nearly everything about the Trilussa Palace. The front-desk staff were great. It was our first trip to Rome, and we must have asked a million questions; but they were unfailingly polite and enthisiastic about helping. I booked online, and there were no problems-prices were as advertised-no surprises. At check-out, a bar bill had been charged to our room in error. When I pointed this out, it was corrected immediately. Our flight was late in arriving-there was our driver patinetly waiting. I would advise potential guests to pay a little extra for this service, as after an overnight flight we were pretty exhausted. the Trilussa will store your luggage if you arrive prior to check-in, which I find is also quite important after a long flight. It is a little off the beaten path, but close to the trolley, which is easy to hop on. Our room was clean and attractive, with a great bed. I took advantage of foot treatments in the spa, which was also positive. The breakfast was plentiful, although it was difficult to locate someone to provide coffee (my only complaint). There is no question, that we would return if vacationing in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jodysloft
Reviews.Content: From Airport take train to Trastevere station and hop on Tram 8 - it drops off right outside front door. Hotel is fine - not luxurious - but offers pretty good breakfast. Mini bar in room at local prices. Near Trastevere neighborhood, with great restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: chinoo
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic- 30 secs walk from the tram that takes you straight into the heart of the city. Very good service- warm and friendly staff, always eager to help. Rooms are a bit small but we didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway. Breakfast could probably be improved in terms of selection of food. Overall, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HadrianIMP
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in July with my two children ages 10 and 11 in an Executive room (Large double bed and sofa bed in side room) . The room was elegant, comfortable, great large Flat screen TV with English Sky channels and excellent air con all enjoyed very much by my children after long days touring Rome. The hotel is 10 min walk to the center of Trastevere and the #8 Tram and buses depart in front of the hotel so you can get to Termini or Piazza Argentina quickly. Also the staff was extremely helpful and the best service I have ever had in the 27 years I have been coming to Rome. Roman Hotels offering quality rooms, comforts and services are expensive. However in the context of what you are getting this hotel is very reasonable. I choose this hotel primary so that my children would be comfortable with insured quiet nights, I was absolutely satisfied and recommend this Hotel . Nearby are a few restaurants of note (La Fete , Orange and an excellent Chinese Sushi restaurant directly next to the Hotel (Not that one comes to Rome to eat Asian food but can be a nice break for some). Over all This is a superb Hotel and excellent for Families

Reviews.Title: “Max and Splendora were splendiferous!”
Reviews.Author: pkounelis
Reviews.Content: Great stay, wonderful beds and fantastic service. The breakfast was delicious (try the capuccino maker) and the staff there was super nice. Seeing Rome with our large group was fun but tiring, and coming back to the Trilussa was most refreshing. Peter J Kounelis San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Martina0911
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean with a workin AC and good bed, the bathroom is very tiny and there is only a massaging shower where some people will have problem to fit (just an advice for those a bit bigger). I'm a regular size women and I had a problem to turn in the shower. The hotel is directly on a tram line, few minutes to the city center. Internet connection is fast and free of charge. They have a very nice bar on the terrace. The stuff is friendly. Breakfast is ok, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “very solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: ggrossi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, in final leg of italy tour , to see the major sites , in early july . Very clean , but the best part of the hotel is the pleasant demeanor of the front desk staff, and I spoke to various reps on every shift . The location is not the most pleasing to the eye , but the tram is right across the street and for one euro , the last stop takes you within 10 minutes to the center of Rome. For dinner , if you take the 4th tram stop from the hotel and start walking up the hill to the left , you will be amazed at the restaurant selection of the trastevere area and beautiful squares and piazzas , there must be 50 spots to eat or drink . . So don't be put off by the hotel spot , which is very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel, close to the tram”
Reviews.Author: EfauG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. We had the executive room, which was spacious and comfortable. The location is the minus. It is however great that tram line number 8 leaves right out front and we didn't have to wait more than 3 minutes for it. It takes you straight to the city center in 10 minutes. Breakfast was ok. Plus for eggs and bacon and fresh fruit, but nothing special about it. Not far from the nice piazzas and restaurants in Trastevere. We also had 1 hour in the spa included, which was really great!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: markalbrecht
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most pleasant stays I've had in a hotel! The accommodations was great, the breakfast was awesome and the staff couldn't have been better. The highlight of our stay was a young lady by the name of "Splendora". She spoke excellent English and was always helpful with any of our needs. She welcomed us with a smile and a helping attitude. She helped us with directions, restaurant advice and she was always at our service. If I ever come back to Rome; this will be the place I stay. The area is great for eating, metro (busses and Trains) and there's a bank across the street. This is an excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: cardella-koll
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 ( 2 parents, 3 children ages 23,21, and 17 stayed in the apartment next to the hotel. Staying in the apartment was so much nicer than staying in two separate hotel rooms. The apartment was spacious, clean,and air conditioned. Everyone in our family was able to relax after a fun filled day of sight-seeing. On several evenings we went to the roof top terrace over-looking the city and talked about our favorite parts of the day. The drinks in the bar were reasonably priced, The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located about 10 minutes away by tram from John Cabot University.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable customer service”
Reviews.Author: lake_merritt
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Trilussa Palace - where we stayed in June 2011. The true gem at this hotel is the staff - who were absolutely fantastic. (Special thanks to both Mana and Silva!) From the moment we arrived, both of these generous ladies spent at least 20 minutes each walking us through a local map - providing priceless suggestions on itineraries for our stay including transportation, restaurant and destination tips. They wrote notes, drew routes, suggested then made phone calls for reservations on our behalf... offering more suggestions as they waited on hold! Then, as we were checking out, we asked for some final advice on how to get to a car rental office that was a few miles away. Silva was kind enough to mention that an alternate car rental office was right down the street, asking if we'd checked with them. When we stated that we hadn't (I had booked a reservation failing to think through travel logistics ahead of time), so she volunteered to call them for us to check if our desired reservation was available. She clarified all the critical details and ended up getting a matching reservation - for a cheaper price than we would've paid originally! (When we were unable to reserve a GPS device - Silva was sweet enough to offer us her personal device to borrow! But, we were not returning to Rome, so that wasn't possible. But, when was the last time a hotel employee extended themselves to that degree?) For us, their kindness left a large impression on us - of the Trilussa Palace, of course, but also of the city of Rome and Italian people in general. Other fantastic qualities of this hotel include - a wonderful spa facility, a complementary welcome drink (great touch!), a turkish bath style shower, customizable pillows, a walk-on balcony, a fresh delicious breakfast spread, free internet, a great rooftop lounge, robe and slippers furnished.... the list could go on. It is clear that the owners have created a hotel experience that focuses on unique customer service - and it truly shows. We will gladly recommend Trilussa Palace to our friends and, if revisiting Rome, we will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Trippy Shower”
Reviews.Author: kapingram
Reviews.Content: Trilussa Palace wasn't five star, but it had some nice amenities: memory foam mattress, marble floors and counters in the bathrooms, delicious breakfast (ours was included in room price), and a little bar area with a tv and friendly bartender (our room also included drink coupons). The staff was very helpful, and used central air controls to make our rooms much cooler. The little metro train stops just outside the front door, and you're just a few short stops away from the Tiber Riverwalk and the Piazza Trastavere with its pretty church, street performers, restaurants, and shops. The shower was an absolute trip - kind of self-contained capsule that looked prepped to shoot you into space. Much smaller than a cruise ship shower, it had a little bench, ceiling and back jets, and controls so confusing that the room provides an instruction manual. We wouldn't mind staying here again, but would check other possibilities before booking.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel with exceedingly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: arem
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for four nights. the staff were very friendly and welcoming and made sure we had all the information we needed about the hotel, area and the best way to get where we wanted to go in Rome. We paid for an upgraded room which was basic but clean. The beds were very comfy and nice to come back to after a day sightseeing. Nice touches were the complimentary drinks in the lobby in the morning, and a welcome drink voucher when checking in - we had booked the wellness package and it was worth every penny - the couples spa was fantastic, and the massages were amazing. This is a good hotel to stay in as the tram is just across the street which takes you directly to the centre of rome. The area Trastevere is brilliant for dining with lots of lovely restaurants and bistro's. Breakfast was good with a nice continental selection along with eggs and bacon too. We would certainly recommend this hotel - especially for the kind staff who made our stay very pleasurable indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for our first 5 day stay in Rome ....”
Reviews.Author: 1FairDeal2
Reviews.Content: Super staff and hotel too. The Trastevere area, in which the hotel is located, is also a somewhat hidden gem, with smart little coffee bars and restaurants in the streets around Piazza Santa Maria. The Church in the square is believed to have been the first Christian place of worship in Rome and most likely to be missed by those accommodated elsewhere in the City as they scour their maps for the more familiar iconic sights. Also, do not miss, in this area, perhaps the best value lunch in Rome at La Scaletta (No. 8 Via Della Scala). The hotel reception was both very welcoming and quick to provide really good clear advice on how to make the most of our stay. A good selection of items at breakfast with staff being very responsive to any particular requests. The roof garden was an oasis of peace after a hard days touring around the sights. The gym was clean and tidy, but be prepared to be on your own (perfect). This hotel with attentive staff and good accommodation proved to be an excellent choice for my wife and I on our first visit to Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: Julkat99
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. From the friendly, english-speaking front desk, cheerful bellman who escorted us to our room and made sure we knew how to operate the key and lights, to the complimentary cocktail and internet in the lobby. Staff were helpful in directing us to the places we wanted to go. The bed was so comfortable, and the room entirely satisfactory. The rooftop lounge was a great place to unwind after a day of sightseeing. In the morning we got our wake-up call on time, an efficient checkout service and details on where to find our ride waiting for us when we left. Overall, all hotels could take a few pointers from this one! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel away from the tourist bustle”
Reviews.Author: acoo6
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's good reviews on Tripadvisor. We stayed four nights, and it was a great base for our Rome visit. We travelled by train from the airport to Trastevere station, pretty crowded but also easy and cheaper than a cab. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the station, or a couple of stops on the tram. If we had known better we would have got tram/bus passes from the start of our trip and used them more, but as it was we walked a lot (and have the blisters to prove it!). The tram stops right in front of the hotel and takes you across the Tiber and into Rome. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly, the room was very good with a very nice comfortable bed. I had noted a few issues with breakfast on other people's comments, and yes, if you go down 10 minutes before breakfast finishes the scrambled egg may be finished, but I can't say that this was a big problem for us as there was plenty of everything else. Not keen on the coffee machine coffee though, you can't beat the real thing, and hey, it is Italy, we should expect better coffee :) There are restaurants near the hotel ( orange was very good but service extremely slow) but the mail Trastevere restaurant area is closer to the river. All in all a very good choice, we would return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: HuanYi
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through a class marketing project for the Conrad Hilton College at the University of Houston Masters Program. This hotel was part of a competitive set for the hotel my classmates were studying. We chose this hotel based on the amenities and location, and we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel not only lived up to expectations but exceeded them. The front desk was extremely warm, welcoming, friendly, and knowledgeable, especially Splendora. Whatever we needed, we knew we could count on Splendora, she was professional and helped with everything we needed. The breakfast was absolutely wonderful and abundant, there was free internet including wireless which is hard to find in Rome, they gave us a free round of champagne at the bar, the rooftop garden is a beautiful outlook over the city, and the rooms are larger than a typical European hotel. It is common to find a box for a room in Europe, but the rooms were quite comfortable. The decor is beautiful and gives a good name to the boutique hotel industry. We used their car services from the airport to the hotel and the hotel to the port of Civitaveccia, and both were reliable, efficient, and capable of a capacity of 8 large Americans. They also have a spa which we did not partake in. On the way back, we made the mistake of using the cruise line to get our last night in Rome and were sorely disappointed with the Cicerone which was more expensive and had zero amenities.
