The location of the Trilussa is also perfect. You are located right next to the BEST place to find good food for a reasonable price, the Trastavere. If you want to go to the main highlights of Rome, it is within walking distance or you can pay one euro a person and take the train which comes every 2-3 minutes and is located right in front of the hotel. You are far enough away to have quite nights, with a great view, without having long distances to travel to get to the heart of Rome. We travel a lot and have traveled all over the world from China and Russia, all over Europe, and all over North America and we highly recommend the Trilussa Palace in Rome. This is also my professional opinion based on my work in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: AkselP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first part of Easter - selected based reviews on Trip Advisor. The staff was very helpful and spoke English pretty good. The bedroom and bath was OK in size and was cleaned very well each day. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Location was good as it was in quiet area, but still close to all all "tourist" attractions - bus and tram just outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but get down for breakfeast early or go hungry.”
Reviews.Author: preeve87
Reviews.Content: dont get down for breakfeast at 10am, which it is open until 10.30 am. i did and i asked for some more scambled egg and was told it had finished and alot of stuff had ran out. well if it is too much trouble why not close at 10 am then? so i went to the cafe next door which is very good and only 5 euros. apart from that hotel is very nice, sergio at reception is most helpful, and close to everywhere, when arriving look out for a garage with the big blue I .P sign it is next to that. ( as it is hard to see on the tram) head to truillisa plaza for dinner really nice food there 3 stops down on the tram, ask sergio.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly, comfortable and well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birding-colombia
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay using lastminue.com's mystery hotel to get the best value. We were not disappointed with what we got. On arrival the greeting was friendly and were immediately told that we would be getting an upgrade to our room which did surprise me given how little we paid. The room was spacious andmcomfortable. The breakfast buffet was much more than I am used to in most European hotels so we always left the hotel satisfied in that department. We used the trams and buses to get around and the hotel was just a few stops from all the main attractions. Those with more time might consider walking instead. Would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAFF, HOTEL, SPA, LOVED EVERY MINUTE”
Reviews.Author: IrishwillowDublin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked 3 nights (April 29 to May 2nd) for us in this hotel for my birthday. after reading the brilliant reviews on this site, and I am delighted to report that we were not disappointed, we agree with all the other favourable reports. From the moment we checked in until the moment we left, the staff were charming, efficient, friendly and professional. A big "Thank You (Grazie)" to Splendora, Max and Marco for a wonderful experience. What ever else you do, make sure you visit the Spa in the hotel. We reserved it for one hour after a long day of walking around this magnificent city. Complimentary robes and slippers were delivered to our room, and we had the wellness centre to ourselves, with strawberries and prosecco - absolutely fantastic!! The jacuzzi, sauna and steam rooms were all spotless and modern. The bedroom (Room 312) was lovely, we enjoyed watching the world go by from our balcony every evening. Amazing shower with many jets and a seat! The bed was really comfortable, and the T.V. was huge. Breakfast was great - plenty of variety, and I loved the white brocade chairs. The staff were at all times friendly and helpful, and recommended lovely restaurants each evening. No need to throw coins in the Trevi Fountain, I can guarantee that we will be back, and I look forward to staying in this great hotel once again. We give it our highest recommendation. 20 out of 10!! Book it now!! You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: northernscamp
Reviews.Content: Never written one of these before, but this place is a real find ! I was in Rome for business and needed a decent, no-too-pricey place to rest my weary bones. Just you wait till you try the sleep-cloud beds - wonderful ! The room was clean, cozy with a huge sky TV. Good lighting for work and quiet too. Breakfast is a huge buffet feast, with some great quality grub ! The staff are particularly helpful, warm and genuine and nothing seemed too much trouble. The internet is fast and FREE ! I didn't try out the gym nor the spa, but I will in my next trip. This really is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value - would definitely recommend for a Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jwchin
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome from April 16 through 25, and were really happy with Trilussa Palace. Being in Trastavere was great - we were within a 10 minute walk to the historic area of Trastevere which is historic and filled with great cafes and restaurants. The tram was right across the street, and would get us to the center of the historic distric in about 10 minutest, with the Pantheon, Campo D'Fiori, and Piazza Navona a 5 minute walk from there, and quick transfers to the main bus lines. Also across the street was a bus that took you to the Colosseum. Overall, the area is less frenetic and quieter than what you find in the middle of Rome. The hotel is small and can provide personalized attention to its guests - the staff were superb and helpful in every way, all of our requests were responded to quickly. The rooms are a typical European size, but our family of four fit fine in a room equipped with a queen bed, a fold-out bed, and a rollaway. The bathroom was small but beautifully appointed with marble tiled-walls, sink and floors. Breakfast was served in an elegant and sunny room and the selection was excellent - eggs, bacon, pastries, fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. Even had a nice automated espresso and cappuccino machine! We would stay here again and recommend it to anyone who would like to have a great value and a little quiet while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: StitcherAl
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 nights here on a recent trip to Rome to visit my daughter. As a woman traveling along this hotel was perfect. I felt safe and very well taken care of. The rooms are very nice, the beds amazing. The breakfast has lots to offer every morning. Don't miss the massage and spa experience, AMAZING! The staff was caring and most informative! From Mossimo picking me up at the airport to him returning me at the end of my trip everyone was stellar. The bartenders make an amazing Prosecco spritzer. The location of Trastevera is excellent. The tram stop is right outside the hotel and in just a few minutes you are in the heart of Rome. I will most certainly return to this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: georgeadam
Reviews.Content: I highly reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome from outside of Italy. I recently vistied Italy with my mother and this hotel made the trip so muc better. During our vacation in Italy, we stayed at four different hotels in three different cities and this hotel was by far the best. it is located outside of the main "touristy" area, but has some of the best restaurants in Rome. There is a tram stop directly in front of the hotel and you can get to most of the sites in rome via public transportation within 10-12 minutes. Its also very easy to get to via train from the airport. Its only a train ride and two trams stops, which will drop you off directly in front of the hotel. The room and facitlities were great. They have tempurpedic beds and a great shower. Just what you need after a long day seeing the sights. Also, this hotel had the best breakfast of any hotel we stayed in whilel in Italy. However, the best part of this hotel was the staff. It was far and away the best I experienced. The english-speaking staff welcomed us, explained everything, walked us to the room, and went out of their way to help us throughout our stay. They really took away the anxiety of being in a different country where you do not speak the language. All of the staff was great but Splendora, who greeted us when we arrived and repeatedly helped us, was so impressive and deserves special praise. I cannot recommend this hotel strongly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Breda22
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were picked up at the airport, the feeling of being looked after was brilliant, reception staff were very helpful and accommodating, took time out to go throough the map and tell us what buses, trams and trains to get, best way to get around and get our bearings, there is a tram right outside the door to take u into the centre and with a short walk you can access buses to all the sights. The rooms were well porpotoned and spotless, the shower was high tech but lovely after a long day sightseeing, The beds were extremely comfortable and you could have a choice of pillows to suit your needs, breakfast in the morning was delicious and there was a great choice to eat, sweet, savoury and plenty of everything, overall had a brilliant stay and would highly reccomend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Charming, very enjoyable, clost to the action, but far enough away”
Reviews.Author: OperaDovi
Reviews.Content: The Trilussa Palace is located in what I would describe as “South Trastevere” meaning you are not on any of the “tourist” maps. However, you are across the street from the #8 tram which we used daily and a bus stop which we also used. We were in Rome for a week and used a taxi exactly once, we tram’d or walked everywhere. We had a lot of fun walking and discovering many local restaurants. The staff of the Trilussa was extremely accommodating, and quick to provide answers to travel logistics, and make suggestions when it comes to local dining. One thing the Trilussa has going for it is Breakfast. Each morning my wife and I would come down to the breakfast room and enjoy a freshly made café latte or cappuccino made by the waitress (she was extremely friendly and made dam good coffee, I am a coffee snob). Our room was small by American standards, however it had a ¾ bath, was nice and clean, the bed was very comfortable and I think essentially king sized. If I ever get back to Rome I would stay here again and will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean, Safe with an Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: tonymagnum44
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great priced, clean, quite and safe hotel in Rome, this is a great place to stay. The staff is amazing, helpful and speaks English. The all inclusive breakfast is great and it is conveniently located right on the tram line that takes you right into the middle of the city. It also has a wonderful spa located in the basement of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - staff exceptional”
Reviews.Author: anothertaff
Reviews.Content: We were in a party of x6 for Wales/Italy rugby. Arrived at hotel excellent welcome from staff. Staff throughout stay were very helpful. At end of stay had problems checking in on-line (a service provided free by hotel), staff member assisted and ultimately spent some time on telephone to airline on our behalf. We were let down by pre-booked airport transfer, hotel staff provided transfer cheaper than our original. Rooms were excellent and the shower - WOW! Breakfast was served in a pleasant room with staff that were again very accomodating. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Hotel is a little out of central city but no great problem with tram stop directly across road. For 4 euro you can travel on all public transport services for the day - great value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: TonyRhodie
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome for a weekend break. We booked through Thomas Cook and included the shuttle mini bus service from the airport. This is shared transfer but worked well. The Trilussa Palace Hotel is a small hotel on the main street through Trastevere. There is a tram service along this main road and tickets are available from Reception. Set back from the road, the hotel was quiet. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The bathroom was adequate but the walk in shower would have been difficult for a large person. Within walking distance are many cafes, bars and restaurants. Not cheap but an excellent recommenadation from our Reception was the Taverna Trilussa, 23-25 Via del Politeama. Reservations are recommended as it is very popular even to sports and entertainment stars. We pre-booked our Rome & Vatican tour with Easy Italy Tours following Trip Advisor research. It was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed again”
Reviews.Author: davidtc56
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night break to Rome. Once again we stayed at the Trilussa (our second visit in six months). It's in an ideal location for easy touring of 'Centro Storico', the best restaurants in Rome are on your doorstep (Trastevere), and the staff at Trilussa are always welcoming. The hotel is very comfortable and clean and has a decent breakfast buffet too. Internet access is easily available. A very good place to stay on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Davidthorpeness
Reviews.Content: The perfect stay in Rome. All the staff were excellant, receptionists, housekeepers and breakfast staff, Paolo was brilliant behind the bar - always able to help and guide us to the best bits of Rome and his bar selection.Love to have had more info on the city and the hotel in the room but what a city and what a great hotel. Thank you again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tomangela
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights a week ago and i cannot fault it at all. Was very simple to get to from Flumicio Airport just a train and two stops on the tram. When we arrived we was impressed instantly! The room was so quiet and the shower was great - my boyfriend loved the fact that the shower had so many settings and he could shower and listen to the radio. The staff wee so helpful with our questions and helping us plan our transportation to all the local sights. We got welcomed on the first night with complimentary drinks and snacks which were lovely and the bar environment was very welcoming. We didnt eat at the restaurant as it was closed the second night but reception recommended a restaurant down the road which was lovely. I couldnt recommend this hotel anymore, not only was the rooms immaculate and quiet, the staff were so helpful and extremely friendly but the overall hotel mde our stay even more special! We even experienced a power cut - as to which the receptionist joked he hadnt paid the bill. All in all such good value for money and such a good experience - 5/5!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: shoover
Reviews.Content: There are other reviews that have praised the staff of this hotel but I cannot help adding my praise . Sergio and Splendora have been singled out and they are deserving of every accolade they have received . The young man who trades off with Sergio is doing everything in his power to be as efficient and helpful as Sergio . The ladies who trade off/work with Splendora are equally as helpful and efficient . Special recognition MUST go to the ladies in the breakfast room , they are incredible . I have traveled a great deal more than I have wished in my life and have been lucky enough to stay in many , many 5 star hotels and resorts . I can say , without reservation , that I have encountered no more pleasant , helpful , caring or efficient staff anywhere , including the place where we had our own personal butler (not on my tab , thankfully). These people are absolutely Amazing !

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: DLKemp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trilussa Palace for ten nights last summer. We had an amazing holiday that was made extra special as a result of our choice of hotel. The location of the hotel is excellent as we love to be in the heart of the Trastevere area of Rome, this is also where many of the good restaurants are located. Directly outside the hotel there are excellent public transport links, with only a short tram (or bus) ride to the city centre, which of course is stunning. After a long day seeing all the many sights Rome has to offer, it was lovely to come back to a pleasant welcome by the staff and a clean and freshly made up room, not to mention the steam shower and memory foam bed. Having said that, you cannot spend a long day in the Eternal City, without a good breakfast to set you up, and here again, the Trilussa and its staff did not disappoint. We had a magnificent time in Rome and there is no doubt that the Trilussa - in wonderful Trastevere - helped a great deal to make it so! We will most definitely return to the Trilussa Palace on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful tempurpedic bed and location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: kulit1
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and this is my second stay. the first one was last summer of 2008 and now this christmas and new year of 2011. as usual the staff had exceeded my expectaion from the time we arrived to the time we left rome. Sergio was very accomodating. He was able to book our rooms & made prompt confirmation of our reservations. Splendora was quite efficient in giving us directions to the different tourist sites with exact bus numbers. All the staff members were efficient. The location of the hotel is very convenient. Transportation is just in front of the trainstop, bustop and is walking distance to different restaurants. The flea market on Sunday was quite an experience. The Turkish bath style shower with sauna is an added treat. Capuccino at breakfast is refreshing. It is a gem in the heart of Trestevere.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantasic Place!”
Reviews.Author: brendalagren
Reviews.Content: I have been to Italy many times since the early 1970s - - never have I had a better hotel experience in Italy. From the moment I arrived at the airport and the driver from the hotel greeted me with his big sign saying, "Brenda", I knew this was going to be great. The spa was quite wonderful - - I had the entire spa to myself including the jacuzzi, many showers with interesting showerheads and sprays, steam room, sauna, just lovely! The staff of the hotel was especially generous and helpful. Max, Splendora, and Lorrena were more than attentive to my every requests. Max even brought an adaptor from home (he has an American wife and they have visitors from the USA) because mine wasn't working. Their restaurant recommendations were fabulous. The hotel is only 5 years old, located in the most interesting neighborhood in Rome, Trastevere. The streetcar to the historical center stops in front of the hotel and it is only about 10 minutes to the center. I will only stay at this hotel when I return to Rome. I had a junior suite with a steam shower, which was another nice luxury for a tired traveler. Breakfast was superb with high quality hams, cheeses, fruits, etc. etc., quite lavish. fantastic

Reviews.Title: “I would definelty return to Trilussa Palace next time my company returns to Italy- the staff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BradoLLC
Reviews.Content: My stay at Trilussa Palace was excellent. It was my first time to Italy, and the staff was very welcoming and helpful in inviting me into their homeland. The bar tender, Paulo was very sincere and friendly as well as Sergio that works at the front desk- they both made my stay a true pleasure. I would definelty reccommend this hotel to my family and friends, and will definelty stay here again when my company returns to Italy for business.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming centre of wellness”
Reviews.Author: Skrubbetusse
Reviews.Content: We are truly satisfied with our stay at Trilussa Palace Hotel. We got a warm and friendly welcome at the check-in and we got the impression that our happiness and well-being really was the top priority of the staff. We especially appreciated how the receptionsts went out of their way to accommodate our needs during the Christmas week-end, when most things are closed in Rome. The location in Trastevere is great if you care to walk a bit. We would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Rome with a bit of luxury without being ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: DivaDonnaJapan
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I spent a lovely week at the Trilussa Palace Hotel--thanks to the very helpful and friendly staff. I think that the staff are very professional---they will be the reason that I come back again. The rooms were small but comfortable and clean. The shower was very tiny and took some time to figure out (like a space capsule with jets of water going every which way) but in general it was a very happy stay. The breakfast was delicious and with ample selections. The tram stop in front of the hotel added convenience. Several nearby restaurants for evening dining were recommended by the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were first class!!!”
Reviews.Author: peggiepants
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with extremely helpfull and delightfull staff! The rooms are a bit on the small side but very clean and tidy, bath room the same and a little tired. The hotel is placed in an area where the tram line is out side so easy to get to and from all the local attractions ( Vatican 10-15 tram & bus) and also lots of places to wine & dine! The spa facilities were great especially the 1hr private use of the hydro pool & sauna etc was fantastic (although 1 or 2 broken tiles). Overall a great 3 nights and would definatly go back again!

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: doctordashti
Reviews.Content: stayed only for one night but very comfortable and friendly atmosphere meant a lot to me an dmade my stay even more enjoyable. I will definitely book for my family holiday fo rnext visit to Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...... excellent service, friendly staff and room was very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Giselevan
Reviews.Content: Staff attitude and cleanliness are very important to me and this hotel rates an outstanding rating on both accounts. The rooms are nicely decorated and super clean. They are small, but no smaller than the typical European hotel room. It is located within a ten or fifteen minute walk from the city center. If you choose not to walk, there is a tram two minutes from the front door that will take you to the city center. The breakfast buffet was included with the room and we found it to be plentiful and good.....coffee was great. There are a couple of local restaurants located within ten minute walking distant toward the river that were excellent and price was not prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: “Near Trendy Trastevere and Spa is a Beautiful Bonus!”
Reviews.Author: Saklamaris
Reviews.Content: We did not want to stay in the heart of Rome's touristy areas nor the Termini metro station and this location seemed perfect because we were away from the throngs yet able to easily catch the #8 bus in front of the hotel and connect to almost anywhere without too much effort. The hotel is west of River Tevere and a brisk 15 minute walk from the trendy bar & restaurant night spot of Trastevere, which we often frequented. The hotel picked us up at the airport for a nominal fee that was well worth the cost and convenience - even more so if you have 2+ people traveling with luggage. The staff at the hotel were incredibly helpful, always ready with friendly greetings, jokes and an endless supply of take-away maps to share restaurants choices, directions and how to best get to where you were going via public transit. Furniture seems a bit dated but the rooms were clean, spacious for European standards and comfortable with marble bathrooms and upscale shower stalls. Small older style TV which we never had time to watch but the room did feature an in-room safe and writing desk. We did not get a chance to sit at the bar or have dinner at the hotel since we were always out somewhere within the city but breakfast was decent and plentiful. Next to the hotel is a pretty good Asian restaurant and a handful of cafés, tavernas and snack shops with quaint outdoor seating. We booked online directly with the hotel and took advantage of their spa package which was a terrific value. There is nothing better than coming back to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing and being able to soak in a hot tub, relax in the sauna or get a massage. Although scheduling in advance is required, the staff were extremely accommodating in preparing your arrival within an hour if the spa wasn’t already booked. This prep time may sound odd at first, but each guest books the spa as a “private retreat’ – you are the only ones allowed in the spa during your one hour session and you lock the door! The space is romantically decorated with lit candles and relaxing muted lighting while the hot tub, which looks more like a small pool, is very inviting as it gently bubbles. The hotel provides bathrobes and slippers in your room and it’s a quick zip down the elevator to the spa. It’s a wonderful treat. Rome central is smaller than it appears on a map and it’s easy to get around by foot, bus or metro. We did not feel inconvenienced at all by our location on the other side of the River Tevere. The Roma Pass www.romapass.it can be purchased at the Fiumicino airport, among other kiosk locations, but does not include airport transportation and is only worthwhile if you plan on taking advantage of the museum entry fee discounts. Don’t forget to check when museums are open and their hours of business. There is so much to see and do in Rome at no cost, and since the Vatican Museum Sistine Chapel was the only one we were particularly interested in as a “must-see”, we purchased a daily bus pass for 5e from a little shop near the hotel instead and ended up with a better value. Other than exploring the meandering cobblestone streets of Trastevere, we also walked along the river Tevere at night where we’d stop for a drink, listen to music and browse the vendors. If you are interested in visiting Vatican City, it is advisable to purchase your entrance ticket or guided tours online at www.vatican.va before you depart as it gets booked well in advance. We were actually late for our scheduled time but they still honoured our tickets and we avoided miles of lineups that wrapped around the exterior walls of Vatican City – no exaggeration! Some folks waited in line for 3 hours but the museum closed before they made it to the front door while we simply walked past the lineup and headed directly to the entrance without any wait whatsoever – although we experienced plenty of envious and bewildered stares. They also offer audio tours with headphones once you get inside if you were unable to commit to a scheduled guided tour. Vatican City is large and the entrance to the Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel is on Viale Vaticano , the north side of the city while St Peter’s Basilica is on the South East. Overall a nice hotel, away from the sounds of Trastevere, but close enough to enjoy its offerings by foot or bus and the spa is an extra bonus that we greatly utilized. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic hotel, fantastic friendly staff and caring attitude hard to find ...loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GOLDENWINDOW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa hotel in July for my birthday. The staff were absoulutly fabulous, always prepared to give us suggestons for authentic restaurants nearby, calling taxi's and generally ensuring our stay was as pleasant as possible. Rooms were very clean and the beds were so comfortable. Spacious rooms with great decor and a really cute roof terrace. The area around the hotel isn't so attractive but very safe and the hotel itself makes up for that. We were there during a heatwave but the tram outside the hotel was a godsend as it does actually come every 2 mins and you can get a 3-4 day pass from the little shop round the corner. The trams do stop around 12pm-12.30 so its cabs home if you're on a wild night out!! All tourist attractions are easily accesible by tram and train from the hotel. The old town (10min walk or 5 mins by tram) was just brilliant for bars and restaurants and there was so much more happening by the river. As my brother found out he passed his exams on the same day as my birthday, the lovely hotel staff left a bottle of wine in our room with a note to say happy birthday and congratulations. It was so lovely. Thank you to all of you for making our weekend just perfect and sorry for the delay in writing this review - Priya & Ajit

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alix66
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for a stay in Rome. It's not very prepossessing from the outside, but inside it's cheerful clean and perefctly adequate. The breakfasts are excellent - and Italian hotel breakfasts are usually terrible. The staff are charming and helpful. The rooms are clean, the beds comfy, the water hot, everything works. You wouldn't want to spend all day in your room, they are not very spacious, but you don't go to Rome to spend all day in your room. It's a really excellent base for sight seeing. The No 8 tram stops just outside the door, is very frequent, and gets you right to the centre of Rome in 10 minutes for one Euro (less if you buy a one day or a 3 day ticket) . We will definitely go back theree.

Reviews.Title: “One Word. OK”
Reviews.Author: TheRendons
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not great, but not bad either. The rooms were classic European size (very small) and they had VERY small showers. The showers were crazy spaceship looking. Anyway, the hotel is in the Tastevere neighborhood which definitely has more of a neihborhood feel. It was kind of nice being able to go back there from the madhouse that is Rome. While at the same time it was a short 4 stop ride on the tram from the hotel to central Rome so getting around is actually pretty easy. All in all it is not a bad hotel for Rome, especially given the price. I woudl recommend it to anyone looking for a good hotel at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, really feels authentically...”
Reviews.Author: kate186470
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, really feels authentically Rome, with a Turkish bath thrown in. The location is quite far away from the centre of town although the tram takes you directly into town and the attractions. Good value for money as most other more central hotels are quite expansive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidtc56
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, good location. Transport links - buses and trams - run right outside the hotel. We only ate breakfast in the hotel but the quality and quantity could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jodyannbeard
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up outside the Trilussa in the taxi we were very pleasantly surprised. The porter came straight out and had our luggage before we were out the car. The guy at the check in desk was particularly helpful. He upgraded our room from a standard ground floor without breakfast, to a room on the fourth floor with balcony and breakfast for a very good price (after initially refusing the first price he brought it down quite alot - it pays to haggle!). He also got out a map for us and gave us the bus and tram routes for the major attractions, it felt as if nothing was too much trouble, and they all speak english very well. The reception area is very clean and welcoming, and the room was a nice surprise. Very very clean, well presented, great hydroshower! :) The room was cleaned every day, with fresh towels. Unfortunately we didn't get chance to use the Wellness Fitness Centre as we ran out of time. The location is perfect as well, there is a bus and a tram stop outside the front of the hotel which takes you into the centre within minutes, we found it very easy to navigate! We would highly recommend this hotel, and if I return to Rome I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JagG86
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Rome and would recommend visiting it to everyone. The hotel which we stayed at was excellent, the rooms were clean and tidy, the staffs were pleasant and very helpful, and they were fluent in English. All the sites were very accessible by walk or by the tram which was directly outside the hotel. The Spa located in the hotel was very nice, and we all enjoyed it, the steam room and sauna were brilliant and the Jacuzzi was great, it was very private as the spa had to be booked so no one else was using it.

Reviews.Title: “Living off its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel to spoil ourselves before leaving Italy after a tour through Italy including Rome. I expected a luxury hotel, clean and with fantastic amenities and in a great location. We stayed in a better hotel in Rome for half the price 7 days earlier! The hotel is run down and dirty, the area seedy and not very clean. there is absolutely nothing to see unless you want to use public transportation at all times. the spa is rented by the hour and is old and dirty, black marks at the steps, missing tiles etc. The only good thing an amazing breakfast, except the coffe comes out of a machine.... For the price absolutley not recommendable, not a good location. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Awesome Experience and an overall Superb time in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: sigourney_19
Reviews.Content: I have just landed in the UK after spending a week in Rome with my family and friends. We all had a fantastic time, in which the hotel played a major part. The hotel is located 20 minutes away from central Rome, which means the major attractions are easily accessible. Also the tram line and bus stop is allocated right outside the hotel so getting into central Rome is very quick. I would be more than happy to go back to Rome and stay in this incredible hotel again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome as it has: a spa, which we used twice; a roof top garden, which has a great view and is good to catch some rays and has a bar area that is good to relax in after lots of sightseeing. The hotel staff at Trilussa hotel are amazing, as they are extremely helpful and are always on hand to answer any queries from where how to get to a location to where to eat. Our stay at Trilussa was made extra special thanks to: Paolo, Max and Silvia as they were more than happy to fulfil our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, hotel and experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sukhi_Gill
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome for a weeks break with family and friends, and it was amazing, There is so much to see and do in the city. The hotel I stayed at was located 20 mins from the centre, walkable distance from any tourist attraction. The hotel staff are all very friendly, and helpful in providing information about transportation (bus and tram stops are a minute walk from the hotel) and locations. I would recommend the hotel, as there is a roof top garden, which is great for working on your tan. A spa, which includes; a sauna, steam room and a jacuzzi (available for private use). An hour in the spa makes you feel relaxed and rejuvinated after a day out walking in the city. Max, Paolo and Silvia (three of the hotel staff) are hot and extremly helpful. They were always very friendly and provided any information about the restaurants and local bars. Rome is a great city, full of good food, bars, tourist attractions (which i remcommend a tour guide for). A city I would definatly return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and had a fantastic time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Raj-Gill
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome for a week with family and friends. We had a great time site-seeing etc, the staff were very helpful with information about locations and transportation. The hotel is sitauated about 20 minutes walk from central Rome, but the tram/bus stops are literally on the door step and will take you to "Argentina" which is a good location to walk from for other bus stops or other locations i.e. Colloseum. The vatican city is also very close to the hotel and can you can walk in about 45 minutes or it is 15 minutes in a taxi. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends if they are planning on coming to Rome, the staff are very helpful, breakfast has a good range as well. We also booked ourselves into the spa twice, we had private use of the jacuzzi area, steam room and sauna. They also have a gym and you can book massage etc which I would definitely recommend. The location of the hotel is excellent and local nearby restaurants/supermarkets are reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Please come and stay @ the trilussa palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: dipesh_j_parmar
Reviews.Content: This is a place you do not want to miss out on. the service, rooms, breakfast and the spa are amazing. Our group liked the spa so much we went twice. Any request we asked for was adhered to. I would recommend this hotel anyone whom wishes to come to rome and to enjoy location, Tranquillity (THE WELL BEING CENTRE) and in general a wicked time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty happy with the Trilussa Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteelersFan27
Reviews.Content: We had a great time while we were in Rome and were very satisfied with this hotel. The woman who checked us in was extremely friendly and helpful and gave us a lot of good information for getting around to the main attractions in Rome. We booked a double superior room which was plenty of space for just the two of us, but it was still on the smallish side when you're used to American hotels. The room was clean, although there were a few ants in the room, which I'm sure they would have taken care of if we had asked. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning felt fantastic after a hot, sweaty day of walking around Rome in August! The shower was tiny, but that's to be expected in Europe I think. The tram and bus stops right outside the hotel were easy to use. I'm sure alot of the main sights in Rome could be within walking distance (a long walk), but we did so much walking once we got to them that we used public transportation whenever possible!! Breakfast each morning was very good with a little bit of everything. The neighborhood directly surrounding the hotel seemed fine, but it's about a 15-20 minute walk to get to the main piazza in Trastevere or it's an easy tram ride. We went down there for dinner most evenings and really enjoyed all of our meals. Get off at the last tram stop before the river and there are a ton of little places to eat along the side streets. It was a really fun, vibrant neighborhood at night! I would recommend staying at the Trilussa as long as you don't mind being a bit of a distance away from the main historical attractions. We were happy with our choice despite it not being the most convienent for sightseeing. It was nice to be out of tourist central by the end of each day and the Trilussa was a great place to come "home" to. Rome is an intense city, but we discovered that it's a lot more manageable with a long lunch, bottle of wine, and maybe a siesta each day:)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sulmona2010
Reviews.Content: Our air-conditioned room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious, and we especially enjoyed our morning cappuccino. The concierge was very helpful, making a phone call for us when we lost our camera while shopping, and calling for taxis as we needed. A computer was available for our use, and free wireless internet. On our last night in Rome, we ate at the rooftop restaurant. It had a beautiful view of the city, and the food and wine were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great rooms, easy access to historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: johnaweiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Trilussa in Trastevere for our family vacation in Rome (with college-age children). The staff were extremely helpful in planning our daily activities. The rooms are clean and the beds are quite comfy - mattresses are of heavy foam, and we all slept well. The hotel is walking distance from the center of Trastevere, so our children could walk down to the active night life after dinner and take a taxi back to the hotel. We would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value in a wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: tvr-280i
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean and elegant. The Trilussa Palace had good sized rooms and a friendly staff. Busses and the tram run right outside the front door. This would be the first place I will book on a return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! Terrific receptionists and staff, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mayfiel511
Reviews.Content: I will be going back! was unsure of this hotel at first because the location is off of the beaten path but I now love that it was. The reception there was wonderful. I went with my mom and grandmother, neither of whom had been to Rome and the reception and staff dealt with all of my grandmother's many, and often, "suspicious" questions (she is up in age) with ease and grace and made her not only feel comfortable but very special! We also found a great local restaurant one tram stop up. It was a great retreat at the end of long days out walking. Beautiful rooms, and though the showers were quite small and the drainage a bit slow, they had steam units, drenching rain shower heads, hand held shower heads, back jet streams, a radio and a seat to sit through it all. The roof garden restaurant view was gorgeous and the food good, though the menu was very limited. I will definitely be coming back to Trilussa Congress and Spa and referring it to others! FYI, Many of the local venues/restaurants were closed for August, which is very common in Italy, so I could tell that the neighborhood would be a bit more bustling in another season. I look forward to going back then too:) Many Thanks to all the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: HolidayMaker2772
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my girlfriend, hotel was extremely easy to get to from Fuimicino airport, took 45 mins from airport to the hotel using the train and tram at a cost of 8 euros, definitely preferential to a long and expensive taxi. The tram stop outside the hotel is perfect, never waited more than 5 minutes for a tram and they are very cheap (most Romans seemed not to pay or swipe a card at all). The tram takes you right into the centre of the City, within a few minutes of the Pantheon. If you prefer to walk, it took us 40 mins to walk to the Vatican and about the same to the city centre. We didn't eat in the hotel as Trastavere has too many osterias/trattorias to choose from, and the atmosphere eating outside in one of the small Piazzas is much better. The breakfast in Trilussa was fine - standard continental style. One complaint.. the showers are simply not big enough to shower in! They have a seat that prevents you standing up, and you can't even sit on it as your knees then bang against the shower screen. Not good after a day walking around the city! If you can cope with that then the hotel is otherwise perfect for the price. I used the gym, it has a running machine, rower, a multigym weights machine that I couldn't figure out, and 2 small dumbells, so not massive but fine for a workout. There is no water fountain so take a bottle of water, it is next to the spa so very hot and humid! Finally, our room faced the street, but we had no problems with noise, and the roof bar is indeed a lovely place for a drink at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, triple room lovely, tram outside for easy access”
Reviews.Author: perrykha
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Rome staying at the Trilussa Palace. Room very comfortable. Hotel does deserve its four star rating. A nice touch is you can actually request your own pillow! Due to neck problems I am now used to a memory foam pillow which was immediately sent to my room on request. There are four different pillows to choose from. Air conditioning in room was 24 hr - which in 34 degree heat was a necessity! Had a late flight back so hotel permitted us to use the spa area with shower to change. All staff are extremely courteous and speak English. Very convenient as tram stop is outside. Two stops along and there are countless restaurants down cobbled streets to a square where the locals like to eat. Half the price of main Rome. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lots of facilities”
Reviews.Author: UkBrighton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Trastevere area, 10 minutes walk from streets full of wonderful bars and restaurants- we would recommend staying in this area as it is buzzing at night. the hotel was quiet though and was the best night's sleep I've had in a hotel as the room was quiet and dark and the bed comfy. The staff was discreet but very friendly and we were welcomed with lots of useful information at check in. The hotel were v helpful with requests I had via email before our stay too. Lovely roof terrace, reasonably priced for drinks compared with in town prices. Room was quite small (superior room) and my only one small gripe would be no coathangers that could hang strappy tops or trousers! So had to hang my clothes on back of chair. Shower in room nice though with steam facility and jets. No bath though. Breakfast was nice, juice always very sour but lots of choice and a beautiful breakfast room. We had a spa deal included in price, having the spa (plunge pool, jacuzzi, steam room, sauna etc) to the two of us for an hour plus massages, this was amazing and would recommend doing this if you are staying there. Free internet in lobby and we also got welcome drink on arrival. If you look on hotel website you can get deals and prices that include all these things. They even provided shower area in the spa for us to freshen up on our last day when we went back to collect our bags several hours after checking out, which was nice of them. If you are an able walker you can walk to the centre in 15- 20 minutes and we walked all over the centre including to the Vatican and the Colloseum from the hotel, did not get any trams at all over the few days- it is do able if you don't mind walking. We also did a fun half day cooking course at LaFate restaurant just down road from hotel- great fun and would definitely recommend for learning simple Italian cooking! We would stay here again as it was friendly with good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The staff could not have been more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Mike01965
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a very convenient location only a couple of minutes away from the centre of Rome by tram. Lots of very good restaurants close by. The room albeit a little small for a family room was very clean and well furnished. Breakfast was included and was great. The big highlight was how helpful the staff were - offering advice on what to do and see and how best to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Trastevere District”
Reviews.Author: jiffydog75
Reviews.Content: A great find, located in Trastevere. A very convenient location - the tram stop is just outside the front door, making it easy to get anywhere in Rome. The hotel is quite nice. The rooms are kept very clean and are quite big by European standards. The furniture is nice and the beds were comfortable. We were very happy with it. The breakfast buffet is very good and a great way to start the day. The rooftop garden was lovely. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. All in all, a wonderful stay, and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Chian80
Reviews.Content: What a find in Rome! Located in Trastevere, a very convenient location to get anywhere in Rome. The area of the hotel is nothing spectacular, but the area further towards the center is great! Amazing restaurants - we always had our dinners there as they were much more authentic and non-touristy, and the prices were amazing! Great dinner for two with wine for 40 euros! The hotel itself is simple and nice. The rooms are kept meticulously clean, the bed as comofrtable as my own at home. The room is a great size for european standards. The furniture is nice, with hardwood flooring throughout. I was very happy with it. The breakfast is good, and I would recommend it, as it is filling (they serve eggs - rare in italy for breakfast!). All in all, a wonderful stay, with polite concierge/reception.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: KateandTed
Reviews.Content: We had a family room (two adjoining doubles) that were comfortably furnished and quiet even on the street side. Choice of pillows added to sleep quality. Breakfasts were really nice with a good choice in the buffet and friendly, discrete service. The all essential first cappuccini of the morning were made with care from the proper coffee machine in the bar - nice touch. Like most I guess we were in Rome to see the sights and found the tram into the centre (6 or 7 stops) a great starting point - it stops at the front of the hotel and for €4 each you can pick up a day ticket at the tobaccionists a couple of doors down that gives you run of the eternal city's handy public transport. The local Trastevere area has it's own charm and we ate locally most evenings - there are plenty of genuine and charming restaurants. It felt safe and would like to have had more time for exploring. The service by all members of staff was good, housekeeping was invisibly efficient. The rooftop bar was pleasant enough but pricey for an OK view. The pool and spa are pretty expensive options on exclusive-use hourly hire which we knew about in advance but all the same it was a pity to be so close to a pool you couldn't just dip into. On balance a comfortable and convenient option which definitely added to our enjoyment of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great service, comfortable sleep!location so-so”
Reviews.Author: 4greatkds
Reviews.Content: spent a week in hotel and was mostly satisfied. the staff is so helpful in every way. they made everything so easy and pleasant. the rooms are nice, beds very comfortable and the a/c , once i asked to have the front adjust it lower, was good. the office controls the temp of a/c. breakfast very good and many choices, and staff was great in making us our decaf cappocino and espressos. the location i think is the biggest drawback. yes the tram is outside door, but it only goes certain places. then you have to switch generally to a train or a bus. and to get from tram to anywhere is lots! of walking, lots!! so we walked, trammed, bussed, metroed, taxid. i think we walked about 10 miles everyday!!i would stay closer to center of city next time. and trastevere is not a beautiful looking neighorhood. it is a working area with a bunch of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff with that bit extra”
Reviews.Author: lifebeginsatforty
Reviews.Content: Although there wasn't much in the immediate vicinity of the Hotel historic Rome is about 20 - 30 mins walk to or jump on the tram right outside the hotel (for 1 Euro). Staff spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful and friendly. Good buffet breakfast. Although our bedroom faced on to the main street the noise did not prevent me sleeping. This may have been because of the massive amount of walking or the wonderful memory foam mattress and pillows. Shower needed a bit of a degree to work but when learned offered a turkish bath facility too. We had the Spa package which gave us exclusive use of Spa - A lovely romantic special treat. Afterwards we have a massage as part of the package which was extremely welcome for tired bodies. There is a lovely roof terrace. Trastevere is 15min walk for great places to eat (Via de Cinque in particular). Hired a Vespa scooter which was a giggle if not a bit hairy at times but was great way to see more of Rome. Would drive a car though. Hotel was perfect for us

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SylviaWaterford
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights last week and had a wonderful time. The rooms (we had a superiror - room 110) were a fine size by european standards and the beds (memory foam mattress) were oh so comfortable - a great nights sleep. This hotel is in trastevere , While we were 10 minutes from city centre by tram - the tram stopped right outside the hotel and we rarely had to wait more than 2/3 minutes for one to come along - a great way to travel. Also, we walked home from Campo Di Fiori / Pantheon / Piazza Navona every night and it still only took 20 minutes .. I would highly recommend this hotel - one slight fault was the coffee at breakfaast was from a machine and terrible - but don't let that put you off - the staff at the front desk were excellent and the porters were very obliging - one thing you should definitely do is book a spa package or hire the spa for an hour during your stay - its absolutely lovely.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel completely.”
Reviews.Author: NickyHopkins
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, well maintained and appointed, staff unfailingly helpful and courteous, great location (Trastevere), convenient to public transportation. No complaints whatsoever. Would and hopefully will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “tired, needs repairs--don't be fooled by 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl077
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled to Italy multiple times and have stayed in many wonderful hotels. The hotel that we originally booked was "oversold" and we were taken here for the night. The room was dark-lamp didn't work--furniture was ripped--window did not close properly and we were on a busy street---we heard the noise from the street all night. It is not in a very nice or convenient area. The 4 star rating is not related to quality--it is related to services--ie if you have a restaurant with the hotel, you get a higher star rating. Hence, a 2 star hotel can be better than a 4.. It is a tired, not well-cared for hotel and needs a facelift. However, the front desk employees were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This was my last hotel stay in Italy and my "splurge" that was a bust!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaSandy
Reviews.Content: If this is a 4-star hotel they hide it well. Great location and clean but that's the best I can report. Otherwise it was the highest priced and lowest value lodging we experienced in our 2 1/2 week trip through Italy. The service is deplorable and I have a hand-written employee note substantiating same. We could not get a few extra hangers [2 requests], a phone that worked [until we complained twice], a working TV, proper directions [we missed a Vatican museum tour US $143.00 using their directions], help with dining reservations [only a note explaining our contact 'forgot' about our request], or even room service, again after nearly begging! Adding insult to injury, I used their taxi reservation service, heeding the advice I needed to leave for airport at 7:15 am for an 11:00 am departure which proved to be a needlessly tiring and unnecessarily long wait at airport. There must be better choices and I will find them next time! One last note: bring your own kleenex, none here!

Reviews.Title: “Viva la Roma!”
Reviews.Author: bleachness
Reviews.Content: Our original arrival date was delayed by two days due to snowstorms in the northeast. We contacted the hotel and they held our reservation without penalty and extended our checkout date at the original reservation rate. when we finally arrived, they knew who we were and upgraded our room for us (I think they knew we were exhausted not from the travel time, but the efforts taken to actually get us there considering the weather restrictions). The hotel is lovely and clean. It's small, but cozy, and all you really could need if you plan on seeing the city. The employees were wonderful, helped out with sightseeing plans, transportation and meal suggestions. Lorena Roman, the manager of the hotel was constantly present and extremely accommodating. For personal reasons, I won't go into detail, but she helped out with a last minute request due to some personal problems. We were only there a week, but because of the wonderful location (so close to the city, and a charming, neighborood area), we will definitely stay there again. If you are looking for a small, clean, charming place to stay that is off the beaten path, but close enough to walk or a short train hop to the city, then the Trilussa Palace is for you. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bed, great shower, good location...”
Reviews.Author: azejo
Reviews.Content: We booked on the hotel website and managed to get a special deal simply by reading the 'specials' and following the instructions! Our deal included free airport transfer, breakfast, a room upgrade, 1 dinner for 2, use of the spa, and 10% off other hotel facilities vouchers. We were met at the airport, no problems. On arrival the receptionist did not give us a detailed check in, and was not very informative. The porter who carried our bags to our room was far more vocal in his explanation of the shower. We believe we were upgraded to a junior suite, having read other reviews on this site, and were delighted by the cleanliness, the fabulous sleep and balcony. Breakfast was average, in fact we only drank tea / coffee on 2 mornings... it could be improved with a selection of fresh fruits, a larger variety of breads/ cheeses/ hams... but there was nothing to complain about, and what was available was edible. The dinner we ate in the restaurant was fabulous, it's only a shame about the atmosphere as we were the only couple from our main course onwards, background music would have made a difference! Drinks (beers and spirits) in the bar were ridiculously expensive, a bottle of wine we ordered was delicious and value for money. We would recommend you utilise your minibar over using the hotel bar. What a treat the spa offered - there was a special offer for weekend guests in the lift, so for E40 each we had a 30 minute massage and 30 minute private use of the spa - definitely recommeded after sore feet from wandering Roman Streets! Our 2nd spa experience was a free offer we received with the reservation - and that was one of the most perfect hour's of our trip to Rome. The number 3 bus took us to the Colloseum, tram 8 to the centre of Rome - everything was walkable from there. The staff in the hotel were very good at answering queries, however weren't forthcoming in suggestions. On check-out we were given vouchers we should have received at the start of our stay - which was a little poor (as we'd known about them we'd made the most of them). Reception could polish their act up, there could be an information bundle in the rooms detailing the hotel's facilities, but this is really just me picking holes for the hotel to improve - not things that disrupted our stay. I must mention the Gastro restaurant (turn left on leaving the hotel - 1 block) - fabulous food and well priced - if you don't fancy going far and discovering Rome at night eat there! All in all a fabulous stay - thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fabulous service - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Paddywagon1
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ideally located 10 mins from centre of town on tram. tram stop outside front door, service second to none, again as in previous reviews, paolo exceptional with help regarding directions etc and that smile!! hotel room well appointed , comfortable bed,very clean.Within walking distance to trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mulder52
Reviews.Content: Just back from weekend stay in Rome with mother & sister and give a double thumbs up to the Trilussa Palace. Service even prior to arrival was great. While had booked hotel via 3rd party, I contacted the hotel to see if would be possible to arrange connecting rooms for our stay - and in the blink of an eye they confirmed change in rooms. Also arranged pick up from the airport. Found staff friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The location of the hotel is ideal. Being a little out from the city you can get away from the hustle and bustle if you need a break after a day of sightseeing - but it is also just a 10 minute tram ride from the centre (no 8 tram stops just outside hotel brings you straight to centre). Rooms that we stayed in had a little balconies, which i think was same with all rooms. Clean rooms with plenty of room. No issue with noise either from within hotel or from the streets outside. Very comfy beds,,,,,perfect to relax after a day's walk around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous helpful staff. An real gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: momsvisiting
Reviews.Content: We just returned from vacation in Europe. My girlfriend and I stayed for 5 nights at your hotel while we visited my son who is going to John Cabot University and enjoyed all that Rome has to offer. We just wanted to say we had a lovely experience staying there. The location was ideal. But as important, we have to say that the staff was wonderful. Paolo, from the front desk was kind and helpful and always smiling. He was eager to be of any assistance with directions or restaurant suggestions or with any hotel requests. He is very good at his job and hopefully you will pass on our compliments. Also, Salvetore' who was managing the bar and other restaurant responsibilities was a pleasure. He was knowledgeable of the wines he poured for us and was interesting to talk to. He also was wonderful to the guests and an excellent representative of the Trilussa Palace. We thoroughly enjoyed being guests at the Hotel. We will recommend it to our friends! Please send our best greetings to the staff that we have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “A place that bent over backward to make sure our stay was positive”
Reviews.Author: hookfree
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 7:30 am after flying all night from Philadelphia. From the moment we arrived, this staff went out of their way to accommodate us. They got us in our room early, helped us arrange english travel guides for our young daughters, helped us book a room in Florence (only later to help us clarify the rate of the room would be in dollars, rather than euros). Honestly, this staff probably gave us 2 hours of undivided attention----service which is usually only found at 4 or 5 star. Room was very comfortable, breakfast was surprisingly good and the staff was perhaps the best I have ever run into. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sam82Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and thought it was fab! The staff are all very helpful and polite and speak good english. The interiors are pretty and quaint and the rooms clean and bright. All in all great value for for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful staff, in a great location !”
Reviews.Author: civciv46
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Trilussa for 5 nights, and were delighted with everything. When we arrived we found that the staff had upgraded us to a Junior Suite as it was my friend's birthday that day. The room wasn't enormous but perfectly adequate and nicely furnished, the best thing being the incredible memory foam mattresses, sooooo comfortable. Bathroom had very funky shower with a variety of settings which included jets in every direction, and a nice touch was the radio in the shower. Double glazing was very effective, the room was quiet despite overlooking a busy street. The staff were fantastic, so helpful, nothing was too much trouble, they always had a smile and went out of their way to help.Breakfasts were brilliant, loads of choice - cereals, yogurt, scrambled eggs, bacon, cheeses, ham, vast array of cakes and pastries and a selection of bread and rolls and all sorts of coffees and teas and juices available. The location of the hotel is great, we particularly wanted to stay near Trastevere and we weren't disappointed. Central Trastevere is easily reached on foot in 15 minutes, or in 5 minutes by bus or tram from the stops outside the hotel, it has a huge charm with its cobbled streets, great cafes, restaurants and shops and of course the beautiful church of Santa Maria de Trastevere. Our favourite restaurants in the immediate vicinity were La Fate which is only about 600 metres from the hotel and Sale e Pepe which is a little further on. La Fate had a wonderful ambiance, and fantastic food. The chef Andrea runs cookery classes which we did and what a great day it was, we were a group of 8, and learned to cook all sorts of things we had never done before, then all sat down to devour them with a selection of wonderful wines to complement each course, - highly recommended! Sale e Pepe was great too, incredibly friendly, on our 2nd and 3rd visits we were greeted like old friends and shown to what had become 'our' table! Marvellous pasta dishes, yummmmm. Wouldn't hesitate to stay at Trilussa again, everything is very easily accessible from there with the frequently running buses and trams that stop outside the hotel. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: AC8580
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights for a suprise 30th birthday holiday for him. We stayed in a Junior Suite (519) and we were very impressed. From some of the reviews i had read on here previous to our trip i wes expecting the room to be small but it was perfect for us. We had a Super King size bed and the mattress was so comfy it ensured every night we had a great nights sleep. The room was very clean and decorated very well. There was also a large sofa (which converted to a bed) and a good size bathroom. We even had a small balcony.Towels and bedding were changed everday, the only minor issue we had was we found the room to be very warm (there was air con in room which we could not get to work but we did not bother asking reception but if we did i am sure they would have been very helpful.) Breakfast was fine with yoghurts, fruits, cereals, pastries and some hot food such as eggs and bacon. Whenever we asked any of the staff help with directions, transport or excursions they were extremly helpful and their English was also very good. The number 8 tram which stops outside the hotel takes you straight to Largo di torre Argentina which is fairly central and from there we walked to Pantheon, Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps and Piazza Navona. We also decided to walk from Largo di Argentina to Vatican City which was very straight forward and took about 20min. From outside the hotel we also took the number 3 bus to right outside the collosseum. We paid 16 Euros each to enter Colloseum and this was entrance fee, audio guide and skipping most of the que. We did eat lunch in Piazza Navona in a restaurant called Dolce Vita and had just a Pizza each and a large bottle of Water. This came to about 30 Euros but it was very very good. In the evenings we stayed in the Trastevere area to eat we never went out to eat before 9pm but there are so many little alleys with restaurants you are spoilt for choice. We had a fantastic starter and Pasta each at a little restaurant that i think was called De Otello and i had a litre of House wine for 8 Euros i would highly reccomend this restaurant Great food, Great atmosphere and Great prices. The restaurants in the Trastevere area seem to be much cheaper than elsewhere. On our last night we went to a Place called la Scala the food was great however that night my boyfriend was violently sick all night and we put it down to the beef as that was the only thing he ate that i did not and i was fine. He was that ill that if it was not for our little boy back home we would have paid to stay an extra night and paid for flights later in the week when he was better. I had never seen him so sick and 2 days later he is still recovering!!! Tip If you go to St Peters Basillica and climb the dome be aware you have a choice of paying 7Euros and getting a lift then climbing around 321 steps or paying 5Euros and climbing 550. With my boyfriend being such a fitness freak he decided we should climb them all. After about 300 steps it starts to become very very narrow and quite claustrophobic. As you get higher up the dome the walls start to slant to the side so as you are climbing the stairs you are not even upright you are leaning to the right and using the wall as guidance as it is not very well lit. As you get nearer the top because most people who are ahead of you are tired you can end up walking up the stairs at a very slow pace, some people actually realised they did not want to carry on and stopped on the stairs but it is that narrow you can barely get passed. The last bit of the climb is up a very narrow spiral staircase which has a rope down the middle for you to hold on to but once you eventually get there you will see the views are totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marlinKent
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel, ideally located, friendly staff, immaculate rooms - definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, excellent location, good breakfast - room a bit small”
Reviews.Author: AndreaNathan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night - my wife and I with our two week old son. I was extremely pleased overall. The staff could not have been friendlier or more eager to help with our every request. The room, tastefully furnished in a classical style, was well-maintained and clean. Be aware that the rooms are small - knowing this, we chose the junior suite which at 135 euros cost only 20 euros more than the standard matrimonial (I got this price by calling the hotel, the official prices on the internet were higher, and of course it's the off season which helps) , but even the suite was pretty small - just one room, not really what I'd call a suite, and probably smaller than a standard room in an American hotel. But if you don't plan on spending much time in your room you won't mind. The buffet breakfast was much more abundant than is usual in Italian hotels. Location is excellent for downtown Rome - a few stops on the tram and you are at Largo Argentina right in the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spa package and great location”
Reviews.Author: Doris49
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to be near all the less expensive and more authentic bars and restaurants, as long as you don't mind using the public transport (trams/buses) to get to the main tourist spots. If you want to stay next to the Colosseum or Vatican then expect to pay more for the hotel, and eating out. There is a tram stop (number 8), and bus (number 3) that stops just outside the hotel so we found it very convenient, easy and incredibly cheap to get around - especially if you get a 3 day pass (11 euros) from the small shop a couple of blocks to the left of the hotel. Most sights are within walking distance from the end of the tram line. The highlight of our 3 day stay was a visit to the spa in the hotel which included private use of the spa itself for an hour (whirlpool, steam room, sauna), a bottle of processo and 2 x 50 minute massages - all of which were excellent and a great way to end our trip. Upon arrival we were greated by the Paulo who was very friendly and helped us plan our stay. We were also able to check in at 11am which was great after our early morning flight. The breakfast buffet was good (not excellent) but had good coffee and is generally on a par with what you will get in most European hotels. The hotel IS a 4 star by European standards, but don't expect the rooms to be as large as what you will find in America or outside most of Europe. If on a budget - don't sit down in bars/cafe's that serve food as it's cheaper to eat/drink standing by the counter. We found that a lot of places that sold great panini's didn't serve good pasta if you sat down to eat it (we heard a microwave being used so didn't eat like that ever again). The prices of drinks and food vary a great deal, with the most expensive cappuccino being 7.50 euros near the Spanish Steps (in Babbington's tea rooms). It's always cheaper to drink house wine by the quarter/half/litre than a bottle, and it tastes really good too. The best places we found to eat were in Trastevere by Santa Maria. Tip - getting to and from the airport is easy and much cheaper by train than taxi. If you're coming in from FCO then go to the train station (follow signs from the arrivals lounge) and get a train to Trastevere. Then get the number 8 tram just outside the train station (direction Argentina) for a few stops to the hotel. Be aware of pick pockets, and make sure you validate your train ticket by putting it in the machines before getting on the train/tram etc.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: epicroman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights on our vacation to Rome. As for the beatiful city, we really enjoyed our staying and we reccomened it for your vacations in Rome. As soon as we walked in we noticed a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and the staff has been helpfull during our whole staying. The rooms are high quality and there also is a SPA center which is great, especially after walking the whole day visiting the city. It provides a bath tub, a fitness center, a sauna, a turkish bath and the opportunity for massages and treatments. The roof garden is very relaxing and it provides a marvellous view of the city, we loved to sit there for "apertivo" around 6pm, enjoying the italian lifestyle. The hotel is situated in Trastevere, an excellent spot to visit the city, and it is also very well connected to the main touring sites. In the aerea there are many opportunities also for nightlife, bars and shopping. The overall four stars are all owned by this structure, which has a very good standards and services. Concluding, we definetly recommend this hotel, and we ll definetly come back the next time we ll be back in Rome. AC

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: LJIowa
Reviews.Content: We reserved at the last minute and got a pretty good rate, but they put us in the absolute worst room they had. At least I hope there were not others worse. We were on the top floor and the ceiling in the bathroom leaked constantly. I complained about the water to at least three staff members and no one even came to look at it. I suspect the person that put us there knew about the leak when he gave us the room. There was incredible noise from the rooftop garden. Imagine dragging furniture and cinder blocks down a ventilating shaft with a 100 foot anchor chain. That is something like the noise in our room we experience half the nights we were there. If you stay there - check out the room BEFORE you give them credit card information. I do like this area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: irfanTX
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at a group rate. The hotel is very convenient to access from the Trastevere train station (train from the airport), using the tram. There's a tram stop and bus stops right by the hotel, which makes it easy to get to Termini station or connect with other buses/trains. A couple of restaurants and tobacco shops in the area, and many more within a short walk. The reception staff were friendly and efficient, and the housekeeping keeps the hotel spottlessly clean. Tha single bed was comfortable. Room size was OK by European standards. The breakfast buffet has cooked eggs, meats, ceral and pastries, but the coffee is instant. Overall a good place to stay -- I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa is the best hotel in all of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TheGrandTourist
Reviews.Content: This recent visit was our third since 2007. Each year we return, we find the hotel is bright and clean, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the food is fantastic and plentiful. In fact, I have booked three professional conventions (85 to 100 persons each) at this hotel and have had no problems at all. The staff handles large groups as efficiently as they do a single person or a married couple. They offer first-class service to everyone at half the price of all the other four-star hotels in Rome. I have stayed in more than a dozen hotels throughout Rome since my first visit in 1989. Believe me, you will not find better, cleaner and friendlier accommodations anywhere in the Eternal City. Please feel free to mention my name if you like. They know me well.

Reviews.Title: “I have never been so well treated before at a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bella081
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel originally for its location as it was close to my daughter's apartment who was studying abroad in Rome. I was most impressed with the staff at this hotel. Both Paulo and Sergio at the reception desk were incredibly friendly, professional and helpful. The restaurant and housekeeping staff were also very friendly. The rooms were very nice and very sound proof which was great because the hotel was close to a busy street. The breakfast buffet was very good and the evening lounge area/ was very comfortable. It was the peole at this hotel that helped make my trip the best ever. I would recommed this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience and great choice”
Reviews.Author: touristinRome
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because i had previously read great reviews about it. Some of my friends had also stayed at the hotel and went on to mention that they also had great experiences with their stay. Location is excellent to downtown Rome and very close to all tourist attractions with a hop, skip and a jump to all major sites. Restaurants are wonderful and greatly priced. Best part about the hotel was the Spa located in the hotel. Also, the bus stop is directly in front of the hotel taking you to directly to the Coliseum, can't beat that! The Staff at the Hotel is wonderful too, especially Paolo who was very helpful at Reception and informative on everything regarding Rome, tourist attractions, bus times, airport shuttles....etc. When we arrived they were very welcoming and gave us a great room in a short time. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be going back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: CyrusL
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the highlight of this hotel. Though slightly small, our room was very well appointed, extremely quiet, and had a great bed in a country where beds can be problematic. The bathroom was an appropriate size and featured gorgeous marble flooring. The Dr. Evil shower (see picture) was the most sophisticated shower we encountered in Italy.
