It had a standard sliding shower head, an overhead shower, and jet spray in addition to a radio and some sort of sauna mode. My wife insisted that I figure it out first. I might give this hotel five stars but we needed to fill one extra day in Rome on short notice and therefore paid €250 for one night, a value / price proposition that only merits four stars. Plus the internet was not free, though after chiding them about being a four star hotel and pointing out the price I was paying, they did give me free internet; however the WiFi only worked in the lobby area. This hotel and our room face a large intersection, one that is rather charmless in a city where beauty is nearly everywhere. If you are staying for a few days this could be a bit of a letdown. However, the tram line does run conveniently past the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard and functional”
Reviews.Author: EllisEngland
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this hotel. We had booked to stay in Trastevere as we had read that it was picturesque and thought it would be a nice quiet wind-down to a busy 10 day sightseeing tour of Italy. We did not think it was pictureseque at all unless the reviewer is referring to the massive amounts of graffiti everywhere. We felt the area was rather run-down. That is, of couse, not the fault of the hotel. The hotel was very conveniently located for the tram service, which we took full advantage of, to travel back across the River Tiber. The hotel itself smelt a bit odd upon arrival, as did the room, I wonder if that is something to do with the spa at the hotel. The spa looked nice, however, it was expensive to use which meant that we didn't use it. I couldn't see that the rates of the spa were on the website. We had booked the hotel because we had wanted to use the spa, but it was expensive which could be made a bit clearer on the website. The hotel room was small, clean and functional with a balcony. The bathroom had a very impressive shower with lots of jets and a radio, which we liked although the bathroom did smell a bit odd but we did get used to it. One of the members of staff was very helpful and showed us where to visit. It is an added bonus if the staff are helpful, we did not find the other members of staff particularly helpful. I think this is probably a hotel for business use and as leisure travellers, I got the impression we weren't quite the clients they wanted, but the attitude of the staff may not affect other people who want to stay here.The hotel does have a nice rooftop bar which we liked. You can see a long way although the view is not very nice but again, this is not the hotel's fault. This hotel was ok but we were a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very neat hotel. Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MancBaldMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Palace hotel from 4th-7th October 2009. We found our stay very pleasant indeed. The staff were wonderful and polite, especially Paolo who we found to be very friendly and informative. The hotel is situated in the Trastevere area of Rome, not too far from the river Tiber and has a tram stop opposite. There is easy access from there to all the main attractions like the colosseum and vatican city. The room was very neat, we were upgraded to a superior room due to the voucher that was purchased off eBay. There was a top of the range multi-shower and the bed had a memory foam mattress which made our nights very comfortable. Breakfast was nice in the downstairs restaurant, and we did eat in the roof garden restaurant using one of our vouchers to claim a 3 course meal for 2 people. It was very average and i definately would'nt pay to eat up there considering the lovely restaurants which are situated in the Trastevere. All in all i would go back again. Paolo gave me a business card and told me if i was to go again to book directly at the hotel and i would be given a courtesy discount. I would recommend my relatives and closest friends to stay here. I would like to say Hello (Buongiorno) to Paolo. Hope you are well?

Reviews.Title: “Good price & fairly central but miniature room”
Reviews.Author: Tania_EU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to locate and offers an underground parking service essential for Rome! Very near Trastevere (10-minute walk) and you can enter the Porta Portese market (Sundays) by crossing the road. Small, neat lobby with friendly and available staff. The room was on the ground floor and extremely small - couldn't really move around the bed - but clean and nicely decorated. Great features were the light in the wardrobe and the multi-function shower jets, although the water took ages to warm up and never really got hot. Didn't try out the roof garden cafè or the spa facilities (short trip) although they were offering an interesting spa/massage deal when we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace Hotel Trastevere Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: wtilford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trulissa and had a very nice room, about the size of most european rooms, not to large. We were very jet lagged and went right to the Spa and got a massage, then took a nap. We were refreshed and ready for Rome after that. The hotel and our room was very clean, with a modern shower and toilet. Across the street on Sunday morning is a vast and very interesting flea market. Dont miss is if you are there on a Sunday morning. The staff is helpful, with a good command of english. They had an above average breakfast included in our room price. There are many excelllent restaraunts nearby. Most are located near the Santa Maria Church square. The tram and buses go right by the hotel. You can also walk to Rome City center if you are energetic. The neighborhood seemed safe, we were out late and never felt like we had to worry. Many ATM machines within 3 blocs of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Surprised”
Reviews.Author: geokyr
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Rome for a few days with our two children. It's hard finding a hotel room with two double/queen sized beds. Trilussa offered that. They also offered an apartment style accomodation for slightly more. It was perfect. Clean, fully furnished, with plasma TV's in each bedroom and living and multiple air conditioners which kept the apartment nice and cool. We didn't have a need for the kitchen, but having a fridge was helpful. Great location, right on the bus line and in an area of Rome which has great restaurants. Staff was accomodating. Treetop terrace looked great. We didn't visit it at night when it was open. Only complaint was that our phone was not working in the room and they never did get it fixed (even though they came to look at it twice). If you're travelling with a family and need some space, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - nice, clean, near everything & has a SPA!!”
Reviews.Author: slpnbuety2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not one of the more known hotels. It is near everything - either by walking or taking the train which stops right in front of the hotel. There is a small garden rooftop which is very quiet and peaceful. The rooms have space and a fabulous showers! When I return to Rome, I will more than likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to exploring Romes sights”
Reviews.Author: CenturianofRome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Trilussa Palace Hotel from 15th to 20th August 2009. Cannot praise the Hotel and staff enough. We arrived about 11am and were given acces to our rooms straight away. The rooms were as you would expect. Well furnished. The bathroom had a multi jet shower. I want one!. The breakfast room was light, spacous and a relaxing place to eat. The breakfast was buffet style and had something for all ages. the staff were some of the most polite, friendly and helpful that I have met. I cannot praise them enought. From the receptionist, bel boy, waiters, waitresses to the cleaners. A big thank you for making our stay a memorable one. It is true to say the position of the hotel is not central but the transport links. Trams and buses were excellent and cheap. Both stopped directly outside the hotel. a 1 euro ticket could be purchased from reception which would give you 75 minutes travel on the tram or buses. Your 75 minutes would start when you first used the ticket. We then bought a three day ticket (11 Euros per person) covering all forms of transport in Rome ( Trams, Buses and the Metro) Word of warning, This is for three calender days. So if you first used the ticket and 10pm on say Monday, the ticket would expire Wednesday at midnight. In effect only two days. The number 8 tram would take you to the Piazza Argentina (End of the line) From there it was a short walk (5 mins) to the Pantheon. The number three bus would drop you off at the Colosseum. If you plan on visiting the Vatican City or the Colosseum then book your tickets online before you start you holiday. You can often find the tickets at a discounted rate, saving yourself some of your hard earned cash. we did this for the Colosseum and walked straight past the never ending queue, went to the reserved counter and picked up the tickets. We must have saved ourselves a good hours wait. We ate out every evening and Trestevera (get off the tram just before the bridge over the river Tiber. Then walk down the side streets on you left. You will find many family run restaurants serving great food at reasonable prices. Avoid places like Piazza Navona, where prices are sky high. Don't keep buyng bottles of water as there are hundreds of drinking water fountains all over Rome. Just keep filling you bottle up. If you want to buy anything from the souvineer sellers or shops then haggle the price. 99% of the time they will come down atleast 20%. Go on, have a haggle. Its fun. Once again, a big thanks to the staff at the Trilussa Palace Hotal. I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful city break”
Reviews.Author: andy-ski
Reviews.Content: My Fiance booked this hotel as a birthday surprise as we were visiting Italy for a holiday with Family. It was an excellent choice, the staff are excellent and attentive, the breakfast was excellent, and the roof top terrace bar and restaurant was lovely after a day out in Rome. We ate the Fish Grill there once and it was very nice, and good value considering this is quite a luxury hotel. My other birthday surprise was having the Spar centre privately booked to ourselves for a morning, they even made me a lovely birthday cake and some champagne. This is very relaxing, and just what we both needed. I feel very happy recommending this to anyone, the rooms are not the biggest you'll find, but for the price for eveything it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a great price”
Reviews.Author: QdogBocaRaton_FL
Reviews.Content: We loved the Trilussa Palace. It was clean, convenient and comfortable. The rooms (we had two - one for the kids) were ample size (small by U.S. standards, but not too small). The staff was great. The internet service was reliable and inexpensive, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was small but nice, the rooftop terrace was terrific, and the fitness room was small but serviceable. Use the trams to get into center Rome - extraordinarily convenient and inexpensive. We recommend the Trilussa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but bad administration”
Reviews.Author: iwannatravelmore82
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through ebay - there was this special offer that cost 299€ for 3 nights in a superior room, including breakfast and a 40€ voucher that could be used at the bar or minibar. That was probably the biggest mistake. We travelled with another couple friend, who had already bought the voucher. The hotel confirmed that if our friends have bought the voucher, we only had to pay the 299€ at the hotel upfront upon check-in. We agreed to that. Hence, we confirmed via email that we wanted to book 2 rooms. Turns out, the hotel was overbooked and there was only 1 room available when we arrived at 1am. We were flabbergasted. On email, it was very clear that we wanted 2 rooms. The hotel said that because we didn´t confirm our stay, they didn´t reserve the room for us. We did confirm our stay and in our email we said "we would like to confirm our stay for the period ....". He said that we should have put "for 2 rooms"...however there was a chain of emails attached and in this chain, it was obvious that we wanted 2 rooms. We had even sent our details - i.e. our names and addresses. We spent the first night sleeping on makeshift beds in the same room as our friends (4 of us)- really bad start to our stay. We were subsequently upgraded to a junior suite which was nice. However, upon checkout, the same confusion and frustration took place with the 40€ voucher. We used the voucher to empty our fridge (according to instructions from their staff). However when we wanted to pay, nobody claimed responsiblity for us emptying the fridge and they wanted us to make a list of things including the prices of these drinks that we have taken. Since there was an incomplete price list on the fridge, we were unable to do that. Manager / staff had no idea how to deal with the voucher, no idea what to tell us nor what to do. Our first and last impresion were ruined by the bad service of the hotel. Rule of thumb: don´t issue a voucher for which you have no idea how to use! Besides the breakfast was way below average for a 4-star hotel. No warm food, only the usual cold ham and cheese and ammenities. I would never go back to this hotel again. So ruined was my impression of this place.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunbartonConcord_nh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trilussa for 8 nights. We had a superb experience at the hotel beginning each day with a delicious breakfast and ending each day in our quiet and clean room. The entire hotel staff was always gracious and knowledgeable responding to our questions about the Roman sites. The Trilussa is the perfect hotel for a perfect Roman vacation.

Reviews.Title: “First rate stay with excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: lhiner3
Reviews.Content: Unlike other reviewers, we found our room to be quite adequately large for two people and suitcases. The newly-installed tukish bath / jet shower was entirely welcome after a long day of sightseeing. The rooftop restaurant did not have a particularly diverse menu, but the food and service were equal to the stunning view across the river to old Rome on the one night we dined there (other restaurants are in walking distance, or a short ride on the #8 trolley). Staff were always most accommodating, and most were quite conversant in English (for when we got past our own marginal capacity in Italian). We lucked into a summer special, and the inexpensive wi-fi from the lobby was reliable on the 1st floor as well. Spa services include hydrotherapy, turkish bath, and sauna, as well as experienced masseur/masseuse who topped off our last evening there in preparation for a long plane ride home. Not as convenient as some hotels to the center of Rome or the Vatican, but only a 10-20 minute public transit ride to most places (can be crowded at rush hour).

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Sera
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was always willing to help. In North American hotels we normally see kleenex boxes, body lotion, pads of paper and pens, iron and ironing board, etc. in our room - these were some of the missing things in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyrical_romance
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April. Hotel clean and comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good value for money. Only one complaint is that we found the room very small for two people. There was no where to put luggage so we had to put our cases in a corner which with it being a small room made the place look very cluttered. We also found the shower a bit small too, not much room to move in it. Another complaint was the wardrobe space not much space for two ladies staying for 5 nights and even though i brought about 4 or 5 hangers with me there was still not enough hangers for all our clothes. The hotel was lovely and the rooms were nicely decorated and spotless but really very small for two people. Ideally situated thought for all the tourist attractions. Even to take a taxi costs no more than about 10 euros. Beware of bogus taxi drivers at the bus station. Do not go with anyone aking you if you want a taxi when you ask them what it costs all they say is "it will be on the meter." On no account take those taxis unless they agree before hand a price. We were charged 48 euros for a ten minute taxi journey. The hotel told us that it should have been no more than 20 euros. So beware make sure you are in a numbered taxi so that if they rip you off you have the company name and the number of the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Could not fault. Hope to return.”
Reviews.Author: Wednesdaychild
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior family room with children of 16 and 14. The set-up was great - 2 lovely rooms with a private corridor connecting them and 2 bathrooms. LOVED the shower which also doubled as a sauna. The beds were very comfortable, there were safes in the rooms, and it was nice and quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Lovely buffet breakfast with a varied selection, some hot choices which was a bonus and good coffee, and it was never crowded. Very good transport links from right outside the hotel, so no concerns about not being bang in the centre. On arrival in Rome, we took the H bus from the Termini Station (need to buy tickets at tobbaconist before you board) which drops you right outside the hotel, and asked someone when to get off - though there are TV screens onboard showing you where you are. We ate out in Trastevere in the evenings - only about a 10 min walk. We felt safe, and found the restaurants to be good value. We also discovered a very nice ice cream shop. One of our highlights was having aperitifs, sitting in the swing seat on the roof terrace at the hotel. Great views and a very relaxing atmosphere. One tip is to carry ID for the children when out and about. Under 18s can get in free to some attractions, but you need to prove age. We used their EU medical cards, as we prefer not to carry passports around. We had a really great time In Rome and at the Trilussa and we definitely want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: centerfield14
Reviews.Content: Went to visit our daughter who was studying for the semester at the American University of Rome. Location was great, transportation was right outside the door and could take you anywhere in Rome in a short trip. Room was more than adequate and what the shower lacked in size it made up in luxury. Place was clean and service at the front desk was friendly and helpful. No complaints at all, just realize you can't compare to American locations. But would definitely recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: mrswilliams123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last year and had a great stay. We stayed in a superior double, which was pretty standard, space-wize, for an eurpoean city hotel room, but had a little balcony which was great. Bathroom was tiny but the shower was good. Beds were 'memory foam' and were very comfy, which is essential after long days exploring the city! The rooftop terrace was gorgeous and had great views of the city. Service was always excellent, naturally friendly and very well informed . The best thing about this hotel is the location, which is FAB! Trastevere is an amazing district in which to stay - it's out of the madness of the 'city centre' but there's a tram stop right outside the hotel which takes you right into the city in about 5 mins. The old part of Trastevere is stunning and has fantastic nightlife, great restaurants and bars, which are mostly reasonable (for Rome) and very firendly. All in all, a great place to stay and I would return in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....but shower in the gym!”
Reviews.Author: chumphris
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Room spotless, breakfast superb (open till 10.30am!). Whilst it is in Trastevere, the No 8 tram to Argentina is just outside the front door - then it's a 62 West bound to the Vatican, a 62 East bound to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The 3 bus from outside (replaces the 3 tram) goes to the Colisseum. The brilliant evening restaurants of Trastevere are a 4 tram stops away or to Argentgina again for central restaurants - use public transport it's great value - you can buy tickets at the front desk. Taxis are about 10 Euros to the centre. However, a few caveats: if, like me, you are larger than average (I'm 6' 4" and a 5XL) - you'll need to shower in the basement gym as there's more turning room! Don't get me wrong, I could still shower in the bathroom - it's a matter of comfort. If you want to eat on the Roof Garden, great view and soft breeze, then you must book at the front desk as the staff upstairs say "I'll see what I can do" which is a kind way of saying "No" - but I expected an answer! There's also no Tea/Coffee in the room but the mini bar had half bottles of wine at 3 Euros - very drinkable. I'd recommend it to anyone as it's so friendly and comfortable (despite the shower). As to Rome itself, forget the sights and stroll down the Via Giulia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: WullieMcMartin
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after the area of trastevere being recommended to us. Ideally located on the tram stop all the major sites are a tram and a small walk away. From the Trilussa we were able to visit all the major sites, coming back to a quiet and well kept hotel. After seeing the location of some of the other hotels, we were glad to be where we were. We are breakfast in the hotel a couple of times, the choice was varied and was very nice. There are also many nice restaurants further north near San Francesco Di Ripa, especially some traditional pizzerias. The rooftop bar is very nice although it was a bit cold when we were there. i'd imagine in the summer it'd be a nice way to end your days. Overall a very nice hotel, located in a quiet area suitable for siteseeing & exploring.

Reviews.Title: “terrible room”
Reviews.Author: omumgrm
Reviews.Content: Room could not fit 2 adults in reasonable comfort. No place for luggage resulting in stepping over luggage to reach W.C. Bathroom tiny and shower impossible to bend or twist. shower nozzle more like water pistol and temperature either blistering or ice No dresser for shirts, etc. management wanted an extra $300 for larger room, we declined 2 Lights didnt work and maintenance did not repair Look out for room size prior to confirming Breakfast and breakfast service very good

Reviews.Title: “I hope the Trilussa remains excellent so I can stay there again whenever I return to Roma!!!”
Reviews.Author: dukebludvl
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Trilussa in Trastevere. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was VERY convenient and it was nice to stay just outside of Roma across the river. There is a very convenient Tram $1euro each way (~10 minutes) to Rome (get off at end of that tram's track at ...Aregentina.... Or, you can catch a cab/taxi for reasonable fare and short time (about $8-$10 euro from hotel to San. Pietro / St. Peter's Square). The hotel was clean, in good condition, and well maintained. There is a nice rooftop terrace that is open for guests to access via elevator. Some room rates include a breakfast buffet in the hotel's restaurant. The breakfast is very good. It had a lot of items and the have both italian tastes and many american style breakfast items. taxi fare from FCO to the hotel is about $45 euro. I also liked the Trastevere area near ponte sisto / pzza san. maria.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim031
Reviews.Content: spend 2 nights at this hotel. kind and helpful service. rooms was nice and clean. good parking. they help us show where to take a train on the street to center off the town. just outside the hotel. very easy. great breckfast aswell. they olso gave us a adress fore a perfect local restaurant in a rearly local part off rome. perfect evening. we will go there again... kim franklin nielsen, denmark

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic & relaxful stay”
Reviews.Author: rdsinvt
Reviews.Content: What a terrific hotel to stay at. After 8 hrs of flight from the states, we only had to wait 30 minutes for our room. Meanwhile it's located in a quiet resisdential area but right where you would want it to be. Across from Porta Portese, the flea market on sunday , the tram which takes you to the center of Rome to catch other buses like to the vatican is across the road. The T to get your tickets for buses, Tram, & metro is right next door as is the post office & ATM machine.On Arrival we were greeted by a wonderful receptionist who checked us in & than proceeded around the corner to a map of Rome & showed us how to get around, to use the Tram & buses to all your favorite attractions. Our room was triple. Plenty of room W/ TV a safe, wonderful foam mattress & great blankets. the bathroom was good size & shower a bit small but great back spray. the maid cleaned wonderful in the a.m. & turned down the bed at night. Breakfast was much more than just continental & a great staff to help you with breakfast. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Up the streeet lots of vendors to buy great stuff & some wonderful restaurants & pizza parlors. Also a great outdoor bar and sitting room on the roof. Great view of the area around. We highly enjoyed it. RDS from U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Excellent Spa Facilities!”
Reviews.Author: scubear
Reviews.Content: Bought the three nights stay as a package on Ebay, was a good deal at the time. But when we checked in we realised it was even better!!! The staff was helpful with info regarding transport and places to visit, excellent breakfast, good variety and well displayed. We had a meal once at the restaurant and it was good value for money too! As mentioned above the Spa is excellent, a bit expensive if you like but worth it. Rooms are not massive, but clean and the mattresses are memory foam!!! The bus and tram stops in front of the hotel too. It's about 20 minute taxi drive from the main train station. If you ever visit Rome by public transport (very reasonable priced) be aware of the rush in getting on and off the buses, we missed a couple of stops because of it!!! As for the hotel anyway we would like to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TreePrincess
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews I booked the Trilussa Palace Hotel for our trip. I stayed there for 6 nights in Feb. 2009. Like many have stated the hotel is not in the center of Rome but a short tram ride will get you right where you need to be. The location of the hotel in my opinion was ideal. We could easily get anywhere in Rome with the tram stop and the bus stop located right across from the hotel. I would say the location - Trasteve was just okay. There were lots of restaurants around but at night the area could be a bit scary for the unseasoned traveller. The only downside to the hotel was the shower. I read all the reviews and saw the pictures and thought surely couldn't be that bad. Yes, it was that bad. I absolutely dreaded taking a shower there. My husband and I are of average size and we felt totally cramped in the shower. The hotel staff weren't overly friendly or helpful but they served their purpose. The room was also very small. I have traveled to various European cities, so I'm familiar with their standards. I have to say this was the smallest room ever. We did book only a double standard room so maybe that was the problem. All in all I would say that the proximity to the city center outweighed the other issues.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tailgator7
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 10:00 AM and since my room wasn't ready, I booked the spa. It was pristine, had steam, sauna, plunge pool, multi jet shower to myself for glorious hour. After nearly 24 hours of airport hopping with 8 hours on international flight, this was the perfect rejuvenating experience. By then the room was ready and the very courteous, English speaking staff settled me into my clean, beautiful room. I had a personal steam shower in the room's bath for the rest of my three nights. This was a big splurge for me but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: bally-deb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fabulous. Staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel is pefectly clean. I could quite honestly say I have never stayed anywhere nicer. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is located perfectly - just a tram ride away to the city centre. It is also easy to locate when arriving from the airport. We used the Spa while there and this was so relaxing. We also had a full body massage which was out of this world!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the four stars or the money”
Reviews.Author: WarholLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in the Trilussa Palace Hotel, following the positive messages of many reviewers. However, while there were no serious problems as such, this hotel is far overrated, does not deserve the four stars it awards itself, and is overpriced. The location is not great, it is not in the centre, and it is not in Trastevere as the website claims it is. You need to walk about 15 minutes along a main busy road before you get there. There is a regular tram that takes you to teh centre, fair enough, but the area is not very pretty, so not nice to come home to. The breakfast was really meagre, very basic quality of food and not a brilliant choice - half of the time the food had run out. Definitely not a four star breakfast. The room was ok, clean, not very spacious (we just came from another 4 star hotel which was almost double the size with a big terrace). The bed was nice and good. We stayed in 'luxury' double bedroom, which meant to include some kind of special massage shower. The whole thing was a nightmare, you hardly have any space to move because it is a closed cubicle, the temperature could not be easily regulated, the doors only half open, so if you're more than average sized, or pregnant, this was a nightmare to get in. The heat made that within seconds you could barely breath in this 'luxury shower', so you needed to open the doors, and then obviously wet the whole rest of the bathroom. on the positive side, the staff were super friendly and very helpful. Lisa and Simon

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmom58
Reviews.Content: My husband, youngest daughter and I came to visit our oldest daughter who was studying at the American University of Rome. The hotel was a great location for us - close to her apartment, the University, and a short tram ride into the city center. Exploring Trastevere was one highlight of the trip. We were very pleased with the accommodations - very clean, comfortable room, and a really nice breakfast. The staff were all very friendly and so helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Illinois00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Trilussa in July 2007 for our honeymoon. We had a great experience staying in the Trastevere section of Rome. Having no experience booking hotels in Europe, we were wary of something unexpected. However, the check-in was courteous; the hotel was very nice and clean; the room was clean, bright, comfortable, and not too small. The room was decorated very nicely. The bathroom was smallish but updated and tiled in white marble with a great modern shower. Very upscale compared to what I've saw in other European hotels. Also, the room came with a safe for valuables. Good Service: The roof top patio bar has such a great view of the Trastevere all the way to the Vatican and downtown Rome. The staff was great, letting us stay on the patio after closing time, making sure we had a cork screw for the wine we'd brought back from our tour of the city, and letting us be. A good breakfast bar with a good selection of food was kept fresh all morning. Good Neighborhood: Though at first we thought the Trilussa was a long walk from the sites we wanted to see, we soon discovered it was not far from the Tevere (Tiber) River, where you can walk to the area sites or catch a bus across town. We found great restaurants and outdoor dining right in our neighborhood, and outdoor fruit and flower stands on the way to the sites. We also discovered where the Trastevere locals hang out, which is a great part of touring. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for service, a very nice hotel if staying right in the heart of the tourism is not a must for you, and you want access to a little of the local scene as well. This hotel may be a hidden treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaconLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 nights at the Trilussa Palace Hotel Congress & Spa hotel. I decided to take my wife away for her birthday and I think I picked the perfect hotel. Staff are very friendly and go out of there way to help you. Also the tram into Rome is right outside the door and takes about 5mins. very good bars and places to eat within walking distance. The only thing I would say which i was a bit annoyed about was the Spa you can use it in the mornings at a cost of 15Euros each it is open to the public as well. But in the afternoon you have to hire the whole spa for 60 Euros per person per hour which i thought was expensive.But still I think the hotel is worth the money and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Slept So Well In A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodie05
Reviews.Content: I am allergic to dust, so often sneeze my way through hotel stays. This room was immaculate, with the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in! (my key hotel criteria) The spa, which can be booked privately in the evening has a wonderful hot tub, sauna and steam room. We totally enjoyed our spa visit -- we were so relaxed we could barely crawl to the Chinese restaurant next door (yes, Chinese in Rome -- it was actually delicious and we are both chefs). The breakfast was wonderful, and the staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Rome”
Reviews.Author: CmonTheCats
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay to this excellent hotel. The greeting by the reception staff is always welcoming. They can help you with everything including tram tickets/excusions/restaurants etc. The hotel is located directly across from a tram stop so getting to and from the main attraction areas is so simple and relaxed. We used the spa several times and it's calm, clean and ideal for winding down after a day of sight seeing. The roof top bar has been revamped since our previous visits. It even more beautiful than before. Sitting up there on a balmy Rome night sipping a blood red Tuscan in the arms of la bella citta is magical. The rooms are good with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Some visitors may like tea/coffee facilities in the room these are not available but with such willing staff in the hotel you will not be at a loss for long. We will definately be back again. If you would like to augment your stay to Rome you HAVE to stay here. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: avrilgc
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 4 days / 3 nights of our honeymoon at this lovely hotel. Having never stayed in Rome we spent ages searching for just the right hotel. Our efforts paif off and we couldn't have wished for better standards or service at such a good price. This hotel deserves all the good reviews its received and we're happy to add to them.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loolooloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay out of the Rome city centre this time for 8 nights, and decided that Trastevere would be a good location. What a find the Trilussa was! A new hotel, we were impressed with both the large (by European standards) room and bathroom. We didn't know what to expect of the breakfast, but were pleasantly surprised with the variety of food. The price of the internet service on the main floor was very resonable. Romena and Sergio of the front desk and Janetta in the dining room went out of their way to answer any questions we had, helped us to plan our daily routes and to practice the little bit of Italian we know. We took advantage of the spa, which was a great treat after much walking! The location of the hotel was excellent, with bus and tram stops just a few yards away from the front door. We bought the weekly transit pass, which was a great bargain! We enjoyed our stay at the Trilussa, and definitey will return - someday! D & Z, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian67
Reviews.Content: We (three sisters from Norway) had a wonderful week in Rome a week ago. We stayed at Trilussa Congress & Spa in Trastevere. After travelling some times in Europe we have experied that the hotels not always looks like they seems in pictures. With this in mind we didn`t have great expectations when we went to Rome. But we got surprised, the hotel was really nice! Exclusive rooms, bigger than expected, and with steamshower in the bathroom. The breakfast was always fresh and inviting, in a pleasant and light room. We also visited the Spa-center at the hotel. After a lot of walking all trough the city we specially enjoyed the foot-spa. It felt like getting new feet! Even if Trastevere isn`t just in the city, it was easy to get to the attractions. The tram stopped right outside the hotel, with just some minutes between each departure. Most of all we was fond of the people working at Trilussa. They were all very helpful and sweet, there wasn`t one thing they didn`t know. We really recomand Trilussa Spa if you`re going to Rome, and we hope to get back there soon ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Keep Your Wits About You”
Reviews.Author: littlefootjones
Reviews.Content: I took my parents to Greece and Italy as they had never left the US before. We stayed two nights at Trilussa. The hotel was lovely. From the outside I didn't expect much, but upon entering we found it was much more than we had originally anticipated. The hotel was in a great location, a bit difficult to find, but I'm terrible with directions to begin with. The rooms were amazing and the staff were fantastic, save for one bartender. Around midnight on our second night in Rome, the bartender on the Trilussa's rooftop bar pushed me against the elevator doors and kissed me as the bar was closing. I was shocked, but managed to get away and into the safety of my room, where I breathed a huge sigh of relief. A few minutes after turning the lights off and climbing into bed, I heard a knock at my door. I froze. My parents were sound asleep on the 4th floor, so I knew it wasn't them. Then it hit me; I had charged my drinks to my room so the bartender knew my room number. I didn't dare breathe. He knocked again, louder this time. When he got no response, he actually TRIED THE DOORKNOB! I didn't know what kind of person he was and was terrified that he was going to come back with a room key and let himself in. Thankfully he didn't, but needless to say, I didn't get any sleep that night as I hid under the covers, waiting, just in case he should return. Now to be fair, I can't say for sure that it was the bartender who knocked on my door, since I didn't want to make noise by going to look. It wasn't my parents, or any other hotel staff. So I can only assume it was he. So ladies, let this be a lesson to you; and keep your wits about you. Other than that, the rest of the stay was wonderful. Gianmarco at the front desk was pleasant and very helpful during our entire stay. He recommended a great traditional restaurant nearby. I would recommend this hotel, yes, but stay away from the rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trilussa Palace - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: NIvisitor1
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week's stay at the Trilussa Palace and would highly recommend it for a stay in Rome. The hotel is located in a great area for eating out and socialising with the locals with a really vibrant atmosphere, while only being a short tram ride away from Rome city centre. We found it very easy to travel around to visit each tourist area, from the hotel, and a travel card allowing unlimited access to the tram, metro, train & bus is only EUR 16 for a week. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful and drew us numerous maps to help us find our way around! In particular, Sergio on the front desk was fantastic and bridged the language gap for us when we were trying to get hold of some concert tickets. The hotel itself is very comfortable - twin room was provided as requested beforehand, amazing shower in the room with massage function and internet access for a small charge. The roof terrace is a really nice spot for a drink before heading out for the night. Overall, great hotel & really charming staff. Would highly recommend and hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Golds
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Trilussa Palace Hotel in mid July, 2008 and it met all our needs and expectations. We look forward to staying there again The staff was very pleasant, helpful and conversant in English. The hotel was quiet at all times even though facing a main street. The room was very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The air conditioning was absolutely quiet and efficient and it was easy to control the temperature. Though we didn't use the sauna option in the shower we used the shower part which had a cushioned seat and various top and side sprays. Though the bathroom was small it accomodated all of our needs. The dining room was charming: the juices were wonderful, the coffee weak and scrambled eggs could have been better. There was no brewed decaf though we didn't find it anywhere in Rome so it may not be common. The roof garden was also charming with views of much of the city. The exercise room, though small, was never crowded. The hotel is just south of the Trastevere, a very convenient walk or tram ride to the center of that district. The #8 Tram stops right across the street from the hotel and takes you to Plaza Argentina where you can connect to lines serving the rest of the city. In the opposite direction the #8 tram takes you to the airport rail-line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SB1LA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great find in Rome. My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and had a wonderful stay. The hotel was clean, cool and very well staffed. The roof top bar was a great feature and a nightly visit was a welcome part of our vacation routine. The room was clean and air conditioned and although the shower was small, it felt quite luxurious compared to the TINY shower we found on the Amalfi Coast! The hotel is located right next to a tram stop that takes you right into the heart of Rome with a 10 minute ride. You could also walk to all the sites in Rome. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from some of the best Italian food in all of Rome and was a welcome place to return to after a long, hot day touring around the city. We found it to be a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: JeannieSE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the the Trilussa from August 2-6. The hotel was fantastic! The staff gave me excellent information about transportation and nearby places to visit. The staff was friendly, professional, and helpful! The front desk clerk even walked me over to post office to assist with mailing a package back home. The evening bartender was warm and friendly. Always welcoming me back to the rooftop bar every evening after I had returned from a full day of exploring Rome. As a single female traveling alone, I always felt totally safe. I will return again! I truly loved my experience at the Trilussa Palace Congress & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: green55
Reviews.Content: We read about this hotel on the internet and were not disappointed. The staff at the hotel were very kind and helpful and gave us all the information we needed to get around the city. Our room was lovely and clean. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast every morning. If ever we find ourselves back in Rome we will definetly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: dhyink01
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with our stay at Trilussa Palace. The hotel staff working the front desk were very friendly and helpful in answering our many questions. Our room was nice and the bed quite comfortable. While the shower was a bit small, it's many features and gadgets made us laugh as we felt like we were stepping into a space age time traveling machine or something - and I loved the waterfall shower feature. The breakfast room was a nice way to start the day - the room was very inviting and many selections were available. I was a bit concerned about location ... but found the location to not be an issue ... public transportation was very convenient and it was easy to get around (and bus tickets could be purchased at the front desk). We ventured up to the terrace one evening for a glass of wine and were glad we did - we enjoyed the company of other guests and the view. We would recommend the chinese restaurant nearby as well. All in all, a gem of a hotel - very welcoming and inviting. We were glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: pal90
Reviews.Content: Good clean rooms, perhaps a little small (although perhaps not by Rome standards, and a very convenient location a short tram or bus ride from all major sights and a short walk to the heart of Trestevere with its superb restaurants. Good breakfast and a very nice rooftop terrace to enjoy a beer before going out for the evening

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MichaekBKK
Reviews.Content: For an ideally located hotel in Rome the Trilussa certainly should meet most if not all of your requirements. Upon arrival you will be greeted by friendly & helpful staff . If you want easy access to trams and bus routes this hotel provides that. Not far away, say a 5 minute tram ride, is a fantastic restaurant area that offers you so many choices, without the high prices and tourist crowds. You should not be disappointed if you decided to stay at the Trilussa.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller026
Reviews.Content: My family (children 13 and 9) recently stayed at the Trilussa and would recommend it. Positives: + reasonably priced + convenient location. Walking distance to Travesterre district, across the street from public transportation which will take you into thhe heart of Rome. + hotel is nice looking and clean + staff were courteous and helpful. + breakfast was first rate + roof top garden & bar was a nice treat in the evening + coffee shops close + excellent Chinese food next door! (if you tire of pasta). + great king sized bed Negatives - our room was a little small for 4. Ideal of 2 adults, fine for 2 adults and 1 teen, cramped for 2 adults and 2 children. We requested 2 cots be rolled in. On balance it was a good deal and we didn't mind because we were out of the room most of the day, but if you need space consider this. - the bathroom is nice and clean but the shower is tiny! It is a modern "capsule" shower. Fine for skinny people, but if you or overweight or claustraphobic I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected gem”
Reviews.Author: momlove
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for many reasons. Very clean, lovely room and linens. It's great to have the frigobar to get water or wine in a pinch. The hotel is walking distance to many wonderful restaurants if you want to take it easy. It is also conveniently located on the metro system, so going for dinner is minutes away. The roof top bar is a must visit for a drink before or after dinner. The workout area was clean and neat, and very empty. Booking a massage was a little tricky. I finally wound up with an " OK ",$100 massage that was misbooked 2x. I adored this location, Trasteverre, as it's very "left bank". The breakfast room was so pretty, and the morning selections were more than adequate. I really was surprised by this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a second”
Reviews.Author: AdGuySeattle
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel. So much so that we've stayed there twice. Great staff, friendly service, high-tech rooms, great amenities, close to transportation, good service -- everything you could want and more. We'll definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Rome Trilussa Palace & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Tsadventures
Reviews.Content: I bid on the Trilussa Hotel & Spa on ebay, and won it for an amazing price(I thought to good to be true). I was very pleased and could not believe how lovely this hotel was. The staff are funny, very friendly, and helpful. The roof top bar has a beautiful view of the city. It is located in the Trendy Trastevere area, walking distance to all kinds of out door restaurants. The food is fabulous in all places. You feel perfectly safe walking at night in the area. Most rooms in Europe are small, this was a nice size room with full Jacuzzi type shower with many jets coming from all angles, air conditioning, hairdryer, fridge etc, in the room. This hotel is a little gem and I would highly recommend trying to find it on ebay and bid, you cannot beat the price, or the hotel has there own website. I would definitely book here again. Also full buffet breakfast available. I cannot wait to return again and spend more time there....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: clara94
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived from a short stay in Rome, and I can tell that it coudn't work out better. I have a long experiencie travelling in Europe and I know ery well Rome and its hotels (I've been a tour guid for almost 20 years) and this is, by far, one of the best places I have even been. Let's face it: Italian hotels have small rooms, and most of the places have nothing to do with, let's say, tourist hotels in the Caribbean or USA, but for me, this was a suprise: functional, quite new, and with excellente service (from the men at the front desk, to the laday manager or the lady at the breakfast room), good facilities for relaxing (if you go, don't miss the spa, ideal after a long walk in the city). I loved the location (I looked for somewhere away from the crowds in the historical center) in Trastevere: closed to many restaurants, the Sunday market, in front of the hotel, and the nice views fron the Gianicolo hill (a winner off the beaten track!), and the tram stop passing every 3 minutes and taking you to the center in 10 minutes. I loved the place, and now is one of my favourites in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms/staff but poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Whitleylass
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel lived up to most of the good points that had been listed through tripadvisor. The rooms were very good quality, hydro shower excellent and staff very friendly and helpful. The only downside was breakfast. We usually aimed for 9.30 and we found that tables were not cleared from other diners, the coffee and hot water for the tea was lukewarm and the choice of food was limited, particularly the fresh fruit. The hotel could easily correct this so I would not let it put you off from going there.

Reviews.Title: “Only downside - a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Merrill13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Trastevere district of Rome across the Tiber, but it is two bridges down from the central Tiber bridges. The location was a bit out of the way, although there is a tram right outside that stops frequently and takes one through Trastevere and into the heart of Rome in about ten minutes. It took 30 minutes to walk to the Jewish Ghetto and Tiber Island. I stayed here at the tail end of two week trip that started in Rome, went to Tuscany and back to Rome, so I wanted something different from my Rome hotel. I had a room with a single bed that was very small but very well appointed and thought out. Top notch air-conditioning and windows that open. Very good linens, pillows and mattress. The bathroom is tiled, modern and large with a fancy electronic hydro shower. The furniture in the room was lovely and the TV/computer set up was high-tech with lots of features. The room was very quiet due in part to the back location and soundproof glass in the windows.There is a lovely roof garden bar with views of Rome. Breakfast was abundant and included cooked food. The staff, especially the front desk, was helpful and spoke English well. The massages ( it is a Spa hotel) were uneven. One was great ( Thai) the other so-so(relaxation). Massage prices were lower than in New York or top-notch US spas. The hotel is within walking distance of several sites concerning Italy's liberation and unification by Garibaldi and the top of the Janiculum Hill. This walk is for the fit, however, since there is quite a climb up many steps. A sweet extra was the huge flea market right outside the hotel on Sunday. It stretched for blocks and blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, staff and area”
Reviews.Author: Lobomojo
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the Travestare area was very charming, very close to the main sights but quieter with local charm. First all the staff was incrediably friendly and helpful. Made you feel very much at home as well as honored guests. The room was beauitiful and imaculate with a a steam shower with a nice view over the main road down towards the rest of the city and decent sized as well. Absolutly incrediable value for the price which was far less than an equivilant class in a more touristy area. The outside may not be as special and unique as a more historic hotel but the inside and the staff more then make up for it. Also was able to get a great and very reasonable for Rome massage in the Spa that helped after all the walking about town. The rooftop bar has a great view and a great place to relax before or after going out and the included breakfast was good with plentiful choices. The neighborhood had many interesting shops, restaurants, taverns, bakeries, gelato stores and just a little bit of a walk or quick tram or taxi to and acrooss the river to the more central areas. Sale & Pepe just down the block from the hotel on the same side towards the river became our favorite neighborhood restaurant with great handmade fresh pasta and woodoven pizzas and from the 2nd visit on the staff there and the patrons treated us like neighbors. I can't get wait to get back to Rome and the Trilussa and visit with the exceptional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly stuff, clean, convenient location in rome”
Reviews.Author: jpcrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in May, and I found the stuff very friendly, esp. Paolo at the front desk, who gave great tips on how to get around in Rome from the hotel, using public transport. His tip was so useful on the day of my arrival that i had no difficulty finding Vatican and Colosseum and wasted no time getting around in Rome. When I booked it initially, i had thought that it might be a bit far away from the center of Rome, but it turned out that this hotel was well connected with the trams and buses, the location was very convenient for sightseeing. Hotel is new and clean, and every day the bed and room were cleaned to the highest standard, and the breakfast was also enjoyable with very courteous service. Definitely will stay again next time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal tourist hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: AndrewGeneva
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel in Rome, in the spring, is not easy, but we were lucky enough to book a family room (connecting rooms with a shared, small hallway) at the Trilussa. We stayed for 4 days (3 nights) and our aim was to visit all the obvious highlights of Rome. We are a family of four (kids aged 8 & 6) and this hotel proved to be perfect. The staff could not have been more helpful and the location is perfect. The No 8 tram stops 50 metres from the hotel and goes across the Tiber into the centre of the city. The children were made very welcome (as they always are in Italy) and they even had the barman prepare them 'special' cocktails. After a day of taking in the amazing sights, we went back to the hotel for a pit stop (including 'special cocktails' and prosecco on the roof terrace), before finding somewhere to eat in the Trastevere area. Within 10 minutes walk, there are an amazing number of varied and excellent restaurants - ask the concierge for a restaurant/bar guide and book if you don't want to be disappointed. However, you can always find a table at the smaller, family run trattoria/pizzeria in the side streets. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the beds were very comfortable. The showers (which double up as a steam room!) are over-elaborate for a small bathroom, but they work very well, with endless hot water. The only niggles were that there is not a lot of storage space, which may be an issue if you stay for more than 3 nights, and I always find it annoying when you have to pay a ransom for internet access. But, as I say, these are niggles and nothing more. If you're looking for a hotel where you'll spend a lot of time, I would choose a bigger hotel. But, if you're looking for a clean and comfortable base in a great location, then I don't think you'll do any better. My wife is hoping to go back to Rome later in the year and will be booking into the Trilussa. Nuff said?!

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond of a Find Outside of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: BroadwayBaby1
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research when booking my first family vacation to Rome. With the weakness of the U.S. dollar, staying in 'downtown Rome' was not only out of our range (we needed SIX rooms), but, also, wouldn't have allowed us the more personal "small establishment" feel that we received at Trilussa Palace. A Roman friend suggested the Trastevere area - a suburb, if you will, of Rome, with easy access to public transportation (across the street from a bus station), a safe neighborhood for evening strolls, and MUCH more affordable than the touristy 'downtown Rome' area. Everyone at Trilussa, from the reservations staff pre-vacation, to the desk staff, and lounge staff (hi, Alex!), was friendly, accomodating, and knowledgeable - they made us feel like family (and EVERYONE spoke English and probably several other languages as well!). It has the look of a very high-end establishment (both common areas, spa and rooms), without the price or high-end snob staff attitude. The rooms were so richly appointed (and VERY large for European hotels) that everyone in our group took tours of everyone else's room, just to see the beautiful furnishings, wall coverings, linens and showers! The beds were amongst the most comfortable I've found in hotels ANYWHERE, and the property is exceptionally clean. If you need help booking transportation or even finding a hard-to-find Italian-made fountain pen, the desk staff is there to help (one of the staff actually called SEVERAL shops for my Aunt to find a pen she was looking for and then gave us directions, including public transportation routes/instructions to get there!). If you need a recommendation for a place to eat - Alex (in the lounge) is your man! What a doll - always there to greet us and joke with us after a long day of touring. And, if you opt to use the spa - WOW! The hours are a bit odd, but you can book private access any time you want (for a price - not too bad, but not free either). Wonderful and relaxing and romantic. Don't forget to check out the roof garden for further post-touring relaxation! The highest compliment I can give to an establishment is a return-visit. I ABSOLUTELY will stay at Trilussa Palace on my next trip to Rome! You won't be disappointed! (I didn't take photos of the hotel/rooms, but their website photos are good depictions and not retouched to make it look nice - it's really THAT nice!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mcgrahams
Reviews.Content: We recenty returned from a six night stay in Rome at the Trilussa Palace for our honeymoon. We were immediately struck by how friendly and accommodating the staff were. The hotel was excellent with spa and gym. However note that there is an additional charge to use the spa. Massage and other treatments are available and are quite pricey but excellent and probably worth the money. Nice clean rooms with turkish bath style shower and balcony. Great location in trastevere, a short walk from numerous restaurants and bars. Excellent breakfast so worth including this when booking. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “What more do you need”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaReading
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and wouldn't hesitate in staying there again. Room was spotless, breakfast was good and the staff were extremely helpful on reception. They gave us a map on arrival marking out all the places of interest. We were close to all the restaurants for the evening and walked to all the attractions during the day. What more can I add but go and enjoy yourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Small But Clean - Great Location/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: dankotyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Junior Suite" and were a littel surprised at how small the room was (see pics). It was basically 5ft larger than a regular room with two single roll away beds placed in the room. There was very little closet or drawer space and we basically had to live out of our suitcases in a very small room. Only other negative is the shower where it is very hard to even turnaround Enough of the negatives. The entire hotel is spotless, though the lobby sitting area is a little worn. The staff was really incredible - not one person who wouldn't go out of their way to help. Location is quite good. There is a tram out font of the hotel which gets you to a place you can walk to attractions or take a bus (note you will be taking public tranportation in Rome or you will come back broke). Additionally, Trasteverre is THE PLACE for good and cheap (by Rome Standards) food in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: gilliang
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel close to the tram - a quick and convenient way to reach the sights of Rome. It's also a great location if you are visiting study abroad students at John Cabot University. Trastevere is a beautiful area with lots of quaint restaurants and shops. The hotel staff were friendly and most helpful. The room was immaculate and the inclusive breakfast was extremely pleasant served in a lovely dining room. The beds were extremely comfortable. We had two rooms, a triple and a single. The triple was a good size but the single was rather small with one twin bed. Altogether - a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: cleanfreakmadrid
Reviews.Content: I was very please with this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were modern and clean. The hotel is convenient to the airport yet close to the city center as well. I would recommend this hotel to any kind of traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible-comfy bed, awesome staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MAParoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: I'm always sceptical of European hotels. They're usually overpriced with poor service, horrible beds, and no water pressure. After carefully reading the reviews on this website, Trilussa seemed like a safe bet. When booking accomodation the two most important attributes to me are location and a comfy bed. No matter how great everything else is, you won't get the most out of your trip if your hotel is difficult to get to and your exhausted from a poor night's sleep. THE LOCATION With that being said, Trilussa far exceeded expectations in both areas. As mentioned in other reviews the tram and bus stop are right outside the hotel. The no.8 tram took you practically to the doorstep of the Pantheon. The stop before the river took you to the heart of Trastevere where there are amazing shops and excellent restaurants. 'Friends' bar near the Piazza Trilussa has happy hour with delicious complementary appetizers. For dinner close to the hotel I recommend 'Sale & Pepe' and 'Le Fate' (ask the owner's son for recommendations-he's the cheerful fellow). THE ROOM Hard wood floors, marble bathroom, and nicely decorated; the beds have memory foam - need I say more? We stayed in room 718 at the back of the hotel on the seventh floor (two twin beds). This was THE quietest room I have ever stayed in all of my travels. Of course it was small compared to North American standards, but for two adults how much space do you really need? The shower was luxurious to say the least with excellent water pressure. I highly recommend the 'Cascade' setting to rinse your exhaustion down the drain. Tip: If you plan to use other settings make sure you turn the dial and let the warm water flow through each setting before getting in the shower. Otherwise you'll get a quick blast from the cold water still left in the pipes. Because the rooms are soundproof I doubt anyone heard me scream. THE STAFF Andrea was my favorite. He's at the front desk in the morning and during the day. He's sweet, friendly, gives excellent detailed instructions, and takes that extra step. It was nice starting out the day with a warm happy 'buon giorno' from him. Housekeeping was also great. The only negatives are no wash cloths (common in Europe) and runny mass-produced eggs for breakfast. However, there are plenty of other protein options. TIPS FOR ROME Don't eat at restaurants that have people outside grabbing customers. Great restaurants don't need to do this. If the price isn't advertised, ask before ordering. Ask the waiter for a recommendation. They know what the best dishes are. Tell the cab driver you want the most direct route to your destination. Before calling a cab find out the starting rate. We didn't realize the cab charges extra after hours. At a start rate of 9 euros at 10pm, I believe we got ripped off. Use the subway when you can. Take a trip to the grocery store. It's fun to see the different everyday items they use. If you have trouble deciding anything just remember...when in Rome, do as the Romans do.

Reviews.Title: “only hotel you need in Rome”
Reviews.Author: posh-bird35
Reviews.Content: We are 2 couples whp spent 4 lovely nights in the Trilussa in January. This hotel was excellent and all the good reviews are very justified. LOCATION - excellent with the main tram line outside the door and all major sites minuites away. RECEPTION - one of the most helpful we have experienced with superb local knowledge ROOMS - really really comfortable and bathrooms not too small considering this is Italy. FACILITIES - did not use the Spa but enjoyed a drink or 2 in the small but adequate bar. FOOD - only had breakfast once which was up to standard for a buffet. NICE TOUCH - log fire burning in the lobby area was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shortypoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa from February 23 -March 2, 2008 and had a wonderful experience from check-in to check-out. The staff was amazing. I wish I had all the names, but I remember Sergio and everyone that worked with him at the front desk were outstanding in every way. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are a good size for European hotels. The buffet breakfast was very good and the staff there and at the bar were very friendly. The hotel has a beautiful wellness center, which we wish we had time to partake in. The location is very convenient to everything as well. This was one of the best experiences I have had in all of the hotels I have stayed at. We organized tours through the front desk and whenever we needed a taxi, it was there within minutes. What hotel staff sometimes don't realize, is they can make or break someone's vacation, and the staff certainly made ours that much more pleasurable. Thank you Trilussa! Gratzia, Bonnie Wagner and Brenda Umbrello

Reviews.Title: “Nice a quiet”
Reviews.Author: sxs317
Reviews.Content: This was a nice quiet hotel in an area of Rome called Trastevere. Although it is not directly in Trastevere area in is only 5 blocks away or a short Tram ride. Since this was our first trip to Rome I'll include lots of info that I wish I would have had. Hotel: It is very clean...and classic European type hotel. Small room, but clean and the staff is excellent. Sergio RULEZ! Thanks! He knows the city well and will try to accomodate anything you ask. Location: A cool are of Rome across the river that's less touristy but has some of the best restaurants there. Prices are lower since it's not so touristy. A nice to be for nightlife and houses a peacefull piazza. St. Marie de trastevere church. It's a cool place to get capucinno and gellati. Which we had EVERYDAY. Also nice is a grocery store a couple blocks down where you can get water and stuff instead of getting it in restaurants. Saves a lot of money. .50 Euro compared to 2-3 euro. Trasporation: Rome is relatively SMALL compared to any US city. If you like walking you can pretty much walk anywhere. We walked a TON. But there is a tram that is right in front of the hotel. So what is the tram? It's like an electric car on rails...that just goes down one street and takes you into the city area. From there you can walk anywhere. You can buy a tranportation card but from what I noticed no one even checks tickets in rome. So you could theoretically go through the city without having to pay a dime. But we bought the week pass to be legit. To the hotel is REALLY easy and cheap. 11 Euro gets you two tickets using the FR1 train to Roma Trastevere stop. Then take the tram two stops and you're at the hotel. Directions on their website helps. To Do: The Vatican Museo was by far the best. Get a tour guide definitely. We chose Presto tours which was awesome. They guy knew everything and it made the Vatican was more interesting. Plus you get to avoid the HUGE line. Although Feb had less tourists and since the Euro was so high...there still was a TON of people. I would also recommend a tour for Foro Romona and Coliseum. We didn't get one but probably would have made it more intersting. Food: Pizza is good ANYWHERE. Just varies in price depending where you are. The house wines are excellent and cheap. They charge your for bread so sometime if you don't want it tell them. Otherwise it's like 2 euro's for bread. That's something we couldnt' get used to...since it comes with the meal in the U.S. There was an excellent restaurant called L'orange right next to the hotel so that was nice. Also a restuarant called Le Fate. The waiter could speak Enlgish so that helped. The seafood is not so good in Rome but maybe that's just us. They salt the fish and the shrimp is tiny. We just stuck with Pasta. Itialians eat multiple courses so on the menu the first course is the pasta dish and the second course is the meat dish. We normally just got appetizer and pasta...otherwise it would get too expensive. Also they eat SUPER late like 9-10 PM is when the restuarants start getting crowded. Well that's it. Rome is an cool place! We loved it. Trilussa Palace hotel is a really cool place to stay if you like to be adventurous and be part of the culuture it's the place to be. You won't get lost with Sergio either! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A first rate choice for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: SteveNorthampton.UK
Reviews.Content: Having carefully read reveiws on this hotel and many others on Tripadvisor, I chose to stay for three nights here with my wife in Rome. I can understand why it features so highly in the ratings. The decor of this modern hotel is made to look old, (like most of Rome is,) but it has all the modern faciliites you could need, and is spotlesly clean and tidy. The number 8 tram stops just 100m away, and in five minutes the end of the line gives you the Vatican to your left and the colleseum to your right. If you want to know which bus to take, then just ask Sergio at the front desk. My room 410 was front facing, but so well sound proofed that the trams can hardly be heard. Though they stop running at 11pm. The large bed was lovely and comfortable, with the flat screen Tv sitting nicely on top of the wooden mini-bar cabinet. The wardrobe has a clever feature in that the interior light is movement sensitive and will turn off when you are not there. The much written about shower/steam room is very different and can certainly fire water at you from most angles, although you will have to shower alone. It's not big enough for two! Ancient Rome at the heart of the city is very busy. This place is situated just right to escape the crowds. Would I go back? Absolutely. And I would book my transfers again with Stefano at www.romecabs.com Far better than a crowded bus, and door to door service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: BellaPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Although slightly out of the central area it was perfectly located for us, in the trastevere district where all the best bars and restaurants are (which in itself is one of the top 5 sites to see according to the lonely planet guide). Being a 5 minute walk from all the hustle and bustle made it the perfect retreat to unwind before venturing out again for dinner. The tram line is all of a 30 second walk from the front door which takes 5 minutes and drops you about 300m from the Pantheon. Public transport is very very simple and free (we were never asked for a ticket of any description). The staff in the hotel were the friendliest I have ever encountered. On arrival they provided a map showing all the sites, telling us how to get to each and told us about the different tours available. Walking is the best way to wander around central Rome, virtually all of the most famous sites are within easy walking distance and there is no better way to experience the wonderful ambience and character of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hotel booking your taxi!!!”
Reviews.Author: sas_daz
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay in the hotel was fine. The staff were friendly, the room was nice & the spa was fantastic!! We even got our room upgraded free of charge as it was our honeymoon. However we got stitched up when the hotel booked us a taxi to take us to the airport. We told them which airport we wanted and it was booked by the person on reception. On the morning of departure we were asked if we would share a taxi with some other guests who were apparently going to the same airport, little did we know they were actually going to a different airport and we would be going there too!!!! We ended up in the wrong airport!!! We had a mad rush then to get to the correct airport, had to pay extra money in another taxi, and almost missed check in. After contacting the hotel when we got home they refused to accept responsibility!!! After several emails they eventually said they would refund the cost of the 2nd taxi out of good will.....almost a month on and I am still waiting for this refund. It was a disappointing end to our lovely honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not in center but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: hw711
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Trastevere but there is a 8 tram stop right in from of the hotel which will take you to Argentina (which is like a mini transit hub where you can change to buses that goes to the Vatican or whatever) in 5-10 min. Hotel is really easy to get to from the airport. Take the FM1 regional train (the train that's not the Leonardo Express) to Trastevere station and take either the 8 tram or 3 bus north for 2-5 minutes and you'll see the hotel on your left. The hotel itself looks very nice. There is a fire place in the lobby. Doesn't at all look old and crappy like many hotels in Europe. The room is tiny but very clean and nice. Internet is only $10Euro for 24 hours and $15Euro for 48 hours which is the cheapest I've never seen in any hotel that doesn't have complimentary internet. The bed is really nice and comfortable. Breakfast was decent. They have the system where you put the key card into a slot on the wall to turn on the eletricity in the room. I think it doubles as a ways to tell the hotel whether not you are in the room. Cause we were never bothered by house cleaning when we are in the room but the room is always taken care of when we leave for a little while. I'd definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: d0r0
Reviews.Content: I’ve just spent the week-end the your hotel( leisure) . The location and the rooms were wonderful. The service offered was very nice. Especially the receptionist with the Spanish accent ( Sergio I believe) . He was very professional and friendly . I stay frequently in five/four stars hotels for my job and it’s the first I’ve been welcomed with such professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: CLHlady
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for both business and pleasure, spending over 100 days a year in hotels. I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Trilussa Palace Hotel. As a woman traveling alone I’m always cautious with my choices and so I’d read all the reviews before booking. I arrived there with high expectations based on the reviews and I was not disappointed. I must say that my actual stay at the Trilussa far exceeded those high expectations and I was extremely satisfied with my whole experience. This is a FANTASTIC hotel! Room – Yes, my room was small by North American standards but it was perfectly ‘normal’ for a hotel in Italy and/or Europe. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom well- appointed and my room well sound-proofed for a quiet, restful sleep. The much written about shower was excellent, easy to use and provided a wonderful relaxing experience at the end of a long day of meetings or sightseeing. Everything was spotlessly clean. The internet access in my room (which is very important to me) was easy to use, was fast and reasonably priced. Location – In my opinion, the location of the hotel is EXCELLENT! It’s away from the hustle & bustle of the touristy area of central Roma where it’s crowded, food and drink prices are high and you’ll be around more tourists than locals. Simply walk out of the door of the hotel and you’re right at the tram stop that, after a short comfortable ride, takes you into the heart of old Roma. From there you can walk or take buses anywhere in Roma that you so desire. I found though, like many before me, that the best way to see Roma is on foot so that you can fully experience all the sights, sounds, aromas and ambience. Food - Trastevere is a wonderful area with lots of little restaurants and wine bars. It is well frequented by locals so the prices are reasonable, with good quality food and authentic menus. I was particularly fond of Sale e Pepe which is a short walk from the hotel. If you walk a little further on, take a left onto Via S.
