Francesco and explore it and the alleys running around it for some wonderful, small and charming restaurants which offer lots of great food, fun and atmosphere. Another good choice is the Chinese restaurant right next door to the hotel. It is family run and the food is fresh, healthy and reasonably priced. A good choice if you’re not up for a walk after a long day of sightseeing. The buffet breakfast provided by the hotel is excellent and well worth any additional fee if not included in your room price. There are lots of choices of juices, cereals, fruits, cheeses, meats, pastries, breads, etc. The selection provided easily competes with breakfasts that I’ve had provided elsewhere in Europe at much more pricey hotels. The breakfast room is bright, airy and spotless. The attendant is always there to provide you with any specific requests for special coffees or teas, etc. Transportation – I made arrangements with the hotel to have a driver pick me up at FCO and it worked without a hitch. The driver was there and waiting with a sign when I exited the baggage area. He carried my bags and opened doors for me. His vehicle was clean and nicely appointed. He drove reasonably, I arrived safely at exactly my anticipated time at the Trilussa and the cost was exactly as I had been quoted. A really painless way to get from the airport to the hotel! I couldn’t have asked for more! As my first experience was such a good one, I asked the hotel to make arrangements for a car to take me from the hotel to my cruise ship in Civitavecchia at the end of my stay. This went without a hitch as well. A different driver was there exactly as booked, he carried my bags, opened doors for me and his vehicle was just as clean and nicely appointed. He drove reasonably, I arrived safely at my ship at exactly my anticipated time and the cost was exactly as I had been quoted. Again, I couldn’t have asked for more! As far as getting around Roma goes as stated above the tram works well from the hotel. It’s definitely worth investing in a tram/bus pass if you’re going to be staying a few days or more. Taxis in Roma are metered and reasonably priced so don’t hesitate if you get tired or lost to take one. Do be aware though that taxis are almost impossible to flag down so it’s best to have the hotel order you one if you’re leaving from the hotel or if you’re out and about, walk to the nearest taxi stand to get one. Taxi stands are well marked and close to all major piazzas and sites. Service – From the moment I first arrived and each and every time I entered the elegant lobby of the hotel I was greeted by one or more of the very attentive front desk staff. This staff (Gian Marco, Paulo, Edoardo, and Sergio to name a few) were absolutely professional and most helpful in each and every encounter I had with them. Whether I was asking for directions to a particular place, asking them to book me a taxi, or requesting suggestions for where to go to dinner or something else, I was treated with the utmost respect, and experienced the graciousness that I’ve come to expect as the norm in high end establishments in Europe. The staff of the Trilussa is right up there with the best of them! Now if all of the above wasn’t already enough to make me a very happy and extremely satisfied guest….the icing on the cake for me was that the Trilussa Palace is 100% NON-SMOKING! Imagine not experiencing that smell of stale smoke in the hallways or in your room that you encounter so much in the older hotels in Europe! I loved it! The Trilussa Palace Hotel gets 5 stars in my book and I will not hesitate to stay there again. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a lovely, elegant hotel to stay in while in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Rome...gotta love it!”
Reviews.Author: Top-notch-Tastes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our first trip to Rome. We are quite picky with our choices and were very pleased with this hotel. Admitted Trip Advisor junkies, we read all the reviews of this hotel and others in Rome in before booking our trip. Our big "musts": cleanliness, location, ambiance, and as close to 5 star quality as possible. CLEANLINESS: This hotel was clean. Not one complaint. LOCATION: tucked in the beautiful Trastevere area of Rome. The tram stop is just outside of the hotel entrance. Just a few stops down off the tram is Santa Maria in Trastevere area, plenty of eateries and shops to browse. From the hotel in less than 5 minutes you can take the tram to it’s end at Largo Argentina a square. This square has many bus routes running through it, you can access all of the major sites from this point with ease. AMBIANCE: my husband and I dislike fussy and overly ornate décor. The hotel is nicely decorated. The outside of the hotel is very plain. This small hotel is quiet and pleasant to return to after long days of site seeing. They provided maps and directions to all the sites, speaking English with ease and the staff were always pleasant to talk to. Our room was quite average sized for a European hotel room. It had a tiny sitting area outside of the bathroom. There was a great balcony overlooking the hilly homes behind the hotel. Very nice view. We had a small flat screened TV, a desk and regular sized closet. The bed and linens were nice and comfy. The rooms really are very quiet as advertised. The bathroom was good. Marble countertop , huge step-in “pod like” bath stall. With every kind of shower head and water stream you could imagine. The hotel offered a limited continental breakfast. A nice perk was that the staff always offered us a cappuccino and muffins, even though the cafe had yet to open, before our super early tours departed. There was a rooftop bar and torch-lit sitting area with music each evening with a great view over the top of Rome. The hotel was a nice three star hotel and we really enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: WebboLondon
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Rome as a surprise for his 30th birthday and booked the Trilussa Palace based on a review on Expedia. The hotel is clean and comfortable although the rooms are a little on the small side and quite dark. The bathroom was lovely, the massage shower would of been most wlecome if it had worked. This hotel was a little off the beaten track but 10mins on a tram (which stops just in front of the hotel) soon had you in the centre of Rome. We booked the spa in the basement after one very long day of sightseeing and it was lovely to relax and unwind in the sauna and jacuzzi. The breakfast was okay but my husband was disappointed with the scrambled eggs and bacon he ordered at £5 a go. We used the roof top bar which was lovely on a gorgeous sunny afternoon. Please be aware that Rome is a very expensive city (that comes from someone who lives in London - supposedly one of the most expensive cities in the world!) and its very easy to get ripped off on the main tourist trails. We ordered lunch at one bar and ended up paying £5 for a can of cola as the prices for these were not on the menu's. Overall our stay here was nice, as it was a special occasion and the city was so fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DaveA71
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 fantastic days of sightseeing in Rome. We booked direct with the Trilussa Palace Hotel via the internet and found this a very easy process - the staff there were extremely helpful and answered all our queries promptly. The Hotel itself was very clean and comfortable with friendly and helpful staff. The Spa was a bonus, albeit a little on the expensive side for massages etc but nevertheless was a great way to end our holiday as we booked it for private use and massage on our last day - we also received a discount for use which was good. Breakfast was included in our stay and was plentiful and well organised. The only real criticism was the size of the shower cubicle which housed the turkish bath - it was a little on the small side ! However, it was very enjoyable. Getting into the city itself was very easy with a tram stop directly opposite the hotel with very frequent trams running - very cheap way of travelling. No restaurant at the actual hotel, but a few reasonable ones within easy walking distance. Overall, this hotel is excellent value and we would not hesitate to stay there again. Our thanks to all the staff who helped make our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: rrsqwared
Reviews.Content: Rome was the last city on our Italian adventure. Paolo at the front desk found two reservations booked under my name, admitted that it was his hotel's issue, and still wanted to charge me for two rooms. The room was not prepared, (neither one of them), our key did not work, and when we asked for directions and a suggestion to a restaurant, we were given a map with a big circle on it. . .no specifics. They tried to have a fancy shower in the room, but it did not work, online when I booked, they were supposed to give me a bottle of wine on check, that never happened, there were not enough towels in the room, our balcony door would not close, and the marble was coming off around the shower. I would never recommend this place. There are so many other beautiful hotels to stay in. . .try there.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: krakatoaIreland
Reviews.Content: excellently located hotel, right on the tram line and within five minutes of some brilliant restaurants. rooms are small compared to similar london or dublin hotels but prefect for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Paddy66
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for my honeymoon which was June this year. I had read good things about the hotel and we weren't disappointed, although when we arrived about midday they were doing maintenance work on the air con so it was a tad hot but this had been sorted by the time we got back. Our rooms weren't ready but they were more than happy to store our bags while we went for a drink in a nearby cafe. The room we had (junior suite) was absolutely fantastic and although it was at the front of the hotel we never heard any traffic noise. The staff were extremely helpful and recommended some really good restaurants in Trastevere and we weren't disappointed once. The nearest one and our favourite was Le Fate which on Via trastevere, you turn left out of the hotel and its about 800 metres down the road. Great restaurant, lovely atmosphere and quite a traditional decor, perfect for the opening night of our honeymoon. One of the outstanding features of the hotel is the roof terrace we went there every night before we went to dinner and when we got back. In fact we took a bottle of wine there one afternoon to relax in the sun, really good views and so relaxing and very romantic at night. Trastevere is a fantastic area to stay and this hotel is so well located away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre but with the tram stop outside its so easy to get in and out of. We will definately stay at this hotel again and this area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: JacquelynMD
Reviews.Content: The Trilussa is one of the best hotels I've stayed in while on personal travel. It's not only affordable but very clean, contemporary and the staff is extremely knowledgeable and helpful - everyone from the front desk to the servers in the restaurant. Gianmarco was a particular favorite of ours. There are great little neighborhood restaurants if you walk out of the hotel and toward the city (to the left). Ask the front desk for their recommendations. They arranged for one to pick us up/drop us back, free of charge. A few things that were interesting to note however, first there are no bureaus. At least not in the Double room/standard. Bring hangers or request them to hang your clothing. Also, there are no face cloths, just bath towels. Bring one if you need it. Finally, if you need something ironed/pressed, you have to go through the hotel. They do not provide them in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace Hotel an elegant treat”
Reviews.Author: Alessia88
Reviews.Content: Date: November 8, 2007 Reviewer: Stoney Creek Ontario, Canada We looked for a reasonably priced hotel to celebrate our 20th anniversary in Rome. We also were looking specifically for properties in Trastevere as we were told of this area's charm. The hotel was great. We arrived early on a Sunday morning and were told that we could store our luggage and enjoy the rooftop garden or the Porta Portense market as our room was still occupied. They took our luggage and were very helpful orienting us with maps, transit tickets and made suggestions as to how we could spend these few hours. The hotel was very nicely appointed, very clean and the bathroom downright luxurious. The bed had a memory foam mattress - divine! The best sleep we got on our whole vacation! The hotel is on a main street, but the windows did not let the bustle of the street penetrate, so we had quiet nights, but the ability to open our door to a small balcony to watch the spectacles of the street. A generaous breakfast was included and served in the dining room as a buffet. Remember to ask the wait staff for your morning cappuccino, otherwise brewed coffee is available in an urn. However, what made the hotel outstanding was the very professional and attentive staff that served us throughout the hotel. They were very friendly, and always made eye contact when you came through the door. It truly felt like coming home. Thank you all at Trilussa Palace for a wonderful 20th anniversary 2nd honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace Hotel - great staff - great location - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Woodieboy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the hotel staff could not be nicer or more helpful. Really refreshing to get such good service. I travelled with 2 friends and we were booked into a triple room, but they upgraded us without prompting to 3 single rooms at no extra charge and showed us the triple room too and let us decide. We took the single rooms and the shower is fantastic! Built in radio, steam etc, just what you need after sight seeing. Another big plus is their Spa Room. You book it by the hour and it is yours only for that hour. It is bliss and very reasonable. It makes you feel so pampered. The jaccuzzi is huge and place is spotless, soft soothing music is piped in, pretty candles dotted about. Perfect for a girlie afternoon or romantic for couples. A must do if you are staying there. We also treated ourselves to the massage and got a very good rate. Location is ideal as a short walk away to main attractions or jump on a tram. Do get the sight seeing bus as it is a 24 hour ticket so we were able to make use of it the following morning too. The only thing to mar our fantastic weekend was that we booked our taxi via the hotel to take us to the airport for our return journey. Due to a language problem we were ferried and dropped at the wrong airport! We only just managed to flag down another taxi who spoke English and broke the speeding limits to get us there with minutes to spare before check in closed! Other than that, book it. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ATL-Travelbug
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews from Trip Advisor. All in all, the reviews are accurate and the candid photos are spot on. We booked a superior room inclusive of breakfast for 4 nights. The rate is reasonable considering the size of the room and bathroom. For European standards, this was a large and very clean room. The bed was comfortable with nice linens. My only complaint regarding the room is the bizarre shower - honestly, it is the strangest thing I have ever seen. I never could get the temperature right. The breakfast offered plenty of choices - meat, cheese, pastry items, juices, cereals, etc. Again, a large buffet for a Eurpoean hotel. If you are not a breakfast person, save some euros and skip this service. It you are a hard core traveller, use the breakfast as a good start to a long day of touring. The #8 tram is just outside the front door and makes a trip into the city so simple and easy. I found the guest services depended on the staff person. Some staff members seemed to be much more helpful than others but they all spoke English. The hotel location is decent. It is on the edge of a boho chic neighborhood which means turn left as you walk out of the hotel and all is fine... turn right as you walk out of the hotel and the neighborhood is not that great. Our room was on the second floor (3 levels up from the street) facing Via Travestere which means there was a bit of street noise at night. But, that is to be expected in Europe. I would stay here again which is always the true test of the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: Eadie_7
Reviews.Content: Travelled with Ryanair to Caimpino Airport. Taxi to the hotel cost £72 Euro. Stayed at the Trilussa Palace Hotel for four nights with my wife and two kids (15+9). The staff were very friendly and helpful from the minute we arrived. We had a Junior Suite Room and paid approx. £250 per night including Continental Breakfast. The room was more than adequate for all of us, although it was a scramble to make breakfact in the morning with only one bathroom.The shower is an experience when you can manage to work out all the functions, best to send the kids in first and then they can explain how it all works.Breakfast was continental and quite limited in choice and was ok, however you can order hot food from the menu at an extra charge. The onsite Spa facilities were fantastic and you can book this for 1 to 2 hours for your own private use (60 Euro for 2 for 1 hour). We bought a 3 day ticket for the tram and metro and found this to be good value. The no. 8 tram stops right outside the hotel and takes 10 minutes to get into the city centre. From there you can reach most of the sites to visit on foot (good pair of walking shoes recommended). Another good way to see the sites is to buy tickets for the tour buses, we bought our tickets from the Hotel(16 Euro for adults / 8 Euro for kids, however i wont recommend this company as we waited from 1/2 an hour to over an hour at the stops on a bus. The best tour buses appeared to be Christian Roma who seemed to have loads of buses on the road. Its best to get on the tour bus from the first day and stay on for the full round trip and then get your bearings as to where all the sites are. The Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel was the pick of the bunch and i would defy anyone not to be moved by its beauty and colour. Closely followed by the Colloseum which is incredible, i would recommend just strolling around this without any tour guides and letting your imagination do it's own job (and 11 Euro better off in your pocket). We never had to queue any longer than 30 minutes to get in to the major sites, although i can imagine that this would be a very different story in the middle of summer. Weather was sunny and around 60-70 degrees every day and just perfect for site seeing.We found a nice place to eat near the Trevi Fountain called the Suggestum Cafe, food was excellent and good value. Our experience overall on the restaraunts we visited was good and as in most cases if it is full of locals it cant be that bad. All in all a great trip and well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMarysmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights while visiting our daughter who is spending the semester in Rome. I asked her to find a hotel near her apartment that would meet her standards. She could not have done better. The hotel was spotless and the staff could not have been nicer. Our room was on the 4th floor facing Viale Trastevere. It was quiet and comfortable. The breakfast was good. there are many fine ristorantes within walking distance. There was a tram stop across the street (1Euro) that would take you to " Argentina" from there you can walk to almost everything. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel highly.When we left we arranged a transfer to the train staion through the hotel. It was cheaper 25Euro than the taxi (40 Euro)we used when we arrived and the driver was very courteous and drove safely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: frijoles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pefect! My friend and I stayed here for 4 days. The staff was very helpful and spoke pretty good english. The rooms were very nice and clean. The beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was nice as well. (once you figured out the space-age shower) The only downfall to the bathroom was the vacuum cleaner-like hair dryer! The location of this hotel is perfect!!!! It is right next to a major tram line and bus line that will take you anywhere in the city! I highly recommend spending that little bit extra and staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, Great Little "Extras" in this Wonderfully Overwhelming City”
Reviews.Author: NJinRome
Reviews.Content: Just returned (as in "2 hours ago") from a first-time, six day stay in Rome. Reviews (and special pkg. deal through Alitalia, a fairly mediocre airline if my two flights were any example) brought me to Trilussa, and I would highly recommend it to someone looking for a great little hotel with several "extras" that make it stand above the rest. I agree with other reviewers that staff here really stand out--pleasant, eager to help (except for one tall guy, but maybe he was having a bad couple days) and knowledgeable about everything you need to know as a first time or seasoned visitor to Rome. You won't be blown away by the outside of the hotel, but inside the rooms are lovely, quiet, & nicely appointed (I didn't have trouble with the "Star Trek" showers, and I'm 6' and not exactly thin. Fiddle with the shower's sauna control and you get your own "mini-spa" thing going on). We also made advance reservations for a 30 min. "conventional" massage (a little tame by massage standards, but great after a long day walking around) and 30 min. foot reflexology thing in the truly lovely spa and gym area on the basement level. I only got a back massage for my 30 mins., but my traveling companion got front and back for the same time period--might want to specify. Make use of the front desk staff--they pointed us to good restaurants (enjoyed Le Fate for casual dining down the street, and had a truly wonderful meal at Antico Arco, just up the hill in the Giancolo District--make reservations & take a taxi) and helped with all sorts of obscure questions (i.e. "Where can I buy stamps for a stamp collector in the city?") For a gorgeous and free view of some of the best parts of the city, climb the steps to the Vittorio Emmanuele monument--"the wedding cake"--and budget time to wander around the Campo di Fiori market area. If you have kids on the youngish side make a special trip to the Rome Children's Museum near the Flaminio Metro Stop--one of the best I've seen, and I've seen a few. Definitely pay for a guide to see the Vatican Museum (the lines must have been a half-mile long--scary long)--we had Angel Tours which was fine (maybe a "6" on a scale of 1-10)--and worth every penny of the 45 Euros just to skip the line and get a little info. besides. (Our guide was very nice but if she talked about Michelangelo and his "posse" one more time I thought I was going to have to intervene.) Eat gnocchi on Thursdays (old Roman tradition) and get coffee beans to take home from Tazzo d'Oro coffee store--they even have branches in the Fiumicino airport. FYI, budget MORE than two hours to catch that internat'l flight home--huge lines and a long way to walk to the gates meant I only had 5 mins. to spend extra Euros and buy all the little gifts I forgot to get before at all the great airport shops. Enjoy, enjoy, enjoy...there's truly no other place like Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Our introduction to Italy”
Reviews.Author: mcyclebabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights during our first trip to Italy. The hotel is located south of the Trastevere area, but within walking distance to good local restaurants. We had a clean room with a modern bathroom. The beds were very comfortable, too. The staff was very helpful and friendly (English-speaking).

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home...”
Reviews.Author: Summerchill
Reviews.Content: The rooms a touch on the smallish side but comfortable... the area is not all that exciting but it's close by tram and bus to everything. The staff especially one chap was quite friendly and very helpful. They went out of their way to make sure all was fine and we found what we needed. I do recommend it to anyone who is looking for a place in Rome. Not too far away are very good restaurants different from the typical Roman fare... Not too far from the airport but of course the taxi driver on the way in tried to charge us 10 Euros for the "bags"... note on the back of the taxi he can only charge one Euro for large bags... so we settled on 5 Euros but really he should have charged only about 2. hey no sweat! Breakfast at 5 Euros is very good and not expensive compared to most places and the atmosphere in the resto is quite cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Roman holiday...”
Reviews.Author: Livingwithidiots
Reviews.Content: The three (two adults, one teenager) of us stayed here at the end of August and had a fabulous time. Our rooms were plenty big enough and very clean and the showers were... interesting! The hotel is out of the centre but even in the heat, most days we walked the 30mins or so to the sights. Trams and buses are easy if you want to go further afied, as we did, and the guys on reception were more than helpful when we asked for the best way to get to places. Ivo is a great pizza/pasta place just a 10 minute walk from the hotel and Il Boom is worth searching out for the small, Roman menu and fantastic 50s/60s interior. A cocktail on the hotel's roof terrace every night was the perfect end to a perfect day...

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel for a charming city”
Reviews.Author: Selinaz
Reviews.Content: A first glace the hotel appears to be on the outskirts of the city, but with the tram stop just outside we found that were enjoying dinner in the back streets of Trastevere in minutes or in the heart of the city in about 10 minutes. Tram aside, it only takes 20 mins to walk into the city from the hotel and that’s when we were strolling, ice cream in toe! Our room was small, but enough space for my husband and I to manoeuvre around each other, clean and quiet. No view to speak of, but that didn’t matter – the roof top bar gave us plenty to gaze over. The only down side was the small bathroom. Although clean and well equipped, only one person could comfortably be in there at a time and although the high-tech shower looked amazing and did all manner of things including turning into a steam room and sauna, it was a little too small. Nonetheless, once we mastered the art of showering in such a small space, it provided no problems, particularly as the water pressure was so good, that it was difficult to spend any longer than 10 minutes in there to get a good clean from the day’s sweat! Breakfast was poor, but typical of many European hotels. And beware of the asking for eggs. We asked for scrambled eggs, which was lovely, but they didn’t inform us that we had to pay for the eggs on top of our inclusive breakfast deal. Nonetheless, the hotel manager dutifully removed the cost of the eggs from our bill when we explained that we were under the impression that all food consumed during breakfast was included in the price and that the staff had not told us that it would be an extra cost. All in all a lovely hotel - have already recommended to others and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Place to Come Back to, Wonderful area”
Reviews.Author: cappy1986
Reviews.Content: After a small upgrade, we got the deluxe room, which gave us more space. Wonderful bathroom with great massage shower, radio and steam. We had a voucher for private time in Spa, a bottle of wine on the rooftop and free breakfast. We love the area, near great restaurants and jump right on the tram to center of town. Most people at the desk were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: mmarrano
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon in Rome. We spent 8 nights at Trilussa Palace and loved every minute of it. When we arrived to the hotel we were welcomed by an extremely friendly hotel staff. Before we left for Rome I contacted the hotel to have champagne and flowers placed in our room, and everything was taken care of perfectly. We were even upgraded to a junior suite free of charge. The room up on the 5th floor was very big and spacious with a sitting area separate from the bed room, which was very nice. The bed was one of the best beds Ive ever slept in at a hotel. The bathroom was very llarge and my wife really loved the shower. Its also very quiet, we felt like we were the only ones on the floor. The rooftop terrace was great....My wife and I would have a nice cocktail up there each night. Its especially nice at sunset. The view is incredible. The neighborhood near the hotel called Trastevere and is a very hip, urban area much like Greenwich Village in NYC. It was within walking distance of all the sites in Rome. Everyday we would take the Tram 8 which picks you up right outside the hotel to Argentine then venture out from there. We always ended up walking back to the hotel late in the afternoon and each time we would end up finding something we wouldn't have seen taking a taxi or a bus. On thing we did which we highly recommend to everyone is to take the Angels and Demons Tour of Rome based on the Dan Brown novel. We did several tours in Rome all of which are a must especially if you don't speak Italian, but this one was hands down the best. It takes you all over Rome, which makes it a good tour to take at the start of the trip, and it was quite informative. Our tour guide told us things about the major sites in Rome that are not in any of the tour books. You wouldn't have to even have read the novel to enjoy this tour. Well worth the money. Stay at Trilussa Palace, we will be when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, if you're happy to compromise a bit”
Reviews.Author: northernash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the recommendations on TripAdvisor. We'd recommend it to anyone who knows what they're in for and is after good value. Although not located in the heart of Rome, the transport links for the hotel to all parts of Rome are excellent, whether by bus, tram or taxi. The Trastevere area itself is one of our favourite parts of Rome and, if you're comfortable with a bit of graffiti and dim street lighting, is pretty safe if you keep your wits about you. We were quite happy to wander round the area at night discovering new restaurants, bars and gelatarias along the way. Our room was fairly comfortable and spacious - the bed was certainly amongst the best I have slept in anywhere. However, the shower/steam cubicle is tiny, and I would not recommend it for anyone larger than average. For me, this was the major downside to this hotel and the only reason I would hesitate before returning. The staff of the hotel are generally very helpful and responsive, although we were very unimpressed to be locked out of our room late at night after returning from a long day's wandering, as reception wanted to know what time we were checking out the next day. Also, it took two days to get the Pay TV fixed in our room, not that we then used it given the limited selection of content available. Although the rooftop terrace is pleasant (in good weather), this really isn't the sort of hotel that I would want to spend much time in. We really used it as a base for wandering around Rome, for which it was fine and good value. But for the shower, I wouldn't think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in suspect area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SkyDallas
Reviews.Content: Trilussa is a very nice hotel for the money. The downside is that it is in Trastervere, which is not a very nice area of Rome. In addition, the hotel is not close to the metro, which, in my opinion, is more easily understandable than the numerous buses and trams that run past the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay at best”
Reviews.Author: PimpinDaddy
Reviews.Content: The Trilussa is an okay hotel, not 3 or 4 stars though. The rooms are small, but that is typical of Europe, so no big surpise. The one surprise was the lack of enough storage space for clothing, just a small armour with no drawers. The hydromassage shower in the room didn't work and was never fixed though several calls were made to the front desk. Likewise, we we're tired one night and tried to watch an in-room movie, which also didn't work and was never fixed. I thought the breakfast was poor, though if you like sweets for breakfast than this may be your place. I've stayed in Austiran / German hotels were the breakfasts included were amazing, champagne, brie, various meats, cheeses and fresh crossants and this one did not compare. The roof top bar / terrace is very nice, drinks are expensive, about $10 US each. They say they serve light fare on the terrace, though I never saw a menu, nor was ever asked. The front desk staff is very nice and helpful with directions. We stayed 6 nights and the maid never changed the sheets. I know because there was a pen mark on my side of the bed on day one and it was there the last day too. Probably wouldn't stay there again or recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location for getting around”
Reviews.Author: Melf123
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from a lovely holiday in a great hotel in a fantastic city. I thought I would share my tips and expereiences with fellow travellers. Arriving from the airport The hotel was easily reached by getting the train to Trastevere and then the number 8 tram or number 3 bus (right outside train station) for a couple of stops. The tram and bus both stop right outside the hotel. On arrival at reception the very helpful and friendly staff gave us a map and marked on the tram and bus routes and the main sites. The staff really are helpful and speak excellent English. The Room We stayed in a twin room on the 5th floor. The room was lovely - good climate control, very comfy beds, fluffy towels, nice big wardrobe with internal lights, little balcony, bar fridge.The only complaint would be lack of storage space - not one drawer in the room which was a little frustrating. The shower is amazing - different settings and steam jets and radio (but not great for any slightly larger persons as it is a tight space!). Tip for the shower - to use the steam jets or radio you need to switch on the swich next to bathroom light. Breakfast There is a massive choice of croissants - all delicious. Try the wholemeal ones - they are yummy! Nice coffee and then the usual bread, toast, cold meats, cheese, cereal and fruit (apples, plums, kiwis and peaches). You can also pay a little extra to get eggs etc. Room Terrace The roof terrace is lovely in an evening - comfy chairs and a little swing seat. Cocktails are very nice and there are lovely views over Rome. Definately worth a visit. Spa The spa is very nice and can be hired out by the hour privately or used in the day along with other guests for about 15 Euros each. There was a deal on in August for two people to hire out the spa for private use for an hour for 30 Euros, normally 50 to 60. A lovely way to relax after a busy day walking around Rome. Getting Around Walking - it takes about 20-30 mins to walk from the hotel to Piazza Navone or the Colleseum and another 5 mins or so for St Peters. You really can walk to all the main sites very easily. - Tram and Buses - The number 8 tram goes from hotel to Argentine - which is very near to Piazza Navone. You can then get the number 62 bus to St Peter's - but it is only 5 - 10 mins walk. The number 3 bus goes from hotel to the Colleseum. I'd recommend a day pass (4 Euro) or a 3 day pass (11 Euro) as this covers all the buses and trams and metro. Transport is very good. What to do We stayed for 5 nights, which was a perfect length to see the sites.and relax a little. My personal recommendations for a 3 day visit would be:- Day 1 - the Vatican Museums (need 2-3 hours). get there early (9am ish) as it closes mid afternoon and there are big queues. About 13 Euros - St Peters (an hour) - free Day 2 - The Forum (1-2 hours) - free - Piazza del Campidoglio and Altare della Patria (the big white monument for Vittoria Emmanuele) this has amazing views over Rome inc Colleseum and the pretty cafe does a lovely salad. - The Palatine if you have time (an extra hour but could spend longer as its very peaceful) - you have to pay but the 12ish Euro price includes entry to the Coloseum and if you go here first it saves you the queue at the Colosseum ticket office!). - Colosseum Day 3 -Castel Sant Angelo (The castle) - 7 Euros - An hour to two hours. try the pretty cafe for a drink (food not great). Fantastic panoramic views od Rome inc bridges and St Peters. -Piazza Navona - sit and have a drink on the square - v expensive but very atmospheric to people watch. The cafes around the little streets are cheaper for food. -Pantheon (free) - half an hour -Trevi Fountain - half an hour In the evening - Campo de Fiori and Piazza Navona are both really nice at night- each 5 mins walk ish from each other. Also see the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon and St Peter's at night. I would NOT recommend the green Rome tour buses - they dont go to many main sites and the commentary on the headsets is ru bbish - very little information, lots of rubbish music and you see much more just walking around. The number 110 red tour bus seems to stop at more sites but we didnt try this so not sure if its any better. I would definately recommend the hotel - it is nice, clean and has lovely staff and its so easy to get everywhere from. A great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews posted here on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. The Trilussa Palace Hotel is one of those hotels where you feel that the staff and management are really proud of what they're offering. Everything from the moment we checked in to our final day of leaving was excellent, the service and knowledge of the staff was amazing, especially Paolo. Location wise, as noted in previous reviews, the hotel is in the Trastevere area of Rome - great for restrauants, but on the other side of the Tiber River. Our favourite was La Fate (only a few blocks down from the hotel), a great recommendation from the hotel, a family run restrauant where food was excellent and the wine was all sourced from the local area. Connections into the main area of Rome (where the majority of tourist sights lie) are easily reachable by either tram or bus (both stop right outside the front of the hotel). No more than a 10 - 15 ride to anywhere (and cheap too €1 per ride). I was a little concerned about the 'remoteness' of the location of the hotel but after experiencing how easy it is to travel around Rome, the location is definitely not an issue, and definitely a plus if you like to be away from the crowds. The rooms themselves were small but clean and well appointed. Beds were extremely comfortable. The shower we found was a bit over the top with all its nozzles and extra settings but nothing to detract from the whole experience of the stay. Did have a problem with the hot water though, it took a while for things to get hot enough. Overall, I loved this hotel and will definitely come back for a return visit. And thank you to all the staff for making Rome such a memorable experience. Grazi, grazi, grazi!

Reviews.Title: “Just came back... its the best”
Reviews.Author: SydinUK
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our extremely "HOT" (38 C) holiday :-) and stayed in this hotel. Honestly it was the best choice I made, this place is simply awesome. The staff was very helpful specially the night recipient named "Ahmed" who really was very humble - he also offered us free coffee and fruits. Its very close the central, we walked and it took us about 20 mins. You can also take a no 8 tram which takes straight into the city. The room was great, best shower I ever used in a hotel. I must say that we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Trilussa Palace!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiddoc215
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. From the first email, the Hotel proved itself to be first rate. They responded to every email, request, question or phone call immediately and addressed every concern. At checkin, we were warmly greeted and given maps, tour and restaurant information, anything we could need. Romina and Paolo were especially helpful. The #8 tram was right outside and easily brought you into the center of city for touring. The bus was also available and brought you right to the colloseum. We did take a cab to the vatican to save time and it wasn't too expensive. The rooms were nicely decorated, although small. We had a family room that was perfect for my husband and I and our 2 daughters. The breakfast was lovely in the morning. The girls especially loved the hot chocolate. I was concerned about being in Trastevere but the dinners there each night were reasonable and delicious. And we found a playground with a climber that kept the girls delighted while we had dinner. Finally, the spa was wonderful after a long day of touring. We would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NanaAnne
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I spent 4 nights at the Trilussa Palace in July 2007. We would go back tomorrow if we could! The rooms were a little small by US standards, but there was still plenty of room and the beds were indeed heavenly. Outdoor temperature was over 100 degrees, but the hotel always had good a/c and there was never a glitch. The desk staff was extremely accomodating and the massage I had was once of the best I've ever experienced. Very easy to get to from the airport (take the train to Termini Station and get on the H bus. It stops 1/2 block away). We loved being in Trastavere as there wern't so many tourists and we walked, took the bus or the tram and found it very easy to get around. Lots of easy fairly inexpensive restaurants within a 3-block walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SteeDublin
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 and we occupied two triple rooms for 5 nights.Hotel location was perfect for exploring the incredible sights of Rome.The tram stops almost outside the front door of hotel.Our rooms were excellent.Staff were helpful and friendly.Breakfast was included in our deal,not all of our party enjoyed the breakfast----it was a bit limited.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jscottd
Reviews.Content: We just spent 9 days in Rome. The Trilussa Palace Hotel is a small, well run, quiet, and very clean hotel in the Trastevere section of Rome. The staff is friendly and helpful. A tram runs down the middle of the street which will take you to the center of Rome in less than fifteen minutes. The hotel is not in walking distance to famous city sights, the tram or the bus is a must. The area is safe with restaurants, snack bars, and other stores nearby. The hotel provides an internet connection in the room, if you bring your own laptop. The rooftop is open and offers a nice view of the city. This is a small but nice hotel! Before you book online, write them an email and they might cut you a deal. [--]. ([--]) The hotel does not have a restaurant or a swimming pool. Use of the nice spa is an extra charge. The boring morning breakfast is not worth the money; skip it and go to one of the many restaurants in the city. Be sure to check out the huge flea market across from the hotel every Sunday. (From the web site- Hotel Trilussa Palace is located in the famous Trastevere area, the center of ancient Rome – this is not true! The hotel is not in the center of ancient Rome and they know it. The hotel is on the other side of the Tiber river with the rest of Trastevere. This is no big deal since the short tram ride is not a problem.) Unless there is a change in management, this hotel is a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LJaneM
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is spectacular -- clean, spacious, great bathrooms and a staff that works hard to accommodate. Every modern amenity, and comfortable, comfortable beds. Even a choice of foam or feather pillows. I was initally concerned because it is located in the Trasteverde section of Rome, not the "heart" of the city. However, the "heart" is a 1 euro tram ride away (6 euro taxi) and Trasteverde is the sort of "Greenwich Village" of Rome -- great restaurants, enotecas (wine bars) etc. The tram is a straight shot literally from the doorstep of the hotel to the area between Vittorio Emmanuel monument and Piazza Navona -- and it's air conditioned. We had a junior suite, and our children (28 & 23) had a twin room. Both were great. We booked with inclusive breakfast, which was European style -- very few hot choices -- but scrambled eggs, omelettes, etc were available very reasonably. THE ROOF GARDEN! We began and ended every evening on the wonderful roof garden, with a glass of wine and spectacular view. They arranged transportation from airport to hotel, and from hotel to port of Citiavecchia. On time, quoted up front, modern van and helpful driver. Do not miss this hotel! You'll love it! Jane from Ohio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: HelenMManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We only spent one night there as it was our last night in Rome after travelling around Italy for a while. The staff are so helpful I have never been to a hotel where they have made you feel so comfortable from the minute you step in the door. Sergio was so sweet and so too was Lorenzo who provided us with many drinks on the roof terrace and bar. I cannot remember the names of the other guys there but they were all very nice. The rooms were very clean and well equipped. It is true that the showers are amazing! They roof terrace is great and the breakfast was really good too for only 5 euros each. There is a spa attached to the hotel and I arranged a massage at short notice which was so relaxing and good value. On Sundays there is a massive flea market just outside the door which is great to wonder around. (Careful you can get lost!). There are some great places to eat just a few minutes walk from the hotel. I recommend Sale and Pepe about 5 mins walk on the left. Great Pizzas and wine. The hotel arranged for their driver to take us to the airport for a reasonable price and the driver was lovely too. I really cannot recommend this place enough. You will not find nicer nor more helpful staff in any other hotel in Rome. Book it!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: ATLDee
Reviews.Content: I booked the Trilussa for the last two nights of my stay in Roma after reading the reviews from this site and was not disappointed! The rooms were large by european standard, very clean with updated and elegant furnishings, and the beds were awesome.. Temperpedic.. But, it was the bathroom that did it for me.. fabulous!, A jetted shower ,with music and steam., albeit, a little small, but still wonderful, after a long day of walking through the summer heat in Roma...The location is just far enough away from the touristy area of Trastevere, about 1/2 a mile. and the bus to the dowtown area of Rome is literally across the street., for 1 euro, couldn't be any more convenient! The reception staff was extremely helpful and courteous..I felt they went out of their way to accomodate our needs. I would definitely stay here again... A special thanks to Andrea!!

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful in Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: CyndiAtlantaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: July 22-30th travel. The hotel was fabulous! More than what I expected. By standards rooms in Europe are small as are the bathrooms. Not here. You start with a warm welcome and in english if that is your first language. Andrea, was always helpful and informative. The king size room is large and the bed splits into 2 singles, so if you change plans or whatever it can accomadate your situation. It has a room safe alot of closet space and a desk area as well. Very nice furnishings. Now, for the bathroom. Get ready because this hotel has turkish baths, mine had a sauna and shower. Yes, it is small by our standards however, it had a radio and seat in it so that when you come in from the day, and you want to soak you can do so. The bathroom also has a magnified mirror so you can see. Also, you can retrieve your email and have internet access for a fee right from your room. I think it is 6.50 Euros for 24 hours. Breakfast was included and you should ask and confirm because sometimes breakfasts can be very expensive. Not here. Right outside their location is the Metro / Eletric train. The Metro is 1 euro for 75 minutes, if you get caught without a ticket it is a $52. euro fine. Don't chance it. You can travel to all of the historical sites. There is probably something I am missing,but this hotel is a 5 star for Europe standards in my opinion. The price was right as well. The restaurants next door were great and they fill up quickly. This area (Trastevere) is a nightlife all by itself. Check out the flea market on Sunday right outside the hotel. You find find anything there cheap. Any questions please feel free to contact me. I found an excellent restaurant right behind the Mcdonalds on Trastevere road called "il pastarelli" i believe. Angelo is the owner and his son Francesco speaks english well. Excellent food. A must try. Ciao,

Reviews.Title: “a "best" hotel”
Reviews.Author: joytogo
Reviews.Content: Seldom have I felt so comfortable when entering a hotel. The front desk staff makes the guest feel like the only one in the room and answer most questions before they are asked. Ever smiling, always attentive, well informed about happenings in Rome describe Sergio, Edoardo,Romena, Andrea, Paolo. From showing the jewelry in the glass cabinets to arranging massages to finding a toy store and directions to get there, everything is possible and findable with these people. Not only would I return to the Trilussa but I am recommending it to my friends. The rooms are comfortable and clean. There is a radio in the shower and it can also be a mini-sauna. We didn't need a sauna inside, we experienced sauna conditions walking outside in July.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Anniversary in Rome - Thank you Triussa!!!”
Reviews.Author: carlydestro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a month searching the internet for a perfect hotel in Rome for our first wedding anniversary - we were looking for a 4/5* hotel which didn't break the bank! We initially wanted to stay at the Aldrovandi hotel as friends had recommended it, but after finding out the cost, a whopping £230 per night - we just didn't think it was worthwhile spending that amount of money when realistically, how much time are you spending in the hotel? My husband came across the Triusaa Palace and after being fed up looking at hotels i said 'just book it' and I’m so glad he did. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the lovely Sergio who immediately announced that our room was being upgraded to a Suite, then he showed us a map marking out all the main attractions and how to get to them. Whilst doing this the bell boys had collected our luggage and taken it to our room. Before being shown to our room we were given a tour of the Spa & Roof Terrace Bar and then taken to our room and shown how everything works, the tv, in room internet, movies, safe, and the super steam power shower!! We were out sightseeing almost immediately, the main centre couldn't be easier to get to with the tram (number 8) right outside the hotel - tickets are 1€. Trastevere is a fantastic place with lots and lots of wonderful restaurants and after dinner they had a great market on with singers and entertainers in the street - which was only about 10mins walk from the hotel. My mother secretly arranged for champagne & fruit to be in our room when we came back from sightseeing on Saturday - when i spoke to her she said how wonderfully helpful they were in organising it. I couldn't recommend the hotel highly enough and i would definitely stay there again when i return. The room, the area, the staff, the breakfast was all perfect. The only thing i would mention is that they don't have ironing facilities, which meant the hotel doing it at a cost, but you're on holiday so who cares! If you’re in Rome to spoil yourselves i would also highly recommend the restaurant BABY at the Aldrovandi Hotel. It is simply out of this world, the food, the service, the atmosphere, the waiters were all incredible - we were treated like royalty - but cheap it aint! But it's definitely an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: doctormichelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and after much deliberation I am so glad I chose both this hotel and this area. We got the train from the airport to Trastavere station and then got the tram a couple of stops to the hotel. On arrival we got a great introduction to the city and which buses/ trains to catch to all the attractions by the hotel staff. The room was good, perhaps a bit small, but we did only have the standard double room and maybe other rooms are bigger. Breakfast was good and the roof terrace was great with really good views of the city. Trastavere itself is a great place to eat and drink at night and had a really great atmosphere with plenty of restaurants/bars. It seemed like it had a more relaxed feel after the hustle and bustle of the centre during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgiagir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Trilussa only one night but was very impressed with the hotel and staff. The rooms and hotel are immaculate. We had 2 connecting rooms and paid about $250 for each room through Travelocity. The tram in front of the hotel is VERY convenient to the center of Rome. The area of the hotel is safe and has a lot of nice nearby restaurants. Take the tram to Santa Maria. It is a very atmospheric area of Travestavere, with tons of traditional Italian restaurants. Don't miss the rooftop terrace and bar. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Rome: The Trilussa Palace Hotel & Spa - The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: TravfreeCalfolks
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our trip through Italy. What a treat - we were spoiled. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Most importantly - it had what turned out to be the most comfortable beds during our entire trip. The Trilussa is strategically located just a short bus or tram ride from all of the major attractions. Each day we walked a few doors down to purchase an all day pass for the transit system for 3 Euro each, walked across the street and jumped on the 3 bus to the Roman section or the 8 tram to the Pantheon and further bus connection (62) to St. Peters square. In ten minutes or so you are at all of the sites without having to stay near all of the crowds, traffic and noise. The restaurants next door provides tasty bargains and a short walk or tram ride puts you in the heart of Trastevere where there were numerous great restaurants. Defenitly recommend dining in nearby Trastevere! We especially liked the San Marco. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly - and everyone speaks English. The staff was great in helping us navigate the city. In addition, my son had a great massage at the spa. We also spent the end of our days at the rooftop lounge enjoying a drink or a nice glass of wine to end our day. The Triluissa is a wonderful hotel and we would definitely recommend it to anyone and plan on staying here again on our next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DesertCrabbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Palace for seven nights and had a great experience. The front desk staff is great, especially Edoardo who took care of booking a car rental for us among several other favors. We had booked a "superior" room on line, but when we arrived we were upgraded to a junior suite. The room was very clean, and the daily maid service was good. My only complaint about the room was that the shower was a bit compact for me. I'm 2m tall and could barely turn around in what we called "the pod". The location of this hotel is great too. I like my sleep, and had no problem with noise here. Getting to all the major attractions is easy with a quick ride on the number 8 tram right out the front door of the hotel. We only tried two restaurants in the Trastevere area, and they were both great. Our favorite was Le Fate, a quick walk towards the Tiber from the hotel. The wait staff was friendly and professional, and they serve a local wine that was the best we had in Italy. We liked it so much we went back and bought three bottles from them to take home! Oh yeah - the food is great too. I'm not really sure where the hotel fits in for value in Rome. We thought it was expensive, but so were all the other places we looked at. We chose this hotel because it had the highest Trip Advisor rating in our price range, and we were not disapointed. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GillWhitleyBay
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. Arrived late at night after long delay in train journey from Innsbruck. Within 10 minutes of arrival at 11pm we were sitting on the roof top terrace, drink in hand! The staff were always friendly, attentive and helpful. We were given map of Rome at check in and advised of key bus routes to major sights (day ticket excellent value at 4 euros, valid on bus, tram and metro). From Rome Termini bus H drops you off within 100 metres of the hotel. Tram 8 from Largo Argentina drops you within 50 metres of hotel. The trams run every few minutes from outside the hotel and the journey to the end of the tram stop (also large bus interchange) takes about 10 minutes. The room was immaculate with an extremely comfortable bed and the bathroom was small but adequate. Showers, as everyone comments, are amazing. Towels changed daily. The breakfast room was light and airy and there was a wide choice of cereals, breads, croissants, continental breakfast and fresh fruit. The icing on the cake for us was that we checked out at 9.30am but the hotel kept our luggage until our return to the hotel at about 2pm. We asked if it would be possible to change into our travel clothes and were taken to a room downstairs with a shower and fresh towels. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A quality, clean and freindly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cowpat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Trilussa Palace Hotel, Rome. On our arrival we were given a tour of the hotel by a very polite, English speaking hotel assistant manager. This included a tour of the roof garden which we used to relax in at the end of a busy sight seeing day before turning in for the night. The room was small but the large bed was extremely comfortable. The mini bar doubled as a fridge for fresh milk - bring your own travel kettle! Room decoration was simple but elegant and very clean. Room cleaning service was excellent with regular clean bed linen and new white fluffy towels every day. The small bathroom was complete if a little compact - have fun with the invigorating power shower - water jets go everywhere! It was pleasant to go down to a breakfast room with bright surroundings and a good continental breakfast with a good variety of choice. Don't be put off by the slightly "out of town" location - the trams and buses stop outside the hotel every 4 to 5 mins and will whisk you to the centre of Rome (takes 5 mins) for a good start to exploring the centre of the city. Plenty of eating places to, suit all pockets, in close by Trastevere district - try the small streets around Santa Maria in Trastevere for an excellent choice of Tratoria. Oh, and don't forget to complete your meal with a "home made" ice cream from one of the many Gelaterie in the area. Polite and helpful staff will assist with your travel information for sight seeing in Rome. Don't miss the opportunity to stay at this First class hotel

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the Trilussa Palace or it's staff- excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MG-Cheltenham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Palace on the 17th June2007 to the 20th June (2 couples). We stayed in the double superior rooms which were immaculate, as was the whole hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, on booking in we were given a map with all the bus and tram routes on and had a tour around the hotel. It is a short distance from the centre which is very accessible and there are many good restaurants within a 10 minute walk (more reasonable than near the centre). The terrace was delightful to enjoy a drink in at night, it was a little warm earlier in the evening and umbrellas would be useful. Breakfast was very good- continental with plenty of variety. I would certainly return to this hotel and thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier.”
Reviews.Author: heightsabroad
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the strength of the reviews in TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Stayed for 4 days in June, 2007. Was greeted by Paulo at check-in, who could not have been nicer or more helpful. The hotel is small, clean, and nice. The bed was outstanding. The staff -- exemplary. The hotel is across the street from Tram 8, which runs through Trastevere and to the bus circle. Excellent restaurants are within walking distance. The roof-top lounge was a relaxing way to end the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastico”
Reviews.Author: siennalondon
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, shower with jets, comfortable beds, staff extremely helpful offered us a map on immediate arrival at the hotel which really helped. Big hi and thanks to Paolo who was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat cold but luxurious and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaCuisine
Reviews.Content: Had some trepidation about this one, but it turned out great. Room was wonderful, the fancy shower was troublesome to figure out even with instructions (only got the steam to work one time -- tip: make sure the vent at the top of the shower is open in order to get steam, though this didn't seem to be the only key). Balcony was a big plus. The area is fine, not very scenic except for some views across ugly apartment buildings toward the sights across the river. But it's a short walk up the street to great restaurants of Trastevere, and there is a trolley/train that stops right in front of the hotel which takes you to a major bus hub at Argentina. The front desk staff was hit-and-miss-helpful but sometimes off-putting, as when I stood in front of a guy who was on the phone for several minutes and he never acknowledged my presence, not even eye contact; then when I gave up and went back to room received a call within minutes and he ended up recommending a fantastic restaurant--Hosteria Glass--with pickup and dropoff service by taxi (and the driver refused to take a tip). On a different afternoon, the woman at the desk opened the indoor bar early so I could get a beer to take to my room after a long hot day of walking, and she was very friendly and joking in a good way about American accents. We never saw the rooftop place for drinks/snacks open, though I can't say for sure that we checked during posted hours each night. Also it seemed that even though we had little interaction with the staff, they seemed to know very well when we came and went, as there was always evidence of someone having come into our room to "tidy up" when we got back from some excursion. Maybe that is what makes this hotel "four-star", I just wasn't expecting it. Overall I would recommend this place, very comfortable, especially the bed, but this was not my first choice and I wouldn't pay the posted rate (found a better rate via internet). Very convenient but just a little bit out of the way, and somewhat institutional-feeling. The spa is definitely worth renting for an hour or two -- felt like an emperor in there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb friendly hotel the Trilussa in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: maximus60
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the hotel at all, good friendly staff, lovely roof top bar and a superb breakfast every morning. Just wish they had a restaurant for evening meals, it would have come in handy sometimes after walking around Rome all day. Rooms very clean. Max & Jill from Aberdeen Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: LeeParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Palace for 7 nights running from 27 May to our check out on 3 June, 2007. I hated to leave. The staff was always helpful, friendly, and courteous. The room clean with a wonderfully comfortable bed. Yes, the shower stall is small but the different jets made it quite the experience. Excellent water pressure throughout our stay. We had a balcony off our room (room 612) which was a nice bonus. Breakfast every day filled us up with goodies and carried us through as we explored Rome. As many have stated, the number 8 tram goes right by the hotel and is very convenient. We also took the number 3 bus from the stop across the street to get to the Colosseum and Forum. Bought transport passes from the tobacco shop just a few steps away from the hotel. Trastevere is a terrific area. A 10 to 15 minute walk (at most) will bring you to dozens of restaurants in a truly charming area. We mostly dined in establishments on the left side of Viale di Trasevere (going in the direction towards the river from the hotel) but did try the right side one evening and found a lovely restaurant there among many others. And the gelato...yummy! We (my gentleman friend and I) enjoyed Rome very much and staying at the Trilussa Palace made it extra special. We both agreed that the hotel was a "winner".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Darkbird50
Reviews.Content: Without doubt what made our short stay so memorable was the tireless efforts of the hotels staff. The Hotel is comfortable in the extreme, I have never before left a hotel with no notion of what I could possibley complain about. The hotel is in Trastevere and eating opportunities are endless. Smack bang on the main Bus and Tram routes into and out of the City makes for easy access and tickets are available in Reception. A great little hotel and we will use this gem time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: navykid
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel in a perfect location. When I booked this hotel, I was a little apprehensive due to some negative reviews I had read. However, I personally cannot say anything bad about this hotel. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was friendly, accommodating and very professional. The room and shower are on the small side but both were immaculate clean and nicely decorated. Special thanks to Maria in the breakfast room. She made us feel welcome and special each and every morning. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a hotel out of the mainstream but yet in close proximity to all the sites. JG - Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: I chose the Trilussa Palace Hotel because it was in the top 10% of hotels rated on tripadvisor.com, it was close to town, and it was relatively inexpensive compared to other top rated hotels (I paid around $250 USD for a mid-week one night stay). The neighborhood is working-class residential and there were numerous basic shops and low-end restaurants. It was about a 15-20 minute walk into the nicer parts of Rome across the Tiber River. (Ask for good directions, though.) My basic room was small and recently renovated. High-tech light switches and an ethernet outlet next to the small desk. (The hotel advertises WiFi in the rooms, but my room had zero signal, but at least they had the foresight to put in the ethernet cable -- 10 euros per day.) The view from the room was of a courtyard and apartment buildings. The window was small, but it opened, and the light fixtures made the room seem bright and airy. The mini-bar had a very limited selection, but the prices were reasonable. (1.50 euros for a half-litre bottle of water.) The TV had BBC and CNN, but a very small choice of pay-per-view movies. Maybe 20 movies total, with about half in English. The bed, however, was a big disappointment. Two small (*very* small) twin beds set next to each other, each comprised of a 5 inch think (12 centimeters) foam pad on top of a hard plywood base. Not very comfortable and not what you expect in a top rated hotel. The bathroom was small, but they managed to fit in everything, including a bidet. The high-tech shower, however, was another disappointment. It was a fully self-contained steam shower, body massager, and multi-shower unit, with a built in seat. But it was extremely small. You could not sit on the seat without your knees pressing against the glass door. The five different shower settings spit out an unsatisfying combination of water streams pointed in various directions, some intentional and some un-intentional due to poor installation of the fixtures. Other rooms might have better showers, but the shower in room 318 was a disaster! I didn't experience the food, but all the staff I met were friendly and efficient. The lobby area was moderate in size and well lit, but a bit too grandma in style for my tastes. The roof-top terrace was nice -- a great place for a beer and a view of some of Rome's landmarks. All in all, it seemed overpriced for what you got, but all hotels in Rome are overpriced during tourist season. I would probably stay there again if I could get a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood location”
Reviews.Author: Fisheggs
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel in a residential neighborhood with wonderful restaurants nearby (I would recommend Le Fate). The room was comfortable, the breakfast very good and the staff friendly and helpful. There's also good access to public transportation. The only downside was the street noise in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great But not so Great”
Reviews.Author: ValenAgudo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and has a great spa. We received a great room with a great steam shower. Then my husband took a shower and there was water everywere. We called downstairs and they sent up the very friendly bellboy/man who then spoke to reception and they offered another room or to have this room fixed the next day . so we agreed on another room, i then took a shower and the shower was usable but also broken and the room was smaller and smelled dingy. so i went downstairs and mentioned to the gentleman in reception that i was very disappointed and if there was anything they could to help us. I expected for them to offer us something..a discount free breakfast (because its not included) after a while of him telling me that these were my two options he finally offered a bigger room on the 8th floor. It was a very good room with the exepction that the airconditioning sounded like a fishtank, but it was more than acceptable. I must say though, the steamshower completly revives you after a day of walking through Rome. So in conclusion, the Hotel has a great Shell but has quirks within. The terrace is amazing also! It has a bar and an amazing view. Preatty good location , with very good restaruants around.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, modern, well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: glendale-member
Reviews.Content: I share the views of most other commenters here. This is a very good, modern, well maintained hotel. A short word on transportation. It really is easiest to get from Fiumicino airport to the hotel by taking the local train and getting off at the Trastevere Station. It costs about half the price of taking the Leonardo Express and you avoid arriving at Roma Termini, Rome's main train station, where the Leonardo Express ends. Roma Termini is across the city from the hotel. Getting off the local at Trastevere Station allows you to ride the No. 8 tram (streetcar) only about 2 stops to get to the hotel. Its tram stop is Plaza Ippolito Nievo, about a half block from the hotel. When you get on the tram, you need only drop a 1 Euro coin in the fare box inside. My problem, however, was that I arrived at Fiumicino about 10 p.m. The stations along the local train route were not lighted, so it was hard to tell in the darkness what station you were at or even see which side of the train to exit on. It all worked out well for me, but had I known how hard it would be, I would have taken the Leonardo Express and caught a cab to the hotel. As noted, the No. 8 tram runs in front of the hotel and takes you into the main part of the city, ending at Largo di Torre Argentina. This tram comes by very often--every 5 minutes or less and so is quite convenient. An alternative is the H bus, which stops about a block from the hotel on the far side of the street and goes to Roma Termini. In the main part of the city I had an outstanding seafood lunch at L'Orso 80, located on Via dell'Orso about 2 blocks from Piazza Navona, which I found recommended in Frommer's.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikesroma
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in Italy and made our home base out of Rome. I did some very extensive research on hotels before booking as it has been many years since I have been to Italy, and never with my wife and kids. We absolutely loved Trilussa Palace and all of the great things that others have said about this hotel are true. The rooms are well furnished, great shower and absolutely the best bed I have ever slept in. The staff is wonderful. Eduardo was extremely friendly and helpful when you check in and gave great suggestions on where to eat, transportation, etc. The young lady who manages breakfast (Swedish, and I apologize that I dont remember your name) was also very friendly and made us feel right at home. Then, there is Trastevere! What a great part of this wonderful city. I know lots of people have talked about catching the tram in front of the hotel (which is very easy), but we walked EVERYWHERE. The Colloseum, Forum, Jewish Ghetto, Vatican are all within a 30 minute walk. It was great! I think the best were the restaurants in Trastevere. Try La Cisterna (ask for Romero and the special tour of the ancient cistern in the basement). Great Roman cuisine. We had roast lamb and rigatoni. Also try Hosteria Capo Roma for great veal and steak. All in all, we would go back to Trilussa. Oh, did I mention the spa? Try a massage as you will need it after along day in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn0
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Rome trip, staying at the Trilussa Palce Hotel. The staff were fantastically helpful from the moment we checked in. We were given a map of the city with an explanation of the trams, buses & how to get to each of the sights. We had brought a book with maps but really this was not necessary. The quality of the hotel furnishings & fittings was superb & the staff extremely polite & helpful. The hotel is located in the Trastevere area, slightly out of the centre but within walking distance. If you don't fancy the walk, the tram stop is directly outside the hotel. Rome is a noisy city & we thought we would have problems, as we had a room at the front of the hotel. Not so! The room was soundproofed & very quiet. The breakfast is great, it's a buffet but with with the option of a cooked breakfast if required. This does cost extra. There are many restaurants within walking distance which are very reasonably priced. Nip down the side streets, they are much better & cheaper & they do speak a little english. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: ldaley50
Reviews.Content: Perfect weather, great food, and a wonderful hotel in a great location! That was our week in Rome staying at the Trillusa Palace. The location is superb, the tram is right in front of the hotel and a short ride will take you to all of the ancient city attractions. The service was friendy and informative and we felt welcome right away. If you enjoy flea markets as we do you will be stunned when you wake up on Sunday morning and look outside. Overnight a huge tent city appeared filled with wonderful things .Antiques, textiles, new designer clothes and shoes and anything else you can think of and all we had to do is cross the street. At exactly 4 pm it all disapeared as if it never existed. The rooms are very nice , we had a triple and it was comfortable. Clean linens every day and turndown service, a nice breakfast buffet, and all of the cappuchino I could drink. What more could you ask for! The spa was great after a long day of sightseeing.The restaurants close by were wonderful and we found a different one everyday just by walking down the side streets..I can't wait to visit Rome again soon and I will be sure to stay at the Trilussa Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Oasis”
Reviews.Author: KelliD
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be a truly pleasant surprise. The location, while across the river from the main ancient attractions, is ideally situated to the excellent casual restaurants of Trastevere. It is across the street from a tram that goes right into the city center in about ten minutes. A great place to stay if you are at all interested in the giant Sunday Portaprese flea market (also across the street) and I had a very good massage in the small onsight spa. The laid-back staff is pleasant and courteous. The strange space-age showers were the only small drawback in an otherwise great experience.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: irishkatie
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! Clean, pleasant room, tasteful decor, soundproofing that really works, very comfortable beds. True the rooms aren't vast, but there is plenty of space for luggage and really, what else would one need space for? Very helpful, pleasant staff, Romina and Andrea especially were only too happy to advise on restaurants, public transport and what to see and when. The hotel is very easy to find too, just get the bus H from Termini station and get off at Piazza Ippolito Nievo (stop 7), the hotel is about 20metres ahead on the same side of the road. The 3 day, 11euro transport passes are extremely good value for money. Bearing in mind that the city is over 2000 years old and that the many attractions are therefore not beside each other, we found the location to be very convenient.
