The No. 8 tram stop is just outside the door, and it is 5mins by tram (or 15mins on foot) to Trastevere and 10mins by tram to Torre D'Argentina, where you can get bus 62 or 64 to the Vatican. A 15 minute walk will get you from Torre D'Argentina to the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps or Pantheon in one direction or Piazza Venezia, Colusseum and forum in another and a 5 minute walk in yet another direction gets you to the Piazza Navona. Trastevere itself is a lovely place to have dinner, we particularly enjoy "Dell Fratte" and "Glass", while the Trattoria "dell Amici" near the Capitoline was fantastic for lunch. The hotel itself doesn't have a restaurant, but there is a Chinese restaurant next door and the very pleasant Enotecta "Orange" two doors up the road, for snacks, lunch or drinks for the lazy. However, with Trastevere only a 15 minute walk up the road there really isn't an excuse not to venture out for dinner. The spa was very luxurious, and my 55min Thai massage with Lianne was sheer bliss. Save your pennies for a massage, it is totally worth it! The shower/steam in the en suite bathroom is wonderful, and the seat makes it very easy to shave your legs if you stand with your back to the doors and put your foot on it. Failing that, a lady could always sit on the lavatory and shave her legs in the bidet! We were particularly impressed with the breakfast, considering most Italian people have coffee and a pastry for breakfast, the choice of cereals, breads, pastries, cold meats, cheeses, salad, fruit, juices, teas and coffee was outstanding and very ample. If none of that was to your taste one could also get a hot breakfast for a small charge. Really, there is nothing I could fault this hotel for, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would go back again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience of our European adventure”
Reviews.Author: SecretAsianMan84
Reviews.Content: We spent a month in Europe, and this was the second last hotel we stayed in the entire time. After being in many "four star" hotels that were filthy shacks with lousy service, Trilussa Palace was a very welcome change. We stayed entirely in four star resorts on the trip with one three-star exception, and this hotel was by leaps and bounds the best. Service was incredibly courteous and helpful, and we weren't snubbed at all for our inability to speak Italian. Upon checkin, the guy at the desk had someone send our luggage up to our room, and took out a map. He highlighted all of the big tourist locations for us and showed us how we could get there quickly and cheaply. He also shared lots of tricks about how to see the attractions while spending the least money or time. The hotel is located right next to a train station, which made getting around very easy. The hotel itself is slightly out of the way from a lot of the tourist attractions, but the proximity to public transit made sure that getting around was a breeze. The hotel itself is very clean, very recently renovated, and very well maintained. Some of the "four star" hotels we stayed in had broken airconditioning, moldy carpet, noisy rooms, etc. Not the case here. A pristine high ceilinged room with hardwood floors, a turkish bath, and everything looked brand new. We were so tired from our travelling we spent the whole first day in the hotel, where in most of our trip we had to escape the hotels in our budget to get some relaxation. There is a great little rooftop patio/bar with an excellent view. There's also a spa that sounded really good, but we didn't have the chance to book it. Unlike many of the complementary breakfasts we had in Europe, the breakfast at the Trilussa Palace is actually quite good. There are some great restaurants a short walk away. If going to Rome again, and we plan to, we will make a special point to try to stay at the Trilussa Palace again. I would happily pay much more than their reasonable rates, but don't tell them I said that :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DebDebGlasgow
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed at the Trilussa Palace for 4 nights as a Mothers Day treat and really enjoyed the experience. Despite being a little nervous when we first arrived (the area can appear abit run down at night) we were pleasantly surprised at how close to the centre of Rome we actually were. The staff could not have been more helpful (especially Romina who helped us on several occasions with viewing some of the lovely jewellery on sale in Reception!). The Tram is an easy trip into the centre (although is crowded from very early to very late every day). all in all a good experience (and don't miss out of the private spa experience).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed thoughts”
Reviews.Author: DEA-7
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome, on the whole, are not very good money. If you are looking for a reasonably priced 4 star hotel in Rome then do consider Trilussa Palace. The upsides are 1. You are only a 15 minute walk from the river, which gives you access to the main tourist areas 2. There is a tram stop outside the hotel's front door 3. There are some lovely restaurants and bars in the Trastevere region (young and studenty area) within 10 minutes walk 4. The rooms were clean and reasonably spacious 5. The shower is great (loads of options and even a seat) BUT there are downsides including 1. Awful towels that fall apart when you use them and leave annoying fluff all over you and your floor 2. The rooms are quite noisy on the road side of the building 3. The concierge at the desk was incredibly rude - to such an extent that I would never stay here agin

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Online-Buy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March 07, the room was very clean and equipped with satellite tv, air conditioning, climate control, telephone, mini bar, high speed data port (you have to pay), safe. Marble bathroom come with slippers, heated towel rails, hair dryers, and toiletries, see the shower, great! All rooms are sound proof dressed with tapestry and parquet flooring. Decorated with armoir from Luigi XVI era with traditional style furnishings. The breakfasts in the hotel were pretty good. The Hotel is located in the centre of historical Rome on Viale Trastevere, within walking distance to the most places of the city (30–45 min.). Infront of the Hotel is a bus and tram service available. For Dinner, try the restarurant, "Le Fate" from the hotel to the left for approx. 200 meters, delicious food and housewine.

Reviews.Title: “Ok--but not what was expected”
Reviews.Author: dnvrgal
Reviews.Content: After having great success following advice from TripAdvisor reviews in the past, we had high expectations for the Trilussa Palace. Unfortunately, these expectations were not met. This is a decent mid-range hotel--but for those expecting a top-end hotel, you will be disappointed. Our room was very small, service was spotty, breakfasts only fair, and the location left alot to be desired. The saving grace of this hotel was the wonderful rooftop terrace where we would have cocktails in the evening and enjoy the view. If value, rather than luxury & location, is your goal--this hotel might work. We, personally, would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCshaker
Reviews.Content: This is just a great place, I admit to being a spoiled American- so I enjoy a really good bed and shower. The staff is just so helpful, the breakfast is very pleasant- coffee is great. The shower is worth the stay. Granted this is a bit off the beaten path- but the transfers are so simple and just outside the door and it is nice to get away from all the crowds. Down the street there are many lovely little places to eat as well as a grocery for interesting picnics. I stayed here to be near my daughter who is studying there- but I could not imagine a better location. If you are staying over a weekend, the Sunday morning flea market- just right outside- is so much fun. Even though the roof top caffe was not open during our visit- we enjoyed resting there in the afternoon, as we had great weather, and the veiws of Rome in the evening.Thanks

Reviews.Title: “would not come back”
Reviews.Author: TLNewYork
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were not satisfied w/ trilussa Palace and can not believe that this was rated a 4 star hotel. Once I arrived, I found out that breakfast was not included w/ standard room and there would be a cost. The room had terrible lighting and was very dark. The shower had a chair inside which took up half of phone booth size shower. It is impossible for ladies to shave their legs. I empathize w/ any obese people that go to this hotel because they may need fire department to take them out of shower. Bathroom was so small that as you sit on the toilet you could bump your head on towel rack which is about a foot away. There were 2 channels on television for English speaking guests BBC and CNN, all other channels were in Italian. Me and my husband paid to watch a movie so that we had something to do in this boring hotel. The Bar is a small quiet room w/ limited cocktails. All other rooms are closed except for breakfast room in morning. I asked to speak w/ manager about above issues and I was told that manager was not at hotel that day. I was then asked if I would like to pay for an upgraded room. There was no way that I was going to pay one euro more so I stayed in standard room! The neighborhhod near hotel was dirty w/ garbage all over streets. However, it was close to transportation, affordable restaurants. Staff at front desk helped us w/ bus routes and directions. Despite all the problems, we had a nice vacation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Leonard2308
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome. Trilussa Palace Hotel is absolutely lovely, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff are so friendly and helpful nothing is too much to ask. Room service, the spa and our massages also made our trip very enjoyable i would highly recommend this hotel and the facilities it has. Although the hotel can be quite a walk to the tourist attractiions there is a bus and tram service available.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: nick123Nottingham
Reviews.Content: Hey this is a very good hotel.The staff could not be more helpful and attentive.The rooms are very clean and well maintained. Youre in a very popular area of Rome and yet there was little or no disturbance during the night due to the excellent soundproofing of the rooms. i would recommend this hotel and area as it is very convienient to all the sights of Rome as the trams and buses run from just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Got to hire the spa!”
Reviews.Author: bexster-8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Trilussa Palace for our anniversary in January. We were so pleased with it for everything really, it is a good hotel for the area(Trastevere is lovely) and it is so easy to get about, the trams are really easy. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a decent clean hotel in walking distance to the Trastevere area (loads of lovely restaurants) and train or bus distance to all of the sites. It is such a lovely city. You should definitely make sure you hire the spa for your own personal use for an hour, we did and it was great. 'The boy' (that's what the receptionist called him !!) was great and set everything up for us, fluffy robes, slippers, towels, turkish bath, sauna and jacuzzi, candles and champayne and this was gone midnight. The beds are so comfortable (as everyone else has already said) and the staff were friendly and helpful. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would go back to the Trilussa with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in all areas”
Reviews.Author: Robrud&family
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic Hotel, very professional staff, spotlessly clean, great breakfasts with a friendly waitress each morning. The rooms were typical European and would be considered small by US standards but we found them excellent. The hotel is only 5 minutes out of the centre of the city and the tram and bus stops are right outside the hotel, it was just 11 euros for an unlimited 3 day pass for all public transport. I can't recommend this hotel enough, if like me your willing to sacrifice a little on the location to get a clean hotel of superior standard then this is the one for you. We only had one problem in that our LCD TV in the room did not work and it wasn't sorted until our final night in Rome. The area around the Trilussa Palace is not without its own sights and top restaurants and boasts Romes oldest church. It was our first trip to Rome and we stayed three nights and are looking forward to going back in 2008. (PS If your flying Ryan Air weigh your bags before you go, we took one suit carrier which weighing next to nothing and a case with most of outr stuff in, this was to avoid my wife lugging a case, they charge you heavily for excess baggage and you can't combine allowances with your spouse, so be warned!)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: dkspud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the trilussa palace hotel for 4 days and really enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly and accomodating, the hotel is close to bus and tram routes and the private spa is worth every penny!! We would recommend it to anyone heading to rome, let them take good care of you!!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexliller
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel back in October and i'm only just round to writing about how good the place was. Initially I thought the hotel was going to be a way out, wrong, for people who haven't been to Rome, the city is fairly small, and you are only about 15 mins walk to loads of major sights. The furthest places of interest are at most a 30 minute walk, and you don't pay the outrageous prices of the hotels right in town. I'm a bit of a hotel snob, and although I was sceptical because of the comparatively low price I was seriously impressed. Our bathroom only had a shower, but what a shower. We had an amazing bed, and the room was very very quiet. The breakfasts in the hotel were pretty good, typical european affair, cold meats, pastries, tea, coffee et al. We didn't eat in the evening, so I can't comment, but the roof top terrace was a great place to have a drink and look over the roman skyline. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced quality break in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: al_carlisle
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at this hotel and I have to say, it was a truly great hotel experience. The rooms were clean, modern and spacious enough for a long weekend break. The public areas in the hotel were pleasant and the roof terrace would be great in the summer (unfortunately for us it rained heavily duiring our stay, so we didn't have the chance to use it). However, whilst the weather was damp, the service from the staff was anything but. On arrival the concierge jotted down all of the connecting public transport links between the hotel and the main sights of Rome, which for two first time visitors was a life-saver. Although the hotel appears to be outside of the main tourist areas there are excellent tram and bus connections just outside of the hotel, which take around 10-15 mins to get you to the centre of the attractions. Likewise, the benefit of staying in this area, flush with nice restaurants and bars, far outweighs the downsides of not waking up and seeing the Panthenon or the Vatican from your bedroom window. Also, further to recommending restaurants in the Trastevere district, the concierge arranged one restaurant to pick us up and drop us back at the hotel later that night evening, free of charge. I would like to say a massive thankyou to Gianmarco and Eduardo, two of the concierges at the hotel for their helpfulness and for making our stay exceptional. If you are considering staying at this hotel, there really is no choice to be made. I highly reccomend the Trilussa Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, not as central as we thought”
Reviews.Author: smilingtravelerBath
Reviews.Content: Had a nice time in this swish hotel, good size rooms and great breakfast buffet, staff nice and helpful. The location was a good 10 minute walk from the bustling bars and cafes in the area. A taxi from Campino airport should be around E40.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: Emily51
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Expedia. The staff in the hotel couldn't do enough for us, always very polite and friendly. The room was lovely, with a nice terrace to sit out in the sun if required. Also the power shower was great. The breakfast was a typical European selection which was more than adequate. We would go back again. Located just outside the central belt of Rome, but easy to walk to the Coliseum. Overall rating was 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “those nice people on the front desk and more.....”
Reviews.Author: sam058
Reviews.Content: excellent bedroom , really comfortable bed after all that walking doing the sites. cosy hotel, well appointed with frequent trams to the main attractions and restaurants. Oh, yes and those really nice people on the front desk who couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: BT_Texas
Reviews.Content: We just spent four beautiful days in Rome over the Christmas holidays, staying at the Trilussa Palace. The hotel is in great shape, accommodations were nice, and staff was very helpful, especially Eduordo at the front desk. Great location along tram line number 8. Also really liked being in the Trastevere district., with lots of great dining and shopping nearby, but not too busy.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maggie026
Reviews.Content: My nephew and I brought our 90 year old aunt to Rome as a birthday present. I selected this hotel because of its proximity to the Vatican and based on the information on the website. I could not have selected a better place to stay. The hotel is lovely, very well-kept, and convenient to public transportation. What made our stay so wonderful, however, really had more to do with the staff. They were so willing to accomodate our needs in every way. We arrived before check-in time (early flight) and they got us into the first available room. From there, I relied on them for everything. They called cabs (including one that took credit cards when I had forgotten to convert more dollars into euros), made dinner reservations, helped me book a wheelchair for my quickly tiring aunt, gave easy-to-follow, detailed directions, ETC. Most important, all of this help was offered with a smile and genuine concern for the guest. We were in the hotel on New Year's Eve, and for a very nominal fee the hotel set up a small party on the roof so that guests could view the spectacular fireworks at midnight. I have never been in a more customer-friendly hotel for such a reasonable price. This is simply a great choice for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Missfitz
Reviews.Content: We were here as part of our honeymoon, loved the Trilussa Palace and had a fantastic stay! However it might not be everyone's taste as it doesn't have much character and is a fifteen minute walk away from centre of things (though excellent tram service stops outside and hotel reception sells tickets). The things we particularly liked were - The reception staff were excellent - very friendly and helpful and with some excellent restaurant recomedations for good local food. -I think this is a great place to stay if you are looking for luxury on a budget as good deals seem to be readily available for this hotel. The rooms are a good size and have (hilarious) MASSIVE sauna shower things for two people - complete with a selection of light and sound programmes! Very comfortable bed, very clean. (there is also a spa and gym on site but we didn't use it) - It is in an interesting area with lots of good restaurants nearby -Rooms very quiet and well soundproofed Negatives - If you want to be right in the centre of Rome perhaps not for you. - The area is fairly up and coming so is not pristine but is interesting - No room service food wise ( i think this is about to change) and breakfast not fantastic but better than a lot of places we stayed in Italy and perfectly ok -The woman in the bar is misearble and has the telly on full blast all the time and bar prices are expensive (where as the mini bar is cheap! Bizarre!) Overall a great base in a wonderful city and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at the trilussa palace”
Reviews.Author: angiec999
Reviews.Content: our stay at the trilussa was excellent, great value for money. The entire staff gave exceptional service and were very helpful with any request. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean. The bed was great, there was no bath but an excellent shower. The hotel was very close to the various transport systems. For breakfast there was a good selection and fresh. the roof garden was closed due to the winter. I was given a complimentary massage and wine. What more could you expect from a hotel. We will certainly visit this hotel in future. Angela and Terry Hartlepool uk

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: billiea
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay in Rome, and 2nd in Trilussa Palace - dificult to see why any-one would want to stay anywhere else! the reception staff are always friendly and helpful; breakfast is "as much as you can eat" continental style with large variety of hams, cheeses, croissants, pastries and cakes, yougurts, fruit juices, tea/coffee - with the option to upgrade to Bacon & eggs served in various ways. The bedrooms are beautifully furnished, the showers are out of this world, matresses have to be experienced to be believed. Although Trastevere is a little way from the main town, we find the transport system extremely easy to understand and very low-cost. Favourite restaurants include Le Fate, a short walk to the left from Trilussa; and The Station - turn right out of Trilussa and walk towards Trastevere train station (or catch the tram for two stops). Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace - the Pro's and Cons.”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRomers
Reviews.Content: Being Frank, this hotel is the best hotel in a poor area. Small Rooms, but clean, recently (and sumptuously) decorated. Great Bathrooms. Front desk staff - great. Restaurant Staff. OK. Kitchen Staff - dubious! We saw food that had been uneaten and left on tables re-emerging from the kitchen, and put back on the buffet. When we objected to this, the woman who ran the kitchen became screamingly abusive and management gave a shrug and pretended not to talk English. We therefore reccommend: 1. Getting down to breakfast early, because they do NOT order enough pastries, and the other foods get low, so people wanting breakfast after 8.45 - 9.00ish have very little choices. 2. If you don't eat all you take - MASH UP what's left, so they don't put it back on the buffet. This is obviously not a hotel policy, but a kitchen habit. Don't let them do it! It's unhygenic and disgusting. 3. Be aware that your breakfast can include omelette, scrambled or boiled eggs. ASK IF YOU WANT ANY OF THESE - because it won't be offered by the restaurant staff.. However, apart from the rather disgusting kitchen habits, this hotel is good, and we'd stay again - following steps 1, 2 and 3. It's right opposite a Tram stop, so it is easy and fast to catch no 8 Tram to Argentina. From there you can get other places using buses or Trams, or the Taxi Rank. Most places (Trevi, Vatican, Colliseum, Parthenon, Thermal Baths, etc) only ever cost 5 or 6 euros by taxi. For your return you can find a tram or bus stop, and if it lists Aregentina on the board,, get tram back and repeat the process. We also endorse using the restaurant someone else has mentioned - turn right coming out of hotel, walk down on other side of road, then turn left at the bank. It's a pizzeria-restaurant on the left down that road. Ask them to explain the meat courses, or they'll try to fob you off with their lassagne - which is good, but so are many other things. Also, right out of the hotel, walk up a block, past the chinese/pizzeria (oh yes!) and you'll see a gelato bar on your left. It serves really nice food, day and evening. Good prices. One fairly undiscovered "wonder" of Rome is the Church of St. Ignatius of Loyola. It's a Trompe L'oeil church! Most of the painting inside was created hundreds of years ago to create a central Dome that doesn't exist and high vaulted ceilings, that aren't !! Absolutely amazing. Even Argentine itself is rathr nice, because the centre of the square is a large sunken garden area, (a drop of about 20 feet) which is railed off, and contains the ruins of 4 ancient temples PLUS scores of cats! It's their official and legal home - unwanted cats are neutered, vaccinated, and fed by a charity, and spend their lives basking in the old temples and on the grass. Only in Rome! BE AWARE that viewing the Sistine chapel is not as simple as it sounds - you cannot just see the chapel - you need to walk through many other galleries and down passageways - at least an hours walking - before you get to the Sistine Chapel. Even in December it was packed, and some of the corridors are narrow, as are some of the stairs, so you get jostled and pushed around all the way. It's not leisurely or peaceful! If you have trouble walking, (arthritic hips for instance) think twice and carry a stout walking stick! Back to the Trilussa Palace - it's opposite another of the wonders of Rome - every Sunday the most enormous Flea Market sets up opposite and it really is worth a visit. It seems to go on for miles. Silk scarves, Gucci Handbags, Brass and Bronze antique cherubs, carriage clocks, handmade Arabic jewellery, horn gramaphones, you name it and you'll find it on offer, and always BARTER! Because it works. To be honest, we'd go back to the Trilussa just to visit this fabulous flea market again - it leaves Cliquancourt in Paris for dead. But take care with your wallet or handbag - we're told that pickpockets abound.

Reviews.Title: “great service at the palace”
Reviews.Author: lLois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Trilussa. Although ranked a 3-star by Expedia we thought it ranked a 4 star for the nice size room and the service. Andrea was perhaps the most helpful concierge/person we've ever met-always willing to take time to answer questions. Getting helpful advice from him,in English ,made conquering Rome in "2"days alot easier! The breakfast buffet was the nicest of our entire trip. The hotel is located in Trastevere district-streets more typical of downtown with some litter etc. but flip-side is you are within walking distance of great pizzerias and eateries rather than high-end in most expensive 5-star tourist area.The no.8 tram and buses connect you to almost everything within 10-15 minutes and Andrea or others will tell you exacty what to take. A one-hour use of private whirlpool is available but we didn't have time.

Reviews.Title: “Total fabrication to gain bookings”
Reviews.Author: jackdawbay
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the description given by expedia everything started well being picked up as arranged from the airport. On arrival my concerns were justified by the location, which was a total nightmare a bit like commercial road at rush hour, but rush hour doesnt stop. the room was clean and comfortable, the hotel description was totally fabricated. 1/ Romantic dinners in the piano bar....No piano bar or even meals are available as this was removed one year ago. 2/ Have a romantic drink at our fully stocked bar.....forget it..This consisted of a work surface and a storage cupboard for spirits only where cocktails only at absorbatant prices only are available. 3/ Delux room room with bathrobes and slippers tea coffee facilities....Room in my oppinion was basic bed only, as extras were removed one year ago. All in all i felt sorry for the staff as they were excellant trying there best of a bad deal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: beule1976
Reviews.Content: We have booked the Trilussa for three nights end of October and arrived late sunday afternoon. The pick up service we have asked for was a disappointment and - in comparision to the Taxi tarif - too expansive. But : we were very impressed of the Hotel. The reception service was allways excellent (thank you Romina and Andrea). Breakfast was better than expected and we have enjoyed the wonderful Restaurants in Trastevere which are not far away from the hotel. The room - with a wonderful bathroom - was very clean - and the service in the Bar great. We will come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “From UK”
Reviews.Author: quang-onetel.net
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at Trilussa Palace Hotel and a kind thank you to the concierge for helping us find an Agriturismo thanks Edoardo. Quang and Abi

Reviews.Title: “'The name 'Palace' is decieving.”
Reviews.Author: BazandClaire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe double room for 3 nights in October and paid £540 which I thought was going to ensure a fantastic hotel. On arrival I was dissapointed at the exterior, basically a tall block tagged on to unremarkable residential flats, a petrol forecourt in front, and another block of flats to the other side. Not a Palace. The staff were pleasant enough on check in, and our luggage was carried up to our tiny room. Deluxe? Not sure why, other than having a fancy complicated peculiar jet shower (which we gave up on and used the ordinary one,) and a small balcony which overlooked a sixties style ugly building, not very Roman! Also on check in you are given a free drink voucher for the rooftop terrace. How nice. But when is a free drink not a free drink! We asked for a G&T and a beer. No. You can only have red wine, white wine or a soft drink. How ungracious, If you're gonna offer something do it properly, it would hardly have broken the bank. Breakfast. The air conditioning meant the dining room was freezing, and usually I find hotels too warm. The decor was very nice, lovely table cloths, but all top show as it was a lousy buffet style breakfast, fine if you wanted to fill yourself with sugar. There was nothing warm to eat, the milk to put in the coffee was cold, the croissants were cold even though they were in a heater which they wouldnt switch on. You could order eggs at an extra cost.! The waitress (who didnt serve you) asked our room number every morning although there were only half a dozen people in there, irritating. No robes or slippers provided which were in the description, small details again, and the air con in the room made it uncomfortably cool which the reception seemed unable to fix. The area is ok, handy for public transport, but we felt the Trilusa Palace was very over priced, We did love Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Graeat Loacation”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTravel
Reviews.Content: Trastevere is a wonderful and safe section of Rome. The hotels location was close to all the sites. It was a 25+ minute walk to the Vatican, Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The local train station was also close by to pick up tickets for Venice. Walk to Via San Francesco and Santa Maria Church for the best bars food and flavor of Rome. The hotel feels new. Rooms are large with thermapedic beds wood floors crown molding flat sceen tv and big marble bathroom. The room and hotel was very clean and well kept. Front desk staff spoke a little english and were very friendly organanized and helpful in directions, free map,and getting taxis. Breaksfast was limited but did taste good. Noise from the street at night but once you shut the new double pain window it was quiet. AC worked great. We can't wait to go back to this hotel and to this section of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: KAYJAYDEE
Reviews.Content: Unexceptional hotel. As other have commented - very comfortable bed in clean room but on the smallish side. Breakfast uninspiring with disappointing coffee -- ask for cappucino. Welcoming and helpful Reception staff. Lovely roof terrace for evening drink. Last minute holiday for 4 nights. Unlikely to return but would happily stay again if no other option. Didn't find the area a problem to walk through at night. Convenient No. 8 Tram stop for centre of Rome in 10/15 mins. Public transport cheap. Try excellent Orange restaurant 100 yards away although service is stretched when busy. Beware pickpockets on Trastevere station. Managed to foil an attempt to take purse from wife's handbag when boarding train for airport. Classic hustle when boarding. Lesson - Don't wait at top of stairs, move down platform.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ladyhelena
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a brilliant time. Although the hotel is a little way out from the attractions, everything is easy to get to and the staff are so helpful - each day they told us how to get to where we were going. After a long day of walking this hotel is perfect for coming back to relax in and the spa is wonderful. We booked it twice and it was so relaxing to be able to have it to ourselves and unwind. The cocktail bar on the roof is lovely too and surprisingly peaceful and romantic. The breakfast was not fantastic and although it was included in our package we were charged extra for having cooked food. The room had all we needed except a kettle and tea/coffee and everything worked well. I would stay there again but not sure if I could cope with traipsing around Rome again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Palace”
Reviews.Author: devonbelle
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in a 'superior' room which was one of the most confined hotel experiences I have ever encountered. The bedroom was smartly furnished and the bed (as others have commented) very comfy- but there was just no space for 2 of us to pass in the room and absolutely no storage space apart from a small wardrobe. All of the tables/dresser etc, were simply small flat surfaces without drawers which, after the first night, really was very irritating. The bathroom, complete with the 'turkish steam', was also cramped- I should point out that both my wife and I are small- in both height and girth! The basic fabric of the building is OK internally; externally it is actually the end of a modern apartment block- hence the lack of photos! Location isn't great but it is on a frequent tram line and is fairly quite- but not an area to be walking out in after dark- and, yes, we are adventurous types. Not a hotel I would return to- very expensive for what is basically a 2/3 star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: dividendo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location at very good price. Tram and Bus across street. 10 - 15 min to all main attractions and 20 to vatican. Nothing to write home on rooms, although everything was 'normal'. Nothing bad either. Breakfast can improve - few options.

Reviews.Title: “Great For First Time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cupertinotraveler
Reviews.Content: We selected the Trilussa Palace because more "desirable" 4 star hotels in Rome were all booked. Driving to the hotel in the car from the airport (arranged by the hotel) wasn't an uplifting experience, but once there we were very comfortable. We stayed in a spacious and comfy suite (albeit $600 per night - but visited the Raphael in Rome and found the same room would have been >$1000) but never got a chance to visit the gym or spa. Overall, we found the Trilussa friendly (Eduardo and staff gave us good advice), convenient (trolley outside goes right into mid-Rome in about 10 minutes and the Trestervere neighborhood is lively) and comfy (breakfast was all we could ask for, and the rooftop bar was a nice respite at the end of each night). Downsides: hotel has no real "concierge" (so if you want tours, entry into museums etc. you'll have to do it alone) and it's not in ancient Rome (it's across the TIber). But it gave us an excellent place to start. Here's a tip: if you get in late, there a a couple great restaurants down the street (but stay away from the Chinese restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rome!! and Trilussa was good too”
Reviews.Author: messytessy
Reviews.Content: Wow!! what a fantastic time in Rome, so much to see and do. We stayed a week. After walking around Rome 12 -14 hours a day, it was great to return to the comfort and cleanliness of Trilussa Hotel. Rooms very sound proof, room darkening curtains, smallish size room compared to Canadian hotel rooms but really for all the time you spend in hotel room, it was all one really needed. The front staff, Eduardo and another fellow were very knowledgeable and helpful, as well the breakfast person/ housekeeping staff were pleasant. Busses and trams run right outside hotel door. We took them first thing in morning then always ended up walking back late evening to experience the ambience/feel of Rome at night. Remember to take your map (supplied @ front desk) and off you go. Would love to return to Rome and would definitely consider Trilussa for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: PandACall
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, elegant hotel. The friendly reception staff greeted us on arrival and provided us with a map and excellent information about tram and bus routes and main attractions. The rooms and bathrooms are small but perfectly adequate - and very clean and comfortable. Breakfast of croissants, fruit juice and coffee in the elegant dining room set us up for the day and a drink on the romantic rooftop terrace provided the perfect ending. (Although 10 euros for a G & T was a bit of a shocker). We really enjoyed it here but the location is not perfect. We attempted to walk back from the city centre and found ourselves in a quite intimidating area which was just 5 mins from the hotel. In the evening the walk to the local Trastavere restaurants wasn't particularly pleasant either, although when we got to the main area it was lovely. As others have said, it's best to make use of the regular number 8 tram to get into the heart of the city. Most of the sights are just a pleasant stroll away from where the no. 8 drops you. Rather than walk into the Trastavere restaurant area we returned by tram into the city centre in the evening and ate in the piazzas. The tram felt safe at any time of the day or night. We would return to this hotel, we loved the staff, the decor and the roof terrace, but if you're looking for an area where you can go for a picturesque stroll in the evenings, this, sadly, is not it.

Reviews.Title: “An upscale hotel at a moderate price”
Reviews.Author: BostonIsStillTheBest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Trilussa Palace for 3 nights prior to boarding our cruise in Civitavechia. We have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. The service was excellent. The room was clean, well appointed and attractive. And we appreciated the free breakfast, which we only discovered on the second morning. The hotel is location on the "wrong side" of the Tiber. We took cabs everywhere. The cabs arrived within 10 minutes of being called and were not too expensive. But there is a trolley line right across the street from the front door which, we were told, goes everywhere. The neighborhood is interesting, definitely quite different than that where the major (and much more expensive) hotels are found. There are all kinds of outdoor markets around, which time did not permit us to explore, but which looked interesting. The one downside is graffiti, which covers the entire neighborhood and really most of Rome. We asked the cab driver whether this stuff was created by gangs and were told it wasn't. Perhaps all Romans consider themselves Michaelangelos. But the graffiti wasn't even good, like some you see in New York City, for example. It uglified what is essentially the most beautiful city in the world (in our opinion). The hotel has a rooftop bar from which you get a stunning view of the city. You can go up there and enjoy the view without buying a drink, if you like. There was a telescope there the night we went up. I don't know if it was a permanent fixture or not. In any case, this is an upscale hotel for a moderate price. You're giving away something in location, but the location is fine. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Nashvilletn
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome serveral times, always staying around the spanish steps, My friend said lets try Trilussa Palace. I am glad I did, it was one of the best places to stay. the rooms are small but very clean. the location is perfect, train stops right in front to take you any where. there are street markets on somedays that were fun, and the night life in the neighborhood is unbelievable , with Street performers. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. everyone in the hotel will help you with anything, Andrea on the front desk was so helpful and so nice to everyone. ( from mailing or stuff home to finding train tickets, hooking up my laptop, everything he helped with). the only thing I would change is the showers are really small, I wish they had a bath tub for my mom who came with us. The service in the resturant was excellent and the breakfast menu was perfect. when we left early in the morning on day trips the staff would get us a breakfast bag together. You can't beat this place, it felt like I was at home in Nashville, Tennessee, USA

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace Hotel recommended”
Reviews.Author: puddingmeister
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just returned from 4 nights in Rome staying at the Trilussa Palace Hotel. While booking we let them know it was our anniversary and upon arrival we had been upgraded to a junior suite at no extra charge. The breakfast was very nice (if simple) and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are good and have a very funky shower / steamer. But the real gem of this hotel is the private spa in the basement (don't miss this). I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Especially those looking for a bit of luxury on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Monument
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good 4.5/5. We had two rooms for four days from 28/08/2006. Both were spotlessly clean and probably above average size for a European room. Altough we were on the first and third floors, at the front of the building and next to the lift, the sound proofing was first rate and we suffered no disturbance to our sleep. The Hotel staff were always polite, helpful and very quickly sorted out a couple of very minor issues we had. Of particular note was the roof top bar (which others have mentioned). We took pre and post dinner drinks each night and enjoyed the great views of Rome. A particular thankyou goes to the lady who ran the bar - she was very friendly and treated us very well (It's us from 110) Although 15 minutes walk from the centre the public transport was excellent, a bus and tram stop very close to the hotel. 4 Euro's for a one day pass being excellent value. There were very good restuarants within 5/10 minutes walk in lovely Piazza's. Critisisms? - Very minor - The roof top bar only served from 18.00hrs, a little earlier would have been nice. The Shower/Turkish bath was a bit of a gadget and for us,a slightly larger, straight forward shower would have been better. A very good hotel which I would not hestitate to return to.

Reviews.Title: “A great break!”
Reviews.Author: Cockhill
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day break in Rome. The hotel was excellent and ideally situated with bus and tram stops across the road. Three of us shared a lovely room, with a balcony, at the front of the hotel. We had clean bedding every day and the room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The reception staff were extremely helpful and very knowledgeable about the city. We loved the roof top bar - a great place to relax and finish off the evening. The views are amazing. There is even a telescope! The Wellness Suite was also a great place to wind down and recharge our batteries after a day walking round the Vatican. We liked having it to ourselves for the hour. We would have liked the opportunity to use the restaurant in the hotel especially the first night but it was closed. However, the receptionist recommended good local restaurants which we tried and also arranged for us to be picked up and collected from a superb restaurant about 5 mins away by car. We all thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it. It was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rach994
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, just out of the centre of Rome across the river. The staff were very helpful throughout the stay, and the rooms were clean and fresh towels provided everyday. The breakfast is very good, an excellent range from cereal to fruit and yoghurts. There is a tram service right outside and is only 5 mins from Travestern train station. Just jump on the number 8 tram from main road at the train station and its just 2 stops, and the hotel is on your left (yellow building). Tram takes your accross hte river and then its just a short walk to the main tourist attractions. Well worth the stay would defintely go back, if not just for the extermely comfy beds which are great for tired legs after walking round Rome.

Reviews.Title: “'Little Paradise'”
Reviews.Author: meldawson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights and have just returned home. Thought I would put my comments down before I forget or get lost in the 'back to normal' routine of every day life! Wonderful staff, great welcome, excellent advise on where to go and how to get there. Chamber maid service was brilliant. Breakfast was continental and great, don't know why some people have given poor comments on this as we found the breakfast to be very good. Room was good standard and air conditioning was excellent especially when you have been sightseeing all day in 90 degree heat! Hotel was slighty too far out but my husband I and decided we liked that as it gave us a break from the bustling city. Number 8 Tram was fantastic and only took 10 mins to centre. Never ate a poor meal, drank wonderful Prosecco would definately go back, loved every minute. One suggestion, please could the hotel make better use of their roof top bar. Beautiful views of city but can only drink in there from 6pm and have access to it during the day but cannot take any food or drink in, seemed a shame as noone used it while we were there, what a waste.....

Reviews.Title: “staff was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: molly1989
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Trilussa palace from july 26th to the 31st..Loved it.. I cant say enough about the kindess of the staff...Our room was a triple and it was large! We had a walk out balcony and the bathroom was all marble and spotless at all times. The dining room was elegant with highback chairs.. I had read some negative comments , I honestly felt like they were talking about another hotel The rooftop bar was so romantic with oil torches surrounding the whole roof.. It was out of the main tourist area, that is true..But the number 8 tram is right, and I mean right outside the door. the tram always felt safe to our family, lots of locals.. Never felt uncomfortable.. Would go back there in a heartbeat..

Reviews.Title: “off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: chicagoboy23
Reviews.Content: location is little inconvenient - must take bus to metro. new rooms fancy shower but turkish steam did not work big bathroom very quiet friendly staff good price staff cleaned room every day great a/c - it was 100 F when we were there no good places to eat around there hard to catch taxis and if you call one you must pay 6-7 euros fee nice bed would stay again except for location goodprice

Reviews.Title: “If you're in the Trastevere area of Rome, stay at the Trilussa Palace.”
Reviews.Author: frdm2
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome at 7:00 A.M. on July 6, after flying + losing hours, & we were exhausted! We got to our hotel, the Trilussa Palace around 10:00. Walter, a wonderful young man at the front desk, suggested that we go into the breakfast room & have a cappucino while they finished getting our room ready. An hour later, we were able to unpack our things & rest in the VERY comfortable & clean room. The shower is a kick; it's kind of like a telephone booth. Walter was so helpful in giving directions to various sites, which trams/buses to take, making dinner reservations for us, etc. The breakfast at the Trilussa Palace is very good, & the cappucino is some of the best we had during our entire 2 week stay in Italy. Eduardo, who also works the front desk, made tour reservations & taxi reservations for us. We really enjoyed staying in the Trastevere area. It's quaint with great neighborhood cafes...very safe to walk around at midnight. The tram stops right in front of the Trilussa, so everything is very convenient. It's 1 euro for 75 minutes, good for riding the trams/buses/metro. The Trilussa even had extra tickets that we bought from them. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ntaormina
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 week stay in Italy where our journey began at the Trilussa Palace hotel. We stayed 3 nights and had a wonderful time. We arrived late Thursday night and wanted to get out for a quick bite. The night manager gave us a little place to go for pizza, pasta etc. where we had the best pizza (Ivo Pizzeria). The staff had wonderful recommendations for all of our dinners as well as how best to get around and see everything. The only downside, the shower is extremely tiny and there was very little space to store your clothes. Not good if your stay is longer than a night. On the plus side there was a wonderful flea market on Sunday directly across the street where you can get some great deals. Good times, thanks for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Auldun
Reviews.Content: Stayed four night at the Trilussa Palace on a city break at the end of April. Clean, comfortable and friendly staff - the man on reception provided lost of useful info when we checked in. The breakfast was more than adequate. but being Brits we missed not having an in-room tea maker!!. Getting to the hotel from Rome Ciampino was straightforward. Shuttlebus to the Termini rail station. Then just round the corner to the Bus station in front of the railway station, the the No. H bus drops you right outside the Hotel. every day we were there we got the No. 8 tram outside the hotel to the terminus at Teatro Argentina, the walked to all the sights from there. No problem at all. highly recommended for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for a Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: smith490
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights 13th -16th Jul 06 and really enjoyed it. Although none of the major sights are within easy walking distance (forum was 25 min walk in 37 deg summer heat!) Trastevere is very well connected to the rest of the city by speedy and regular buses and the no. 8 tram. The stops are just 100 yards from the hotel. Also the area is not packed with tourists and felt safe day and night. There are an increasing number of restaurants as you head up Via Trastevere but a great one not far from the hotel is Le Fate – small and friendly with great tasty food. The Porta Portese market brings Trastevere alive from early on a Sunday morning and is an experience not to miss if your stay allows. The hotel itself is pleasant, very clean with elegant décor. The staff were all helpful and particularly friendly were the bell boy and the waitress on the roof terrace. The roof terrace itself is a real treat – no famous sights to see just great views of the rooftops of the city and an excellent drinks menu. I booked a twin superior and was expecting a slightly larger room to be honest but it was comfortable enough for a short stay. The shower, with all its different settings, was great, the air-con was good as was the sound-proofing (never heard a fellow guest and could barely hear the shower from the bedroom). Only criticisms are that there is no iron in the room or available from reception so take your own (or be prepared to stump up hotel prices to have it done for you) and lacked in storage - drawers and better hanging space for long skirts/dresses would’ve been good. Had the chance to see a Junior suite and if your budget allows I would recommend stretching to this for the extra space (room for 2 chairs and a table), larger wardrobe and two windows. Breakfast was included and was very good value with a self-service selection of yoghurts, fruit, juices, teas, meats, cheeses, pastries and cake. For a small extra charge you could order omelettes etc. Service (to serve tea, clear tables etc) could’ve been a little speedier but on the other hand I didn’t feel rushed out the door in the morning. The spa was a bit of an indulgence at 40 euros for 2 people for an hour but you do get the place to yourself and it was very relaxing. There’s a large Jacuzzi pool with waterfall, a steam room, sauna and walk-in shower with various settings. There are also loungers to rest on and slippers, bathrobes and water are provided which is a nice touch. I didn’t try the beauty treatments as they were a luxury too far – rather pricey. On the whole my stay was very pleasant and good value at 150 euros per night bed & breakfast (though I wouldn’t pay more). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good location without the bustle of the heart of the city and something a bit more than a basic bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: SarahNewark
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend this hotel for all the reasons stated by other travellers. I suggest that you contact them to arrange a pick up from the airport. Their rates are very resonable and the taxis do have a tendency to overcharge. [...] Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck up staff”
Reviews.Author: Gaviscon1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Trilussa palace we got a very cold reception. I don't think the chap at reception even said hello, he just looked at us blankly as if to say "what the hell do you want?". Not a good start. The deluxe room we payed extra for was small and we could hear all the street noises through our sound proof window, and considering the Roman drivers use their horns every few seconds thinking maybe this would make the lights go green, it was noisy. We had arrived in the evening so instead of going out to look for a place to eat we ate in the hotel. Once again we went down to reception to ask if we needed to book a table but were confrunted with the another miserable employee who couldn't crack a smile. the food in the hotel was expensive and of limited quality. Now this brings me on to the breakfasts. Very poor quality, limited choice and when they say a selection of fresh fruit they mean a fruit bowel with whole apples and oranges. The fruit juice is squash and not very nice squash at that. I have no idea why a 4 star hotel does not serve fresh fruit juice, we payed enough to stay in the hotel. And the breakfast staff looked down their noses at us, once again not cracking a smile. Is it a hotel policy for the staff to be miserable? (although one waiter was very nice to us, happy and polite, but he was the only one). There is a fight for the yoghout's and the staff seem to only bring out the unflavoued ones so you have to ask for something a little more exciting. The chocolate coissants are made with nutella so taste very cheap. Sometimes the waitress's did not even come to our table for 20 minutes, just stood around talking to eachother. We hired the spa one day. Although it was nice it cost about 50 euro's for 1 hour which is far too much. As I said before the deluxe rooms are small and cramped, I can't imagine what the non deluxe rooms are like. The TV has only italian TV stations and the in room entertainment was not working. The turkish bath is far too small to wash your self properly. All in all the staff in the hotel are unhappy and unhelpful and when you ask for some help they do their best to make you feel stupid. Breakfast are awful and the rooms are boxes. Do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa staff and location are great!”
Reviews.Author: joeconmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Palace based on the previous tripadvisor reviews and weren't disappointed! We were there during an extremely warm last week of June. The public areas of the hotel are nice, but not well air-conditioned. We arrived early in the morning, but our room wasn't ready, so the hotel stored our luggage and we went off to explore. We returned a few hours later to find our room ready. We had a Jr. Suite-well, Jr is correct, it was very small! There was room for a bed, desk and chair, 2 chairs at the end of the room. The armoire for clothes storage was awkwardly placed in the entrance to the room. The bathroom was also small. However, everything was very clean, from the marble bathroom with nice quality towels to the hardwood floors. The shower(as expected) did remind us of the Orgasmatron from the Woody Allen movie "Sleeper", but we had fun trying to figure it out. My husband (who is a big guy), had no problem fitting in and showering. The air-conditioning in the room was terrific and the beds and pillows so comfortable. Very important after wandering around very warm Rome. The staff at the front desk was extremely helpful in getting us around the city. We took Tram 8 to "Tango Argentina" (as we called it) and from there, could get anywhere in the city. We loved walking around the Trastavere area at night-we ate at a different restaurant every night-all good. We also found great gelato. One night the trams weren't running because of a demonstration and we had to walk back from the bus and it was a great 30 minute walk. We were also catching a cruise from the port of Civitaveccia. We took the tram to the Trastavere station for 5 minutes (instead of having to go all the way to Termini the main train terminal) and then purchased a ticket to the Port for 6 Euros each. A taxi from Rome to the Port is about 150 Euros, so it was nice to have a close, easy option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - stay here”
Reviews.Author: Where to go nextt
Reviews.Content: Accomodation first class - well equipped room very clean. The turkish bath was very interesting!! The furnishings were very elegant. The hotel staff especially the reception staff were first class and very willing to offer help. Breakfast was adequate and indeed could be improved with more attention to juice/coffee which does run out. The location is fine either a 15 minute walk to Pont Garabaldi or the number 8 Tram to the centre for 1 euro. I would have no hesitation in staying here again - ok it is a little expensive, but it was very comfortable and clean and a reasonable location too.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trpplnr
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of our Deluxe non-smoking room was the cigarette hole burned into the middle of the bedspread. Next we noticed that the walls appeared to be dirty. They were covered with a cloth material, probably expensive, but hard to maintain. There were streaks and marks all over the walls. One area had a large water mark. Overall, it gave the room a rather skeevy feel. It was not clean under the bed and I found a lipstick within easy reach from a previous guest. I had read that this was a fairly new hotel, but our room already needed to be redone. The shower was ridiculously small. If you dropped the soap, you had to open the doors to have enough room to bend down to get it. A shower seat took up most of the room. There were many water jets and I think it was actually meant to be a luxurious shower with the seat and water jet options, but it was so cramped that taking a shower became an extremely frustrating event. I think it's important to note that we are thin people. The bathroom was so narrow, that if one person was at the sink, they had to step out of the room to let the other one by. The size of the shower and bathroom are the main reasons I would not recommend this hotel. We ran out of soap one day and toilet paper another. Once after cleaning the room, they only left one bath towel and one hand towel. We had to keep calling for various supplies, but they did bring them up speedily and with a smile. On a brighter note, the bed and pillows were super comfortable. Three out of the four front desk staff that we met, were very friendly and more than happy to answer all questions and offer any help. The fourth wasn't too happy to help, had a bit of a smirk, and we felt that we were troubling him with the few quick questions we had. Breakfast was okay. No eggs were included, as they were at the other hotels during our trip. The same choice of food was offered every day. The marble cake and some sort of tart did not seem as fresh as they could have been. They offered a nice variety of yogurt flavors, including lemon and coconut. The breakfast room was pretty. The rooftop garden was beautiful and our favorite part of the hotel. You can order drinks there in the evening and they offer a few complimentary hors d'oeuvres. The hotel was located out of the way, yet it was still pretty easy to get to the sights because there is a tram stop directly across the street. A lot of the sights you then have to transfer to a bus, but the hotel was helpful in giving directions and sold tickets for the tram, bus and metro at the front desk. It is close to the great restaurants in the Trastevere neighborhood. After dinner, it was nice to be close to the hotel. If they replaced the shower with just a standard stall and remodeled the room so it didn't give a dirty first impression, this review would have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Friendlyness of the staff”
Reviews.Author: ulrich
Reviews.Content: very very clean, tasteful and expensive decorated, due to tramstation in front of the entrance quick transfer(5 min.) to the city center, quiet because of silentproved windows, all 3 receptionist, we have seen, were very polite and helpful, thank you

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in Rome and lovely accom too”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in Trastevere area. I could jog down to Lungotrastervere every morning. Good shops and a great restaurant nearbyt and up the hill and a good hike is American university of Rome. The staff made me feel welcome, helped so much with supporting me given delayed airline delivery of my one bag needed for business, and was always willing to answer questions with a smile and SINCERITY. Best place I've stayed in Rome and italy and even other European, Asian and South American stays.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trilussa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Trilussa Palace was a great hotel, away from the center of Rome in a residential nieghborhood. The room itself was clean, very clean! Tempurpedic bed was stellar, every night was a great night's sleep. The turkish bath was a treat, albeit a little small for my husband (he's 6'2). The staff was very helpful, and the tram that stops across the street was easy to get around with. It took about 20 - 30 minutes to get to Vatican, Spanish Steps and other attractions and it was safer than their subway. Even though this hotel is not in the center of Rome, the local neighborhood is great - fantastic restaurants every night, gelato, supermarket, drug store and shops about a 1/2 mile walk, but you walk everywhere in Europe anyway. Rooftop terrace was a gem. We didn't try the breakfast, it was easier to pick something up wherever we were going. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: louis1
Reviews.Content: Very clean and well run hotel only 3/4 mile from the trastevere district, not difficlult walk on same side of the road. Found the staff extremely friendly and helpful, beds are superb being tempurpedic!. Agree with other review, the shower reminds me of woody allen in the sleeper!. noted other reviews, one has to remember this is not a 5* hotel but a small and intimate 3* so ... The breakfast was a little dissapointing, coffee was cold each morning and a larger continental with some eggs would be good. However, on the whole quiet, very clean, good location, very modern ,TV, internet etc so very pleased to stay there again.The roof terrace is a must, not busy, to sit and watch the stars with a wine was just bliss.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but by no means perfect”
Reviews.Author: NickCah
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Trilussa Palace June 2006. Paid about £200 a night for a Junior Suite, which included breakfast and an hour in the spa. For this amount of money, I expected an awful lot which the hotel didn't quite deliver. First the good points: Location: Near to excellent, good price restaurants (30 euros for two, four courses, wine, wate & coffee). Near to tram stop and bus routes, excellent to get anywhere. Not too bad to get to Vatican (get there early, before 9, unless you want to queue 4 hours, Pegasus tours, who do Colliseum Tours too, were excellent). Nice and quiet. Sunday flea market across road. Staff: Always helpful, could recommend areas to go to eat and how to get around city. (Didn't know much about how to get to Ciampino however). Spa: Excellent, relaxing, worth the money if you had to pay extra, should be 40 euro per hour for two people if I remember correctly (but see below). Below average (not bad, just not up to expectations): Breakfast: Cheap fruit juice, little choice one day, more choice the next (but stlll not much, felt very budget). Said that they would do drinks other than coffee, but this was never offered. Spa: Booked spa 24 hours in advance, wasn't ready at booked time, Never managed to get Sauna hot in the hour that we had. Shower in spa wasn't warm enough to use. Nice to have the spa to yourself. Rooftop Bar: Said it was open from 5 weather permitting. Went up, but was told it was closed because it was too cold, didn't feel cold to me...but I guess I am from the UK! Shower: Looked good, but electronic controls/radio did not work, so several of the settings weren't much use. Also, turned shower to highest temperature and still was only just warm enough. Shampoo not replaced after first night. Room: Slightly worn in areas (curtain tie-back broken), no instructions with TV, or whether any of the services (internet on TV etc.) were chargeable or not. The Trilussa Palace was good overall and I have no comparison with any other Roman hotels, but I am not sure at the price I paid, that it was value for money. If you can get it cheaper then maybe it should be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: boston16
Reviews.Content: the room rate does not include the breakfast, which was just awful. Always ran out of coffee.. stale bread and no eggs or anything.. they make you pay extra for this! Also the cleaning of our room left allot to be desired. We did not have soap at all and about 5 shampoo containers. The shower was broken - we think- we could not figure it out. We asked if we could use the sauna's but not get a massage.. was going to charge us 50 euros each!!! that was insulting considering what we paid for the room. Also the location was close to the bus stops but not the best location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An elegant and extremely comfortable hotel, conveniently situated close to the centre of Rome. All staff were professional, obliging and very happy to help. Our room was superior with a balcony and a modern, clever shower. Definitely highly recommemnded and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler1717
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to get to from the airport. Just a train ride and 2 stops on the tram and you are there. The elevator wasn't working at the train station so it made getting the bags up and down the stairs a challenge. We upgraded to a Superior Double here, so the room was spacious. Bathroom was ok. Shower a little small, especially if you wanted to stand. It is one with a seat. The bed was very comfortable and the air worked very well! Front desk help was great. Told us how to get around. This area was fine for going out. Lots of choices for dinner, etc. Lots of graffiti ruined it for me. Seemed dirty, even though it wasn't. Please go to L' Orange wine bar and restaurant just down from the hotel. Have the salad and meat and cheese plate! Fabulous. We thought we would enjoy staying near Trevi fountain next time. Nicer area. Do yourself a favor and buy a bus, tram and metro map. It was needed! Rome now has a pass that includes museum visits and transportation. Check out that for visiting the city. Otherwise, buy the daily pass for 4 Euros and take all the public trans you want! We went to the Vatican one day and stood in line at St. Peter's when approached by a tour group. They asked if we wanted a tour of the museaum, Chapel and St. Peter's. Wonderful tour with a great guide. ICON tours I believe was the name. Check them out!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a bit difficult to find.”
Reviews.Author: jimdago
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed three nights in early May. Hotel was difficult to find, even for our driver from the airport, so get directions before you arrive. I had a 3rd floor balcony room overlooking the street. Quite noisy, although the room is well sound-proofed, but forget about getting fresh air due to the heavy traffic. Temperpedic bed was just as described by others -- very comfortable. The shower reminded me of the orgasmatron in Sleeper. Don't be intimidated by it -- you'll really enjoy it. The only convenient way to get around is by the trolley that stops across the street. Walking gets tedious from this location, but perhaps I'm just getting old. On Sunday morning, a pretty large flea market sets up across the street, too. Can recommend, but not strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Easter Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Maverick69Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this delightful hotel following a number of recommendations from this site. I must say we chose well. The hotel is a gem. Immaculate rooms, very clean with everything you would want. The breakfast was very good with pleasent attentive staff, what you would expect for a cold buffet breakfast. From the staff, Emiliano was fantastic, nothing was too much. We planned our days through him, he knew his buses, trams and where most things were, you simply could not get lost with his advice. The trestavere area is disappointing with the amount of graffiti that is around, but if you ignore that there are some lovely restaurants down the back streets. We had a delightful meal at a restaurant near to the church. Rome itself is minutes away with all the main areas in easy reach. We'll definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!---Great Employees!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel-stayed 5 nights. First time out of the United States. The breakfast is great. The employees were always willing to help us--even though we spoke almost no Italian. Emiliano at the front desk was always willing to help us in English with a great smile. Will stay here on next visit--Thank You

Reviews.Title: “excellent Trilussa Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anne1709
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay, friendly staff. The hotel is not far (about 1km) from the center of Trastevere, where you can spend not only one nice evening (in fact we were there every night) with excellent restaurants of all categories. If you do not like to walk, there is a tram leaving just in front of the hotel, which takes you not only to Trastevere but also inside the city on the other side of the Tiber. What we really did not know from the description of the hotel was the fact, that it is very expensive to use the nice wellness-center of the hotel (40 Euro per hour). But everything else was so nice that we will stay in the same hotel again when we will visit Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for an extended wkend in Rome as a surprise for my boyfriend's birthday. If you are looking for a friendly, clean and comfortable hotel then the Trilussa is a perfect option - there are definitely grander 4 star options but the hospitality and extras at the Trilussa (such as the private use sauna and turkish bath room and wonderful roof garden) far outweigh the slightly lackluster outside façade and lobby area. Location: The hotel is 5 to 10 minutes walk from the central Trastevere area but in our opinion this was perfect (I think to be in the central restaurant area would be pretty noisy). The walk is really pleasant in the evening. Everywhere is so accessible in Rome and with the frequent trams the location is not a problem and we loved walking everywhere anyway. I definitely recommend walking and taking time to soak in the scenery in Rome as much as possible as this is the most wonderful thing about the city. We will really miss sitting outside and watching the world go by! Having walked all over Rome this area would still be my choice of where to stay. The roof garden is such a treasure of this hotel - it’s such a peaceful place to go to after you come back from an evening out. You can look out at local life and Italians sitting out on their balconies enjoying a glass of wine. Rooms: We had a standard double room. The normal size for one of these at the hotel is about 14 sq metre which in my opinion is far too small (we have stayed in many small European rooms but that’s too small) - particularly if you are paying the full price like we were and I don't think for us this would have been acceptable and our overall rating may have gone down a notch. However, I voiced my concern to Eduardo at the hotel a couple of weeks ago and he went out of his way to find us a slightly larger standard room (about 20 sq metre) and so this was fine. I don't think this can be guaranteed but the staff's willingness to go out of their way to make your stay a good one is quite rare. The room was also nicely decorated and very clean and the bathroom was big. Hospitality: The staff were all so friendly and helpful. The lady at breakfast was incredibly welcoming, the staff at reception always willing to help and the bellboy saw us having a nosy round the sauna area on the first day and gave us a lovely enthusiastic, un-salesy tour which persuaded us to book the sauna and turkish bath for an hour in the early evening of our second day - highly recommended, its better than most five star hotels. (I know some don't agree with using saunas etc when in cities like Rome but after lots of walking its so nice to refresh yourselves for the evening and also, you come away with your partner or family to relax and spend time together as well as see the sights). Food: A simple, continental breakfast was 5 euros which we thought was fine. Tips for eating in Trastevere - look out for where the Italians are queuing and go down the side streets away from the squares, also look for restaurants which have fire burning ovens for making their pizzas (everywhere sells the same type of foods but the quality varies enormously). Two wonderful restaurants recommended by locals are: Alle Fratte di Trastevere (on Via di Trastevere, for great oven baked pizzas) and La Tana di Noantri (on Via de Paglia, really good fish and Sardinian dishes). If you are someone for whom the height of luxury is very important - there are other 4 or 5 star hotels in the centre which may be more to your taste. But for a hotel which has charm, great service, has pleasant, clean and attractive rooms and a few lovely added extra facilities this is a great option. It’s for these reasons that this is the highest rating I've given for a hotel! Naomi, England

Reviews.Title: “After the staff warmed up a little, I loved Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: EverJulia
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived I thought the staff was a bit standoffish, but after a night's stay, they were very warm and helpful. Andre was great, he really helped me out with my converter/plug issues! I thought the hotel restaurant was delicious (they had butter!). I liked the location, right on the bus line. Restaurants abound but you must look off the main road (Trastevere). The room was always clean and I really liked it. One must remember that hotel rooms are typically smaller in Europe. Loved the high-tech shower as well. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Trilussa Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: lplunkett
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel, rooms were very clean. Loved the shower even though it took me a few minutes to figure out. Front desk was very helpful. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Trilussa Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome from the staff who were very helpful during our stay. The hotel was very clean although our room was a bit small. TV, safe, excellent shower and cupboard space but no drawers for clothes! Food very good although the restaurant was not open for dinner during the week of our stay. A small but splendid health centre is in the hotel - sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, gym. Good location as it was in the Trastevere district where there are numerous excellent restaurants and transport facilities (tram, bus) nearby. I would recommend the hotel as a base for seeing Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As part of my duties in planning for the after=cruise portion of our Mediterranean Voyage, I was challenged to find a decent hotel, but not too pricy. This is not an easy task, especially when you are relying on the information gathered off of the internet. I must have looked at over 100 sites, reading the reviews, assessing their location in the city, and of course, the nightly rates. I was very surprised when I read the reviews for the Trilussa Palace. Most everyone that took the time to render a rating, gave it high marks for all the above categories I was usiing to make my decision. I contacted the hotel management and corresponded with Mr. Eduardo Caroni, who was most responsive and helpful in so many ways. He arranged for our transport from our ship to the hotel and then from the hotel to the airport. He was most helpful in suggesting area restaurants and helped in our plans of touring the famous sites in Rome. Mr. Caroni and all the staff at the hotel were very friendly and accomodating. Their quaint restuarant was excellent for starting the day off on a positive note. The rooms were very clean and thank goodness, air conditioned. The bathrooms are a bit small in comparison to the States, but they were sparklingly clean and had the most beautifu marble on the floors and walls. A Great Bargain and a Real Treat for that home away from home!! G. E. Forney Wellington, Florida
