Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulou1580
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend came back from Rome just yesterday morning and we would definitely go back without a doubt. The Trilussa Palace hotel was just what we needed. It was extremely peaceful and quiet - away from the main hustle and bustle of the city but within easy reach of the main sights via tram/bus or foot (no. 8 tram gets you to near to the pantheon, no. 3 bus goes to the colosseum, H to the Termini station and 62 or 64 to the Vatican). The room was clean and fairly modern in design and although it was not spacious, it has all you need for a city break. The bathroom was all marble with a very luxiourious shower and the staff were very helpful. As per other reviews we did think that the extra charges were a bit excessive, in particular the spa - 40 Euros each for 1 hr - therefore we did not use these services. In brief, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kss22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location away from the very busy downtown Rome. The TRAM is only 50 feet from the hotel and a cab (if you have the stomach) is always right around the corner. It was very clean and the staff was extremely nice. I do however agree that it is ridiculous that they charge for everything though. We were charged 7 euros to have a pair of pants and a shirt to be ironed. All in all we were pleased with the hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mom2004
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel, however,,,, every item is a la carte! I can't believe they charge extra for internet service. We got it for free at our hotel in Florence (and that hotel was HALF the price of this one). The area is great though, it is away from the hustle and bustle of the city itself. I do agree while it lists Trastevere location, it is a bit of a hike to the restaurant area, but every thing is a bit of a hike, so who cares at that point. The restaurants in this area were wondeful! We did think the hotel staff was extremely helpful. There is a tram that stops right across the street that takes you right into the tourist areas for only 1 euro each way. That is a great value, though we walked everywhere the majority of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return...”
Reviews.Author: mferlisi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trilussa in February of 2006 and found that the service from beginning to end was definitely above average, very personalized. The location is just far enough from the city center to avoid confusion, but just close enough to enjoy the beauty of the city. It is well connected with the public transportation and the personnel at the front desk were extremely helpful with directions and suggestions. The restaurant offers a good selection and excellent quality. The room was very comfortable, cozy and clean! The best part was after a tiring day of sight seeing...relaxing in the spa! The sauna and turkish bath was the perfect end to a perfect weekend! I would definitely choose this hotel again the next time I am Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff makes the Trilussa a treat”
Reviews.Author: FrekwentTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Trilussa Palace after reading the very positive reviews here, booking the hotel and flight via Travelocity. The hotel location is a little out of the way from the main city sites, as it is across the Tiber. However, the tram line stops right in front of the hotel and is a very efficient way to get into the heart of the city. (One comment- there is no need to waste time buying tram tickets- think of the tram as a free service because the Romans certainly do!) The immediate area around the hotel is not particularly attractive, but the Trastevere area close to the Tiber is very interesting and worth the walk. There is a major outdoor market on Saturday mornings that starts across the street from the Trilussa and seems to extend forever, or at least further than I cared to stroll through it. Very interesting to see ordinary Romans shopping. The hotel itself is modern, and the decoration is attractive although a little sparse. The breakfast room is OK, but I wouldn't recommend having dinner at the hotel with the thousands of other more interesting choices just a short walk or tram ride away. My room was small, but well equipped, and the steam shower in the bathroom was a first for me. I think the Trilussa is rated a 3 star, and I would say that is about right in terms of facilities. The best thing about the hotel, in my opinion, is the quality of the staff, particularly the 2 men who work the front desk. They were always helpful and patient, and made the experience really enjoyable. They arranged a very good guided tour for me, recommended good restaurants instead of the usual tourist places one is steered to, helped me understand the public transport system, and several other things, always in a friendly and respectful manner. As one who has experienced his share of arrogant and unhelpful "service" workers in Italy, it was very much appreciated. I would recommend the Trilussa to anyone looking for a clean, friendly hotel in the heart of Trastevere

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is nice, I don't think it deserves the high ratings it receives on this site: 1. As far as I am concerned, this hotel is NOT in Trestevere. Its a good ten to fifteen minute walk from the heart of Trestevere. My wife and I are from NYC, so we like to walk, but at night, the walk back to the hotel was so far and so quiet, that it was a buzz kill. 2. The hotel has a restaurant, spa and gym. However, breakfast costs an extra 10 euro per person. Also, if you are in Rome to see the sites, why would you bother with a spa or gym visit? 3. The rooms and bathrooms seem to be brand new and state of the art (check out the high end shower-massage), but the hotel has all the charm of a Best Western. Am I in Rome or Kansas? You wouldn't know it until you stepped outside. Also, there is nowhere to unpack your clothes other than a small closet. Don't get me wrong. The staff is very helpful and the hotel is very nice, but at over 200 euro per night, I thought it was not a good value considering the above issues. For a business traveler, this place might be perfect, but for a vacationer looking for a charming hotel in the heart of Trestevere, you probably want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us stayed at the Trilussa in April during Holy Week. It was a great find. Clean, well-kept and really convenient to all the places we wanted to visit. It's located in Trastevere which in itself was a delightful area to explore. I agree with other reviewers-- the front desk staff, while courteous and helpful-- really did NOT project much warmth. But that's the only negative. I highly recommend the Trilussa.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Modern Amenities & Good Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the rear of the building, nice and quiet. One for the 3 kids and ours. The tram was right out front and the front desk people were very helpful. We arrived Sat before Easter and Monday was a holiday too. After we spent most of our cash in the Sunday market (out front - a must go), the front desk person used the internet and called to confirm that a local money exchange was open during holiday. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom with hydramassage shower was great (note marble is slippery when wet !). Most people working at the hotel spoke English. Breakfast was good and there are some good nearby restaurants and shops. Try dinner at La Face and ask for Fabrizio - real nice waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SteveDLasVegas_NV
Reviews.Content: Followed fellow tripadvisor reviews on this hotel and was not too happy. The hotel had good tram access but was away from the downtowwn attractions and was in a residential area. Room was so small two people could barely navigate around without bumping into one another. We are experienced European traveleres and are used to small rooms but the room and bathroom shower was a bit of a joke. Staff was not overly friendly or helpful. No internet access without paying. Would try another hotel in the incredible city of Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ruben-Anthony
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the best area of Rome. Just outside of the center of Rome, it avoids the "touristy" noise, yet keeps you within minutes of the action. The tram stops right in front of the hotel. The staff is great and always willing to assist you with whatever you need. The rooms are the biggest I've seen in Europe, and the beds are memory foam which means they are sooo comfortable. Bathrooms a good size as well. The bathroom also has an electrical converter socket as well. Oh and the Trastevere is the best place for real Italian food, this is where the italians go for dinner. Loved it, and we miss it big time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Hotel located in the Trastevere section of Rome in January for two weeks. This hotel is small, but the staff is absolutely wonderful. The desk staff arranged early breakfasts for us when we needed to leave early and was knowledgable about how to get anywhere in Rome. Breakfast was included and after the first morning, our cappucini and table were always waiting for us. A neighborhood restaurant, Mopi's, is excellent--reasonably priced and the owner is always there to greet you. A short trip on Tram 9 takes you to the Ancient City. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Trilussa really is a palace...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms were beautiful, and the breakfast buffet was great. While the hotel is not centrally located to famous Rome sites, the metro is just across the street along with the bus line. Also, we simply walked to most sites. Great restaurants nearby with good prices. Most, importantly, the hotel staff was very helpful and courteous; especially Andrea and Roberta. They helped us plan a day trip to Florence as well as Astia Otiga (sp?).

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Trilussa palace is excellent hotel..this hotel offers a stay worthy from king!! rooms are confotable:there are big beds and all you need to confort; you can use internet too..when I was in rome I spent there my best holiday days..inside the hotel there is a fitness center where you can made massages too, hydromassage pool and the turkish bath, there is the sauna, ...it is a mix to relax!the staff is very qualified, they know a lot of languages and they can solve you every problem.. it is worth of it! it needs to live to believe to it. Go there you will be surprise. thank you trilussa palace. you are very excellent

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. The spa is one of the best things about it and it is only 30 euros for an hour to relax to yourself. the beds were comfortable and the shower, awsome. We had the suite but it was still a bit small, but i hear that that is the way hotels are in rome. The hotel was not in the best part of rome, although it was only 10 minutes from the collesuem, walking distance, and there was a bus right outside, the neighborhood was bad. A lot of grafety. They say the food in this area is the most authentic and the best. St, maria in trastevere was one of the most beautiful churches and only 5 minutes away. Although the bus was right outside we seldom rode it because it was risky and crowded and you had to keep your hand on your wallet. Watch out! The hotel told us our bus tickets were good all day but they are actually only good for 75 mintues and we got a fine for 100 euros! Go to L'original Alfredo's , it's a great resturant! Taxi's are scary, they dont drive in lanes and do not obey the speed limit. They try to rip you off too, sometimes. the hotel staff was semi-friendly, but a little rude at times too. I would not stay here again because of the location, and the staff. I would stay at something i know, like the Hilton, or sheraton. We also took a tour to Florance, with carrani tours, it was a lot of fun and worth the money, i recommend it, but everything else in rome is within walking distance so i recommend going on your own so your can spend as much time there are you want.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Get Away”
Reviews.Author: dawn2241
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short break to Rome. We stayed at the Trilussa Palace Hotel which is fabulous. The facilities are excellent, staff friendly and location ideal. You must book yourself into the spa (which you book just for yourselves) as this gave our break a relaxing start, ready to tread the streets of Rome. The hotel has a roof garden with spectacular views over the city. Rooms, although not large, are exquisite. The bathrooms have fantastic showers which incorporate a turkish bath and multi spray shower. Although not right in the centre of the city, the public transport is excellent with a regular tram service just outside the hotel. We have had a wonderful stay in Rome made all the better by this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AntoinetteA
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Trilussa. If you take a taxi from the Termini train station, be aware that you should spend between 16 and 20 euros for the ride -- I was charged 46 euros by a crooked taxi driver. The room was well appointed and clean. The staff were very helpful. I booked a couple of tours through the hotel and agree that it's more efficient to schedule them, especially, if you don't have a lot of time. However, if you prefer to sight see on your own, Ancient Rome is only a tram ride away. The hotel is in a relatively quiet area, which is nice, because there were crowds of people everywhere. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I miss the bed at Trilussa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The staff was extreamly helpful, and very curteous and nice. They all spoke very good english which not always the case in Italy. The room was very nicely decorated, and the floors are beautiful dark wood floors. The best thing about this place was the bed!!!! I have never been so comfortable, and woken up w/o any little kinks somewhere, but in this bed I did. In fact I am trying to find out which brand it is, so I can purchase one for my home. Breakfeast is continental, ie there is a small selection of breads, jams, yogurts, cereal, coffee etc. The is cooked food to order for an extra charge which we never did. The included breakfeast was sufficient and the coffee was very tasty. There is a baby high chair, so our smallest girl could actually sit and eat with us. Trastevere has many good restaurants (we recommend Pizzeria IVO) plus a nightlife, just 10-15 walk awyay (or 2 stops on the tram). The tram runs just outside and takes you to Argentina from where you can walk to many sights: Piazza Navona, Fontana di Trevi etc.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in April. Really good mid priced hotel located a 5 min tram ride from the centre. This is no inconvenience, travel on the tram is cheap clean and safe and the stop is right outside the door. We dined in the Trastevere region, dining is considerably less pricey than in central Rome and very good. Took a junior suite, room was spotless, linen change daily, quiet rooms that are well decorated. Shower is a bit small but didnt spoil our stay. Breakfast was good by continental standards, staff v friendly. Roof top garden is a blissful escape. We booked the spa which was a nice treat and again very clean. A great base to see Rome and experience the real thing. There is a Flea market across the road on Sunday mornings, its huge and worth a visit. We plan to use this hotel as our base for future trips to Rome, would recommend it to anyone planning to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaineo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really really lovely. The beds are great - so comfortable, the showers are great (ok a bit small but we're not very large so they suited us fine), the spa is great, the staff are great, the location is great, just about everything is great!!! Would definitely stay here if travelling to Rome again and wouldn't hesitate in recommending it to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Spent Honeymoon Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Alright, here is the real deal about this hotel. I will give you the good and the bed. My wife and I arrived at the airport and caught a taxi to the hotel. (A little heads up, the taxi driver's definitely will scare you during the drive). The hotel was very nice and clean. As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel staff was very friendly and spoke pretty good English. They told us where to go, how to get there and everything else. I was not able to see the balcony, but the jacuzzi and the cardio area were nice. It was definitely in a good location, and it is very safe to take walks on the street, even at 2 am. Now, there was one bad thing about the room-The shower. Yes, it had a lot of shower heads and all that stuff, but it was VERY VERY SMALL. If your a big guy (Over 6'2" 200 lbs), and you drop the soap, you will not be able to pick it up. Also, the shower is not big enough for two people. There was also safe in the room. As far as Rome, my advice is to definitely pay for the guided tours. They are worth it, and make the tourist attractions a lot more enjoyable if you know whats going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa Palace from 17-20 March. The staff were very friendly and helpful giving out maps and noting places of interest. The rooms very clean and the beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. The shower was excellent, just what you needed after a hard days sightseeing. The mini bar was well stocked and reasonable. The roof garden was very nice with good views. Breakfast could have been better but still ok. The hotel was in a good location with the tram stop directly across the road to take you into the centre of Rome in about 5 minutes. We bought a 3 day ticket from the Tabbachi shop next door, it cost 11 euros each and can be used on the buses and trams. There were lots of good restaurants and bars in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6-day stay at the Trilussa Palace hotel from March 5-11, 2006. After landing at Fiumuncio Airport, my wife and I took a train to Trestavere Station (costing 5 euros each) which took about 20 minutes. From there, we took a short 4-block tram ride (costing 1 euro each) that dropped us off in front of the Trilussa Palace hotel. We were immediately impressed by this 4-star hotel. The hotel was in mint condition and incredibly clean, the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, and our room and bathroom were more than we could ask. Our standard room had hardwood floors and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom floor and wall was marble, and the shower had 2 shower heads. Also, the continental breakfast was excellent and the wait staff very accommodating. What made our stay at the Trilussa Palace even more enjoyable was that it was on Trastavere street, which is a major street that goes straight through the heart of Rome. The hotel staff gave us a map of Rome on which contained the major tourist stops. The staff also was very helpful in informing us of which buses or trams to take if we wanted to go to, for example, the Colloseum or the Vatican or the catecombs, and the staff sold the tickets (costing only 1 euro). I could go on about this excellent hotel, but rest assured that if you choose to stay here while in Rome, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ssy
Reviews.Content: Visited Trilussa Palace Hotel on 10th Feb for 5 nights. Did book a deluxe room and had been warned that Italian hotel rooms are small. It was adequate but bathroom would have driven us stir crazy by the end of the stay so opted to upgrade to a juinor suite which was lovely. If you can afford the upgrade, couldn't reccommend it any more. The shower was fantastic and great after a day's walk around Rome. Staff were very friendly and informative. Breakfast was fine. The hotel was situated just opposite Rome's Sunday flea market and ten minutes walk from the restaurant district of Travestere. It was nice to be outside of the centre in the evening although it was only a short hop on the tram to get in the centre. The tram line was right outside the hotel so we found getting around very easy. Loved Rome, hotel was great and wouldn't hesitate booking there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just the best hotel in Roma!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned a couple of weeks ago from a 7 day trip to Roma and is imposible to stop thinking about the great time me and my friend had in Roma and the Trilussa Palace hotel...!!!!! It was my second time at this hotel, and even though i knew it was fantastic(reason why i came back to the same hotel), this time, i enjoyed it even more than the first one. My friend was really excited about our tryp to Roma because i couldn´t stop taking about the hotel and the city after my first visit....She got really surprised when we arrived at the hotel, she couldn´t believe how beautiful everything was, from the reception to the fantastic room we had. The hotel is newly done, and there is marble everywhere you look, what makes it look really posh. The lobby bar is very confy and the staff there is so friendly, you don´t feel like going anywhere for your evening drink. The rooms are just perfect, with great beds and a fantastic shower. You feel new after coming out of it...... If you want to see a great sight, go to the roof top and enjoy the views of the city at night, it´s amazing...!!!! During the week we spent at the Trilussa Palace, everyone treated us so nicely, we found it really hard to leave. We would like to thank everyone, from the lady at the breakfast-room (Viola), ever so nice giving you a very warm smile to start your day and making the best capuccinos we´ve tasted, to the staff at the reception, without forgetting the cleaning ladys that kept the place immaculate. We have to give special thanks to the reception staff, Gianmarco, Andrea and Edoardo, for being so helpful and patient with us, helping us with all we needed; they definitely made our stay perfect.... Since everyone gives tips about how to get around, i will skip that part, i can only agree. So, if you are planning a trip to Roma, and you don´t know where to stay, stop looking, the Trilussa Palace is the best choice you could make, and you won´t regret it....I will definitely come back, soon i hope.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Trilussa for the last leg of our short Italy vacation. We were there for 3 days but it was worth it. The room was very comfortable (the bed was terrific, we slept like babies - tempurpedic mattresses)however we did have a small problem with the heat during the day. It was winter time and there was a chill in the air, but at night, it was fine. The location of the hotel was perfect, far enough away from all the noises of the main part of the city, yet close enough for a short tram ride to Argentina and then right in the middle of most everything. To get onto a bus to get anywhere was quite easy. There are bus stops everywhere and every stop is listed right under the bus number. The breakfast was very good, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. If you want, there is a gym downstairs, but with all the walking you do during the day to see all the amazing sights, who has the strength to go to the gym? But it is there for the offering. If you want dinner in the hotel restaurant you can, however, it is a bit pricey. So many other restaurants around, either on the block or in town. If you are there for a day or more, your best bet is to go to the Tabacchi shop a few doors down and purchase a 1-3 day pass for the tram and bus. The first time you use the pass, remember to put it thru the ticket machine on the tram or bus in order to validate it and then you just can get on and off the tram or bus as often as needed. I would stay at this hotel again. It was very comfortable and very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reetz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome and our vacation was fabulous. We loved the Trilussa Palace Hotel and its location. The staff was most helpful and made phone calls to various places at no charge. The weather was rainy most days but the temperature was mild compared to Massachusetts. The public transportation was very reasonable and convenient. The area of Trastevere was perfect for us and the food was moderately priced and wonderful. The food at the hotel was very good but more expensive than the local resturants. A week wasn't enough and we definitely want to return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in January, just a short walk (or tram ride) from Trastevere train station (easy to get to from the airport). The tram stop is right in front of the hotel, and takes you to Argentina which is close to many of the major Rome sights. Restaurants in Trastevere can't be beat. Just take the tram up the street a few stops, get out right before the Tiber River, and wander around in the back alleys and streets. You'll find numerous restaurants, you can't go wrong. Great food and a non-touristy atmosphere....the grafitti seems to blend in with the buildings after a while and become part of the atmosphere. We had a room in the rear of the hotel, and it was beautifully quiet. The beds are very comfortable. The staff was tremendous, anticipated our needs and accomodated us with special requests (we wanted to watch the NFL playoffs at 2am, they arranged to have the tv in the bar carry the game for us). The breakfasts are great, lots to choose from, and our hostess (I'm sorry, I don't remember her name) always greeted us with a very warm smile. The front desk staff arranged a tour to Pompeii for us, and a car to take us back to the airport, which was a huge help since we were leaving so early in the morning. The bartender (again, don't remember his name) was great, having us try different drinks and always being there with a great smile and great attitude. I think the more nights we stayed there, the more it felt like home. We liked the flea market that happens across the street on Sunday, we liked watching the clean-up after the flea market that much more. Was quite a sight! The hotel is very clean, the housekeeping staff does a great job. Rooms are a bit small by American standards, but by European standards they are superb. Loved the shower! All in all, the best small boutique hotel I've stayed at in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Trilussa palace hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: February 16th 2006 Just returned from Trilussa Palace,very comfortable,loved the facilities available including the spa/gym particularly grateful for the exceptional comfortable beds after a hard day walking round the treasures of Rome -Particular thanks to the wonderful friendly staff who all contributed to a fantastic break,will certainly recommend this hotel to friends. Trip Advisor User Edinburgh, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in every sense of the word. Very friendly and helpful front desk staff who speak very good English, Ideal distance from city centre (not too close but not too far), rooms are very clean and spacious with lovely bathrooms. We satayed at this hotel on our first ever trip to Rome and couldn't have picked a better place. 5/5

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hotpants3
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel front desk staff extremely helpful who spoke excellent English. Rooms clean and roomy, showers to die for. After walking around Rome the shower was a delight to come back to. Great location with tram service seconds away from the hotel. If you didn't care to walk. Only one fault as I have stayed in numerous other 4 star hotels all over Europe the breakfast was not the greatest as already mentioned by other reviews. But its enough to keep you going. (If your not a big breakfast person). Staff in the breakfast room could improve as it took them a time to replace foods that had run out, When asked for hot water for tea they were very slow to respond, So maybe for a 4 star they could brush up in that department. Booked the Jacuzzi, steam/sauna package was very clean well taken care of just lovely all round. All in all a great little gem of a place. Will certainly recommend this hotel without hesitation. Well done Trilussa Palace for our wonderful stay. Just a word of warning look out for pick pockets in Rome as a member of our party had a camera stolen on her on our last day there!!...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellin' More
Reviews.Content: Staff was most friendly; location was great. No complaints except the rooms could be brighter. I would stay here again any time. Breakfast was served early and by good staff. We were delighted with the hotel and its location.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Complete”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was so nice to stay in a new clean and well managed hotel. The hotel is a 10 min tram ride from the centre of Rome or else you can walk as we often did, it took about 25 min at an easy pace. We were pleasently surprised at how eaasy it was to from the hotel to the airport.(Tram 2 stops and short walk and 20min train to airport). Beds were comfortable, clean rooms and a funky radio in the shower. Did not get time to use the spa which you can rent per hour for yourself. Very helpful staff and good food. Although there are many restaurants close by in Santa Maria Majore etc... We will be Back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Trilussa for our first visit to Rome, the hotel was excellent, the rooms small depsite ours being a deluxe, but that didn't spoil it - the beds were so so comfortable!! The staff were excellent, even at midnight - on our arrival we were fully advised and equipped with a map of all the spots to see! The Hotel spa 30.00 euro for 1 hour sole use was fantasic, so relaxing! The local transport was also excellent no. 8 tram was so regular you would never need to run to catch a bus/tram again - in fact the Uk needs to take note of the efficiency of this service - from some one who never ever rides public transport, if the UK had this system, I'd never take my car again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at hotel it was great! staff very friendly, breakfast was very good and is served between 6.30 -10.30 am. Room was lovely bed very comfy.Had the use of spa for our sole use 30 euro for 1 hour just what you need after all the sight seeing. you might be a little way out but it was no promblem as there is a tram no.8 which stops outside hotel and they run nearly every 5 minutes. Would stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: DuluthMich
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Trilussa. We stayed for 8 wonderful nights. The staff was very helpful and informative. Andrea, Gianmarco and Edwardo gave great advice about Rome. The tram was convenient. The hotel offered a car for transportation to and from the airport. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were clean. The hotel is close to the heart of Trastevere. We would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel pity about the food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to be greeted by a warm and friendly atmosphere, the staff were very helpful and the hotel was beautifully decorated. We ate at the hotel one evening out of our 3 night stay. The food was definitely below average, one of us ordered a filet steak - well done - when it arrived it was very rare and so we returned it and emphasised again very well done, again it arrived back very rare, so we gave up, but we weren't charged for the steak, there also wasn't much selection of evening meals, and the continental breakfast was average...Rome itself on first impressions seems dirty as it is covered in Graffitti...Imagine my disappointment when I arrived at this supposedly beautiful historical city covered in graffitti but once you see past that and into the ancient city centre you will find this is a beauitful and remarkable place to visit, and we will be returning in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful One Week Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Trilussa Palace is a wonderful place to stay as my new wife and I found out on our honeymoon. The hotel attendents are friendly, accomedating and very helpful. The hotel serves delicious dinner meals and the breakfast buffet is a great free bonus. In terms of its location in Rome, it has easy access to the Tram system that will take you to the center of Rome. Thanks for the great experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this fabulous hotel in January 2006. We were impressed by the dedication and friendliness of the hotel staff who tried their best to make our stay a memorable one. The location of this hotel is close to all of Rome's main sightseeing attractions. The room service was excellent and we would definitely make this hotel our choice when we return to Rome next year. Our special thanks to Mr. Andrea Mariani for all his help during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “very convient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thsi hotel is very well located from the airport and the centre of Rome being on good tram routes and within walking distance of trevestere, so easy to get home after a night out here. It has a good roof garden and a resonable breakfast. The rooms where clean but basic although the bathroom was very nice. The front desk service efficient but lacked a personal touch that made you feel welcome. A hotel that ticks the right boxes but never manages to make you feel welcome or at home. Would return as much as for how easy it makes the city as for any enthusiasm for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: smcg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Trilussa Palace. I'd stay there again. We booked a deluxe room through Expedia, I think it came to about £200 for 3 nights, breakfast included. Our room was big and well-decorated and the bed was comfortable. There was a little seat in the shower, which made it cramped, that would be my only complaint! The hotel was very clean and new, and the staff are friendly. The hotel is within walking distance to most of the sights and is about 10 minutes walk from the heart of Trastevere, which has a great atmosphere, good restaurants, etc. If you don't want to walk, the number 8 tram stops outside the hotel and is very frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights/4 days in this hotel. Overall a great hotel, good location (Porta Portese flea market is directly accross the road - a must go if you are there in a Sunday), easy to find and easy to get around Rome using the Trams (a stop which goes right into the centre is right outside) or just walking as we tended to do. The Spa is great after a day's wandering around the cobbles of Rome and it's nice that it can be booked for just you and yours. Staff were very friendly, pleasant and helpful - the small problems we did have in the room (one faulty light fitting and intermittent pay-per-view TV) were dealt with in good time and to our satisfaction. Rooms are fair sized well decorated and have very comfortable beds. The fancy shower is great and I am by no means a small bloke and found them sufficiently roomy to be able to reach all that needed reaching! Food was good - standard continental style breakfast and while the meal we had in the restaurant was good a short walk around the Trasteverre (especially just south of the river) gives you loads of fabulous, typically Roman places to eat at very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Trilussa Palace in Rome. First of all the location is in a convenient spot, quiet and very accessible to public transportation, yet close to local restaurants, shops and a supermarket. The hotel itself was extremely nice, well maintained with comfortable rooms and extremely clean!! Nice complimentary breakfast also. The staff was very friendly, polite, and courteous. All spoke good English. They were also very helpful with directions to historical sites in Rome. We would definitely stay in this hotel again as well as recommend it to any of our friends who plan to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, convenient, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome, staying at this 4 star hotel in Trastevere. It is located in a very handy spot with a tram stop outside which is only 5 minutes from the center of Rome. There was a good selection of local restaurants and the area was very safe indeed, and much quieter than central Rome. The hotel itself was plush with a well appointed room, reasonably priced restaurant and - most markedly - excellent service at all times from the staff who spoke fluent english. We can highly recommend this hotel and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Trilussa”
Reviews.Author: mayoman
Reviews.Content: Okay so here goes my first time writing a review, have just arrived back in Ireland from 4 days in breathtaking Rome, had the most fantastic time. Stayed in the Trilussa Palace Hotel in trastevere. I booked the hotel because of its location which was as good as I expected you just cross the road to your tram stop,Trastevere is a really lovely area and much cheaper to eat and drink in than the real touristy piazzas in the centre. We had beautiful meals in Ivo's which is a great pizzeria on San francesco also on the same street a fantastic Indian called Jaipur a lovely touch in the jaipur a welcome free glass of wine,I can also recommend highly Taverna Delia Sciala on Delia Sciala and finally a couple of doors from the Trilussa a wine bar called L'Orange beautiful food and wine. The Trilussa hotel Has some superb good points great location , a fantastic shower even as has previously been said its not the biggest shower but after a day of non stop sight seeing its something to look forward to, the room is'nt that big but spotlessly cleaned every day and everything changed bed clothes and towels, you have a room safe and the mini bar is really well priced, but I found it frustrating having no drawers in the room so storage is a slight problem, the roof top bar is closed but it has a great view so in the summer would be beautiful,also the movies on tv do'nt work,the brekfast could be alot better even for a continental one the staff were all very helpful especially Andrea who gave us a map and marked all the places we wanted to go and which buses to catch.So all in all we were pleased with the Trilussa and Rome is without a doubt the nicest city I have ever been in, word of warning I wasnt expecting it to be as cold, sunny but very cold so wrap up warm if you're going in the winter months, but we had no long queues for all the sights which made up for the cold ,looking forward to going back already

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: MelBBishopsStortford
Reviews.Content: My mother-in-law, niece and I stayed at the hotel for 3 days/2 nights in early January. We had never been to Rome before and the staff were incredibly helpful about how to get to different places. Our room was large and even with 3 twin beds in it, we were not on top of each other. It was especially nice to have a fridge and safe in the room at no extra charge. The massage setting on the shower was brilliant after a long day walking around the sights. Also, the flea market on a Sunday is literally across the road from the hotel - had a lovely time wandering around it. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again. The only slight downside is that the hotel is not in the centre of town, but even this isn't really a problem as easy transport to the centre is just across the road. If you prefer to walk, it's about 15-20 minutes to the centre.
